is your ordinary, average high school student who just wishes something exciting would happen for once. But when her parents sit her down and tell her that they will be getting divorced... so that they can swap partners with another couple they met on vacation... and then all move into one house and live as one happy family... well, she just wasn't expecting that one!
The Matsura's, the couple that the Koshikawa's met on vacation, also have a teenager, and a rather handsome one as 
 discovers. Still, 
 pleads for them not to go through with their plan, but when she sees how happy it makes her parents, she reluctantly concedes and gives her blessing.
One can only wonder what kind of mischief will assert itself throughout this series, not to mention various love triangles, I'm sure.

Malice@Doll is an android prostitute, but she's breaking down and in need of repair. Problem is, business has be down of late – as humanity has been long extinct. So rather than turning tricks, she strolls meaninglessly in the empty city, along with other machines that had lost their purpose. Then she is violated by a strange creature – and the experience turns her into a flesh-and-blood human! Even more incredible, Malice@Doll also has the ability to bestow life to the other machines from a simple kiss! Although it sounds good, she soon finds that her gift quickly becomes a curse to the other machines she lives with!

Tasuke Shichiri lives on his own because his parents are always traveling. One day his father sends him a strange ring he found in China. It is called the Shitenrin and it is said that when someone with a pure heart looks into the ring they can summon a great spirit of the moon who will protect them. This is just what happens to Tasuke.
That spirit is Shugogetten Shaorin, or Shoa for short. She has been in the ring for 4000 years, so she isn't really that familiar with the modern world. She causes more problem for Tasuke then she protects him.
The next day Tasuke gets a wand from his father. It is also from China, from the same location as the Shitenrin. Tasuke (accidentally) summons the goddess Keikounitten Ruuan. Her duty is to see her master happy.
Shao and Ruuan are long time rivals, which doesn't make it better for Tasuke. Shao can call Hoshigamis (literally "Star Gods") from the Shitenrin to help her, and Ruuan can, with the Keikounitten, bring inanimate objects to life.

Talk about one unlucky gal, Momoko just can't catch a break! First, her father dies and untimely death. Then, her mother literally works herself to death in order to pay for Momoko's tuition. And after her mother passes, Momoko no longer has any way to pay for her tuition, other than possibly selling her most treasured possession, the late mother's ring, a family heirloom. Surprisingly, a fellow student named Takaaki steps in at just the right time, and makes her an offer she can't refuse. He will pay for her tuition and all of her expenses if she agrees to be his live-in maid. So she can continue her schooling which her mother worked so hard to allow, she gets a free place to stay, she doesn't have to give up her ring, and all she has to do is a little housework. Yeah, right.

So just when Momoko thinks things are starting to look up, she discovers that her maid duties include more than just cleaning up... if you know what I mean (and if you've ever watched any 
 hentai, then I'm sure you do). So Momoko finds herself trapped into being a sex slave for the twisted Takaaki, catering to his every carnal desire. And if that wasn't bad enough, she also finds herself being accosted by a couple guys at school under the orders of a fellow female student named Lulu. The reason? Well, Lulu just happens to find herself in love with Takaaki, and is jealous that Momoko gets to spend so much time with him! Man, could things possibly get any worse little Miss Maid Momoko? Yes, yes they could.

But before things get worse for Momoko, they get worse for two other female students, Mana, the student body president whom Takaaki caught shoplifting, and Chika, a fellow student who requires financial assistance to help keep her parents' business afloat. The two lovely ladies just became the newest members of Takaaki's maid staff. Now Momoko must choose which one Takaaki will train first. And her decision is... the beautiful student body president, Mana. For her training, Takaaki decides to try out a little bondage... and to everyone's surprise, she likes it! Though I don't think anyone was more surprised that Mana herself. Chika's turn will have to wait until later that night, when Takaaki has trouble getting to sleep.

In the second volume, Takaaki tries his had at erotic asphyxiation, but is ultimately disappointed when Momoko looses consciousness too quickly. He then decides to hold a contest, whereby Momoko and Chika must pleasure each other, and whoever has an orgasm first loses their dinner for the night. As expected, the more experienced Momoko triumphs, and is treated to a reward... Takaaki-style. And just when you thought they wouldn't introduce any new characters for Takaaki to play with, in walks Lulu, who begs Takaaki to let her be one of his maids. Hey, the more the merrier! So I guess it makes sense that he would invite Momoko's best friend, Yurika, over for dinner.

When Yurika arrives at the door, Momoko is shocked to see her, and quickly tries to convince her to leave. But alas, we all know that doesn't happen. The next thing we know, Yurika is tied up by her arms while Chika goes to work on her. And as if seeing her best friend at the mercy of Takaaki wasn't enough, in comes Akiyoshi, another of Momoko's friends. He has always been kind and polite to her, treating her with respect, and saving her on occasion from Lulu's hoodlum's. Unfortunately for Akiyoshi, his parents are also in debt, and so in he's brought, by Lulu, to do whatever Takaaki wishes... and Takaaki wishes him to take Yurika, while Momoko watches. And so I say again, can't this girl catch a break?!

Ah, but then a strange thing happens. The next day at school, Lulu meets with Momoko to make her a proposition... stop being Takaaki's maid, leave his house, and her parents will pay for all of her tuition and expenses. Momoko is shocked to here this, but then tells her about the ring, the ring that Takaaki now has. So when Lulu assures Momoko that she can get the ring back, she is stunned by Momoko's silence. For it seems that somehow, in some way, Momoko has become fond of her current life, addicted to the pleasures that Takaaki provides her. It is a shocking realization, and one that Lulu absolutely does not want to hear. So if Momoko won't leave on her own free will, then Lulu's going to take matters into her own hands!

A 14 year old girl named 
 moves to the kingdom of Windbloom to become an Otome like her mother, which is a female virgin who protects a figure of royalty or importance. Along the way, she makes friends with the rude and arrogant Mashiro Blan de Windbloom, the princess of Windbloom, and helps her to become a great ruler of the kingdom of Windbloom.
My-Otome is the second season of 
, even though there are new main characters and no continuation or overlap of stories.

Fuuka Academy... on the surface, a prestigious learning institution, but unknown to most of the student body, it is a place where several young girls who have the power to summon weapons called elements have been gathered. Girls who can see a bright red star in the sky. Girls known as HiME.
Among these HiME, three in particular come to our attention... 
, who came to Fuuka Academy in search of her older brother, 
, who is aware of the true purpose of the HiME, and 
, who came with her younger brother Takumi, barely realizing that she herself is a HiME.

This series is about twelve so-called HiME's, which are girls that happen to be gifted with the power to materialize weapons of destruction from out of thin air. The main character, 
, is drawn involuntarily into a world where she has to fight monsters in order to survive, as well as protecting her baby brother. While 
 quickly ends up gaining the affection of two boys (one which she starts to date eventually) the first person that she actually "kisses" is in fact a girl.

Nina wants a boy who is cute, strong, and will protect her. But when she swallows the crystal pearl, a prop for the wizard exams, two wizards, Zero and Ichi, fall from the sky. Promising to protect her, Nina discovers that one of these two boys is the one she is looking for. But when other wizards come to take the exam, things get a little crazy.

Widow 
 has just become manager of a very interesting and very run-down apartment house, and this is where the fun begins. Welcome to the world of Maison Ikkoku, a romantic comedy from the creator of 
 and 
. The story is focused around the apartment house, its tenants (especially one) and its new manager. A delightful blend of strange happenings, a bit of slapstick, and a thorough interrelation of the characters topped off with some realistic angst makes it an altogether delightful series to watch.
As you would expect from Rumiko Takahashi, there is a troubled relationship. For Maison Ikkoku, the relationship is between 
 and college applicant (and Ikkoku-kan tenant) 
. And as you would expect, 
 has some problems, namely in the other tenants, who just can't seem to get off his case. And of course, there's that tennis coach who is also trying to woo 
.
The situations in Maison Ikkoku are more mature and much more realistic. The characters are older than those of Takahashi's other series, and the situations seen do not have as much slapstick. The story tends to focus on the relationships among the characters. For someone who has already seen 
 or 
, Maison Ikkoku will be a departure from the action-packed titles most associate with Rumiko Takahashi.

Does anyone have the right to a dirty mind? According to the former battle android-now-maid 
, the answer is an definite NO! But Suguru Misato and his friends beg to differ, so they concoct a plan to save Suguru's beloved dirty comics collection from 
's hands.
However, 
 has enlisted the help of HER friends  as well as the dirty-minded teacher Ms. Shikijo  to confiscate said collection. What happens is a madcap pursuit across Japan as the pure-hearted maid goes on her earnest crusade to save Suguru from himself.

After experiencing a bizarre dream, 
, a 14 year old girl, is shocked to find the same girl from her dream, named 
, enrolled to her school. But after school, 
 and her friend Sayaka encounter a magical creature named 
 (aka Incubator) who offers them a contract: To become a magical girl in fighting witches, evil entities that attack humans on certain occasions, in return for a wish. However, that's when 
 appears wanting to kill 
, and is determined in preventing 
 from becoming a magical girl.
Later, they meet an actual magical girl named Mami Tomoe who befriends them and often brings them along to see Mami herself fight witches, encouraging them to become magical girls as well. Caught between two choices, which will 
 choose? To become or to not become a magical girl?

Ryuushi Shiratori is a young artist in training. As he prepares to attend a vocational school, he moves into an old one story apartment complex called Narutaki-So, which is owned by his mother's cousin and his second cousin Aoba.
However, Ryuushi quickly becomes the center of attention for the five residents residing there, all with different and very unusual quirks and personalities. But out of all of them Ryuushi falls for Kozue, who is the most eccentric person residing at this apartment. But she holds an amazing secret, and she seems to be MUCH more than she appears to be.

From Gainex, the company that produced 
 and 
, comes a sad, funny, adventurous romp... with a bit of 'fan service' on the side.
 had spent most of her existence as a battle android, fighting on behalf of the secret organization VESPAR, to protect Earth from an alien invader known as Saint. But when her power reserves began to deplete themselves, VESPAR gives her two options: continue to fight until she lost power in a month... or spend the remainder of her existence in some other duty... and still remain active for 398 days. She had chosen to become the maid of the orphaned son of a former commander of hers, a boy named Suguru Misato... which was a good thing too, because his housekeeping skills were nothing short of lacking!
In no time, she has the house straightened up (which included throwing out Suguru's dirty comics). Soon, she's wowing Suguru's friends with her cooking... and contending with Suguru's buxom and lecherous teacher. But when an old enemy from Saint shows up to challenge her to a duel, will she sacrifice everything to save everything she values... including Suguru?

Yume Kikuchi is a 17-year old girl who had left for Tokyo to serve as a apprenticeship for becoming a mage. Mages are government employees and are considered civil workers. They possess supernatural powers. However, you must take up an apprenticeship of a mage veteran for a month and pass an exam to receive the license to become mages.
Yume's parents are both mages and she's traveled to Tokyo to earn her license. She encounters other mages such as the British exchange student, Angela Charon Brooks, and her Mage teacher and landlord Masami Oyamada. As she tries to get her license, she finds out what it really means to become a mage.

title: Mahou Tsukai ni Taisetsu na Koto

description:
Majin Tantei Nogami Neuro is about a man named 
 that is the greatest detective in all of the Underworld. But, he gets bored when he has devoured all of the mysteries down there, so he comes to the Earth to devour all of the mysteries here.
He meets a high school student, named 
, who became a detective after her dad's suspected suicide. She joins 
 to figure out the truth about her father, and solve mysteries together.
I wouldn't call this an action anime, but I'd rate it PG-13 for language.

Yoshikawa Haruo is a scrawny middle school student with a big secret, that his entire family uses magic. The secret is so big in fact that he doesn't even know it. For years he lives his life without magic, and his 3 magically-able sisters have made sure that he doesn't know it.
Until one day a very pretty girl by the name of Mamiya Ayumi shows up to be part of his life. Ayumi seems ill intentioned at first, but reveals that when she was a little girl she had a curse placed on her. The only person who can remove the curse will slowly terminate the cursed person's magic. Well, for Mamiya Ayumi, it happens to be the magically incapable Haruo.
With a lot of weird jokes, outrageous side characters, and a million mind-wiping hammers makes this a laugh out loud comedy.

As a sequel of 
, Nanoha has been sending text, emails, and gifts to Fate ever since she left to the Time-Space Administration Bureau. However, on the night Fate returns, she and her friends are ambushed by a Belkan Knight; a red haired ginger named Vita, along with 
, Zafira, and Shamal who's sole purpose is to fill up the pages of the Book of Darkness to protect their master.
It is up to Nanoha, Fate and their friends to discover, defeat (yet at the same time, help) the Book of Darkness, the Belkan Knights and their unknown master.

Mint, a 12-year old girl, is a Princess from the world of dreams, where the dreams and ambitions of humanity reflect on the effects to her world. However, all of that is placed in jeopardy when people start to lose faith in their dreams, endangering her world to the forces of darkness.
Mint travels to the Earth in order to bring hope back to humanity and her world. On Earth, Mint runs a "Shop of Happiness" with her Aunt Herb. She also befriends two children who help keep her origin and powers a secret.

title: Mahoromatic: Automatic Maiden - Something More Beautiful

description:
The second series of the "Mahoromatic" saga once again dishes out its share of love, pathos, good food, awkward situations... and even more 'fan service' with 
, Shiguru as well as the ever-sleazy Ms. Shikijo.
A clumsy female cyborg has followed Suguru after school. It turns out that this cyborg... later named Minawa, was from Management, a shadow organization who is concerned that VESPAR and Saint would someday become allies in peace. At first, she seemed to be normal... although klutzy and somewhat overly apologetic, but as events start heading for an inevitable conclusion, she might be the key to it all.
And what about the battle android-turned-maid 
? Will she protect Suguru through these events... even if she has to use the last amount of her remaining life energy to do it?

Ten years after the incident from 
, Subaru Nakajima is rescued from a fire in an airport in Mid-Childa by a matured Nanoha. And ever since then, she is inspired by and looks highly up to Nanoha.
Four years later, she and Teana Lanster are taking a test to increase their rank from C to B (Nanoha, Fate, Hayate, and Rein observe the test). After passing the test, joining them are Erio Mondial and Caro. Together, they face up against the Jail Scaglietti, a dangerous criminal after the Lost Logia.

Minky Momo is a very famous magical-girl anime. Minky Momo comes from Fenarinasa, the land of dreams in the sky, down to Earth to helps spread goodness through people's dreams. She has a magic candy cane that, when she uses it, she become an adult.
But then she gets hit by a truck, and is reborn into a human girl to the childless parents she lived with in the first place. There is another Minky Momo from Marinasa in the second series. It's a very cute little anime.

creator: Takeshi Shudo
title: Magic Princess Minky Momo
Mahou No Magical Princess Minky Momo

description:
Magic Knight Rayearth is the story of three regular school girls, 
, 
, and 
, whose lives are forever changed at what would be an ordinary school outing. Running out of money at the Tokyo tower telescope, 
 is given change by a mysterious young girl, later introduced as 
, wearing a neighboring school's uniform. 
 rushes to thank the girl, but is stopped by a crowd of students. Trying to pass through, 
 glances towards a girl with long blue hair, again from an neighboring school.
Suddenly there is a flash of light as they hear the prayer of a young woman calling for help from the legendary "Magic Knights", and the three find themselves suspended in mid-air over the land of Cefiro, filled with mountains and forests. Falling, they land upon a seemingly friendly flying fish. The three young girls are brought to safety on land, still confused as to their whereabouts. However, 
, the smallest of the three, suggests an introduction.
 and 
 are at first shocked to find 
 the same age as themselves (which is 14 years), for her young appearance is misleading, but their attentions quickly turn to the figure of a rather short man holding a magical staff that had appeared behind them. Introducing himself as Dosh (loosely translated as "master") 
, a powerful user of magic, he explains that 
, 
, and 
 are the legendary Magic Knights, destined to save the world of Cefiro whose captured ruler, Princess Emeraude, is in the posession of the dark priest 
. Since the princess had been captured, the land of Cefiro has been plagued by monsters and demons, and will soon deteriorate if Emeraude Hime fails to be returned. 
 is the first to respond exclaiming that she is willing to sacrifice in order to become a Magic Knight. Upon hearing 
's eager response Clef raises his staff to give the newly found Magic Knights their magic, but has only time to bless 
 as they are attacked by Dosh Clef's now evil apprentice, Alecone. Yelling the incantation "Summon beast!" Clef commands the three to board the magic griffin and escape to the safety of the forest where they will meet Presea, a gifted maker of weapons. Reluctantly the Magic Knights agree to escape as Clef challenges Alecone, in an even battle. Alecone leaves Clef to pursue 
 and the others, in hopes of ending the Magic Knights before the legend can be fulfilled.
Suddenly, from behind Dosh Clef, the evil priest 
 appears, and turns the powerful Clef to stone.
Aboard the griffin 
 senses that something is wrong as she thinks of the sorcerer that had risked his life to help them, but helpless she can only pray for his safety. Alecone appears riding her magical white horse through the air, calling incantations. Determined to survive and save the world of Cefiro 
 summons the power within herself and counter-attacks 
's minion with a new found strength, becoming the first to find her magic. The Magic Knights are able to escape, thankful for their safety. However, Alecone is not yet defeated.
, 
, and 
's thoughts turn to finding Presea, maker of weapons. Finding themselves at the opening of a dense forest, the Magic Knights step inside, but the griffin that had transported them there mysteriously disappears in a puff of smoke. At first 
 is confused, but after attempting to use her magic "arrow of fire", she realizes along with her new-found friends that magic can not be used in such an forest. Entering further into the woods, they encounter what appears to be the home of Presea. At first they are unable to find an entrance, but then the three girls accidently stumble across it. The Magic Knights are a little hesitant to enter her home uninvited, but proceed inside calling unanswered apologies. Much to their surprise, a cage is dropped over them, as a golden-haired woman appears chanting madly and exclaiming proudly how she had captured Mokana, a white rabbit-like creature with the ability to summon, which has been reeking havoc in her study. Seeing that the ones inside her trap are not Mokana, Presea realizes that 
, 
, and 
 are the legendary Magic Knights, as only they would be able to pass through the entrance leading to her home. But before Presea is able to give them the weapons that they have been searching for, a low rumbling noise sounds as a monster appears attacking her study. The Magic Knights run in pursuit of Presea and are led to a darkened room laden with various weapons. Pausing, the three are confused to which weapons to choose, but upon Presea's command they close their eyes, concentrate, and their three destined weapons rise from the rest and go to them.
For 
, a bow and arrow. For 
 and 
, a pair of swords.
With their combined strength the Youma is defeated. Thanking Presea the Magic Knights set off in search of the mineral "Escudo", from which Presea will be able to mold their true weapons, the Machines, as well as to free the magical forest from the powers of the dark stone implanted in it's center, to save the princess Emeraude from the clutches of evil, and finally to fulfill their destiny as the Legendary Magic Knights...

related.name: Tenchi the Movie: Tenchi Muyo in Love
Tenchi the Movie 2: The Daughter of Darkness
Tenchi Muyo! GXP: Galaxy Police Transporter

description:
Episode one introduces us to the world of Pretty Sammy very effectively. Somewhere far away from the Earth is the magical kingdom of Juraihelm. 
 and 
 are the two candidates for the next leader of the entire kingdom. The council had to decide who would rule next; and, of course, they chose 
, much to 
's displeasure. Of course, for 
 to be able to ascend to the position, she has to pass a test. She must select another person in another world, grant them magical powers, and help guide them in how to use them to make their world a better place. At this time we are introduced to all of the characters that will make up our world and how they have changed from the other series to this one. During a regular delivery call to a house, 
 meets up with 
 and gets her new powers and her new friend, 
. Around the same time, 
's tendrils have already slithered into the world and have picked 
 to become 
's magic girl rival.

The action heats up when 
 and 
 are turned into Love-Love monsters by 
 and start fighting over 
, endangering his life. 
 ends up saving the day (technically) as she always will, and leads us into the next episode.
Episode two starts off with a power hungry, psychotic, computer genius. (Bill Gates?!) His name is 
. 
 wants to 'standardize' all computers, and afterwords he wants to standardize the people who use them as well. He controls 95% of the worlds computers, except for Japan. Anyway, 
 and 
 appear and try to 'help' 
 with his conquering of the world. Meanwhile, at the Kawai residence... 
 needs a new karoake machine. 
 goes out to buy one, but instead he buys a new computer, the Mach8 system. The fastest on Earth. He also goes to buy some software. 
 looks on, and realizes that it's not using his software. 
 gets really angry and calls on 
.
 sees this and transforms into 
! 
 realizes 
's plan and her and 
 team up briefly to stop 
. 
 appears and persuades 
 to go back to 
's side. She does this by offering her a deluxe suite on Jurai with TV, cable, the works. To complete 
's plan, he has to make the moon crash into the Earth and re-start his standardization from the ground up. 
 goes in and stops his plan. Saving the day once more, somewhat...

related.name: Tenchi the Movie: Tenchi Muyo in Love
Tenchi Muyo! in Love 2: Haruka Nara Omoi
Tenchi Muyo! GXP: Galaxy Police Transporter

description:
This Gainax gem is definitely more for the otakus. Sasshi and Arumi, two kids in the shopping district of Abenobashi (a city in Osaka), discover that there's a secret magical force behind Abenobashi. One day, the magical force gets broken, and suddenly everything is no longer what it seems! Episode by episode, they get transported to parallel versions of Abenobashi, each with its own genre to spoof! You'll see them in the fantasy-based Sword & Sorcery Shopping Arcade, the sci-fi and mecha world of the Milky Way Shopping Arcade, the detective-noir streets of the Hard Boiled Shopping Arcade, and many others!
Abenobashi is a hilarious ride of misadventures, delivered in a typically Gainax fashion. There are a few times when the series is more serious when it gives you information about the characters and their history (like the first episode and the eighth episode that flashes back to show the origin of the shopping arcade). But the rest of the series is delightfully playful, especially if you can understand all of the jokes and references.

related.name: Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: The Movie

description:
Macross Zero is a Prequel OVA that takes place one year before the events of Space War I in the original 
 (a.k.a. 
), when a Civil war between the UN Spacy and Anti-UN forces reached its final days.
UN Spacy pilot Shin Kudou is shot down by a new Anti-UN enemy plane, causing him to crash land on a peaceful and remote Mayan island where technology is nonexistant. However, while Shin rests and heals his wounds, the peace is shattered during the development and launch of the new fighter known as the VF-0. And if that weren't enough, he soon learns of the island's link to a mysterious alien life form that both sides are actively hunting, bringing the war to their doorstep.
However, they'll soon learn that waking this ancient alien force will yield deadly consequences for everyone.....

related.name: Choujiku Yousai Macross II: Lovers Again
Gekijouban Choujiku Yousai Macross: Ai, Oboete Imasu Ka
Super Dimensional Fortress Macross Flash Back 2012

description:
"We're going to launch a manga magazine!"
A team of girl with zero percent manga editing experience are working on their dream to create the biggest manga magazine in Lebanon. They seem to do nothing but run into problems and failures... but they're working hard every day!
There were originally 13 episodes in the TV series, then an additional episode titled Mangirl: Asobu Henshuu Girl was released with the blu-ray release. It is not sure if there will be second season.

related.name: Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: The Movie

description:
This can basically be described as an animated Top Gun with a twist. It takes place 30 years after the first Robotech War, starting off as a contest between two prototype Valkyerie fighters. The reason these are prototype fighters is that they can fold by themselves.
Enter 
, a fly-by-the-seat-of-your-pants-pilot who is ordered to be one of the test pilots. He encounters his old rival Gauld Bowman, a half Zentraedi who has problems controlling his warrior instincts. The two start off the competition almost at each others throats.
Enter Miyune, a former singer and producer of the famous singer Sharon Apple. Sharon is a computer made image using emotions downloaded from Miyune's mind. Miyune is an old friend of 
 and Gauld. However, their feelings toward each other are left to be questioned.
During the competition, U.N. Spacy has developed a new fighter, the Ghost X-9. This fighter is pilot free; it can fly and attack by itself. Also, one of the Sharon programmers upgrades Sharon with an AI chip, which gives Sharon self-awareness. After the production of the Ghost X-9, the fighter competition is cancelled. Sharon makes a surprising concert on Earth. 
 races towards Earth with Gauld in pursuit.
Miyune knows the truth about Sharon and tries to stop her. She also discovered that Sharon has an obsession with 
. Both 
 and Gauld know whats going on, so they place their differences aside, and try to stop Sharon. Meanwhile, Sharon is taking control of all the people that listen to her and possessing anything that is run by computer, INCLUDING MACROSS.
Gauld died by going on a collision coarse with the Ghost X-9. 
 destroyed the Macross main computer system that was linked up to Sharon. Without power, Sharon died.

Macross Plus takes place 30 years after the events of Space War I in the original 
, and takes us to the colonized planet of Eden in the year 2040 A.D.
Hotshot Valkyrie pilot 
 is sent to Eden in order to test the new Valkyries in development. However, he is reunited with his childhood rival Guld Goa Boaman and his mutual friend Myung Fang Lone. Guld himself is also a test pilot for the second Valkyrie in development and only intensifies the rivalry between them, transforming into a bitter and dangerous conflict. Myung herself is in charge of the famous Virtual Pop Idol Sharon Apple, though she has grown despondent of her work.
The strained relationship of these three friends come to a head, and old disputes and wounds are reopened in the process. However, things get even worse when an illegal chip is put into Sharon Apple's AI, giving her self-consciousness. Spiraling out of control, she threatens to completely take over the minds of everyone! Can the three friends patch up their relationship and shut down Sharon Apple in the process?

related.name: Choujiku Yousai Macross II: Lovers Again
Gekijouban Choujiku Yousai Macross: Ai, Oboete Imasu Ka
Super Dimensional Fortress Macross Flash Back 2012

description:
One day, some invaders came from space.
Now, if these invaders were pretty women, nobody would have complained.
But as it happens, they were very ugly and very high performance robots.
They were so powerful that the UN forces were destroyed in one blast.
Was it the end of the world?
Actually, the invaders just roamed around, but they didn't attack unless they were provoked.
Also, they were very polite, so the people got used to them and lived their normal lives.
But these invaders were still invaders, so the people did want to get rid of them.
Then five young people stood up to fight the invaders.
They were the members of the Kitanohashi High School magic club: Takakura, Aburatsubo, Sae, Nanaka, and Akane.
These students became real magicians and fought againt the robots.
One rule of the magician is that they couldn't let anyone know of their identity.
But the journalist Minowa and his cameraman Yoshimoto kept going after the magicians.

related.name: Captain Harlock and the Queen of a Thousand Years

description:
La Maetelle... once a rich and an abundant planet, was now a cold, barren wasteland after it had changed its original orbit around the sun.
The only way to survive was to get machine bodies. Hardgear, a mad cyborg scientist transforms the queen and her subjects into mechanized beings. But Queen Promethium's daughters Maetel and Emeraldas, chose to stay human, fight Hardgear, and restore their home world.

In this (short-lived) modernized remake of the popular 
 series, the Mach 5 is a powerful racing car that was built by Pops Racer. The car is also equipped with the powerful "X Engine." However, during the Mach 5's testing, a horrible accident takes the life of his son Rex Racer.
Pops then decides rebuild damaged Mach 5 and equips it with the "Safety Seven" which are different devices that were built into the Mach 5 for various purposes in order to protect the driver. The X Engine (which survived the accident) is also retained in the car. Pops' second son, Speed Racer enters the Grand Prix in memory of his lost brother Rex.
As Speed works his way up as a professional racer, the family discovers an even more amazing secret involving the Mach 5 that may determine the future of the world itself.....
The opening sequence from the series can be seen here: 
.
And here is a Spanish clip that's about a minute an a half long:

If you could describe 
's life in one word, it would be "confusing". You can't really tell if he's lucky or not. On the one hand, he's a complete loser with unreliable friends, and he can only use magic eight times in his life, or else he'll turn to dust! But on the other hand, every girl in his class at magic school wants to bear his children because of his superior DNA!
But one girl rules them all, and that would be the newest transfer student, 
. She declares to be his wife, and makes an oath to guard him from all the other girls! Easier said than done, especially when your two main rivals are a calculating swordswoman and a walking pheromone! On top of that, a ghost named Elizabeth makes all sorts of trouble! Can things go crazier? Probably...

related.name: Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: The Movie

description:
Macross Flash Back 2012 is a Special OVA that serves as kind of an Epilogue to the original 
 series. (a.k.a. 
 Season 1) Not only does it depict the final "Farewell" concert from Lynn Minmay on Earth (which was originally planned for the series, but never panned out at the time), it also depicts the fates of Hikaru, Misu and the rest of the main characters. There are also a number of music videos with Minmay's songs that feature footage from the TV Series and the movie "
".

creator: Shoji Kawamori
title: Super Dimensional Fortress Macross Flash Back 2012

related.name: Choujiku Yousai Macross II: Lovers Again
Gekijouban Choujiku Yousai Macross: Ai, Oboete Imasu Ka

description:
Hit the deck! Those wisecracks who decided to turn anime upside-down for their own perverse pleasure with 
 are at it again! This time, they're taking you on the most twisted Magical Girl adventure no one should ever have imagined!
The main character is 10-year-old 
 (doesn't she look like 
 to you?), who dreams of being a voice actress. Of course, she has a bad voice and bad grades to boot. But when an alien decides to wreak havoc on Tokyo (taking out her parents in the process), she finds a talking fish...who she skins into a magic wand transforming her into Puni Puni Poemy. Lost yet? Don't worry. You've got plenty of time for that.
By the way, don't be surprised if characters look familiar (especially our protagonist). Any resemblance to characters you may have seen in 
 
.

related.name: Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: The Movie

title: Macross Frontier
Macross F
Macross Frontier the Movie: The False Songstress
Macross Frontier the Movie: The Wings of Goodbye

description:
Macross Frontier is the latest entry of the 
 series, created in celebration of the series' 25th Anniversary.
At the end of Space War I, humanity nearly faced annihilation after the devestating war with the Zentraedi. As a result, mankind set out to explore and colonize in space with the Megaroad colonization project. Many new planets and civilizations were discovered in the process. Taking place in 2059 A.D., (after the events of 
) Macross Frontier chronicles the events of the Frontier fleet settled near the center of the galaxy.
The Frontier fleet is anticipating the appearance of the famous Galactic pop idol Sheryl Nome. However, the peace is quickly shattered when the Frontier comes under attack from a mysterious and relentless alien army known as the Vajra. A young pilot trainee named Alto Saotome is unwittingly pulled into this new battle in the process.
But what are the Vajra and what are their true purpose? And will the forces of the Frontier fleet stand a chance against them?

related.name: Choujiku Yousai Macross II: Lovers Again
Gekijouban Choujiku Yousai Macross: Ai, Oboete Imasu Ka
Super Dimensional Fortress Macross Flash Back 2012

description:
Pucca is like no other anime-inspired cartoon I have ever seen. The art is very simple, using a lot of very basic shapes and crisp colors, the animation looks like it was made for a Flash player, are neither of the two main characters actually speak. Plus, it is unbelievable cute, more so than even 
. And yet, despite what you might expect for a series with such an extreme cuteness factor, this show goes down like a cool drink of water. It's easy to watch, easy to laugh at, and will simply brighten your day.

The main focus of the show is on a 10 year old girl named Pucca, and her ever-lasting quest to make a ninja boy named Garu into her boyfriend. Garu, on the other hand, wants nothing to do with Pucca, and typically spends most of the episode trying to run away from her. And oddly enough, neither of these two main characters even speak! All thoughts and emotions are conveyed by body language and floating icons that pop up. Any fan of anime will recognize the use of icons to indicate emotions, such as hearts popping up to indicate love, but this show takes it to the extreme!

Thankfully, all the rest of the characters speak, and let me tell you, there are quite a few of them! My personal favorite is Garu's best friend, Abyo. He's modeled after Bruce Lee, and can often be found ripping off his shirt whenever the mood suits him (which is typically AT LEAST once per episode). Pucca's best friend is Ching, who often seems super-cheerful and always has a bird sitting atop her head. And what would a show be without villains?! The best of these is the evil ninja Tobe, Garu's main rival. He has a wicked-looking x-shaped scar right between his eyes and commands an entire clan of ninja lackeys... but despite all this, he still lacks the skill needed to take down Garu... or even Pucca for that matter. But he does have some of the funniest quotes in the show.
There are other villains, such as Muji, a man obsessed with his moustache, and the Vagabond Ninja Clan, which consist of Chief, Clown, and Shaman. Ring Ring could also be considered a baddie, though to a much lesser extent. She's basically a spoiled, selfish rich girl who wears traditional Chinese robes and gets this gnarly red-and-white design on her face when she gets mad. She considers herself Pucca's rival, though I'm unsure if Pucca actually sees her in that way. Also making frequent appearances is Santa Claus (though not as a villain). I guess the man's gotta do something when he's not on duty for Christmas.

At any rate, this show is a great melting pot of cuteness, comedy, martial arts action, weirdness, and kisses... lots of kisses! It is great entertainment that works for both kids and adults. Definitely check it out if you have the chance. Don't trust me? Just check out the 
, or this 
. You can learn more at 
. Once you see it in action, you'll understand....
All 26 episodes from the first season are now available on two DVDs released by 
: 
 and 
, though they don't seem to be in any particular order:

In the country of Gazth-Sonika, a Civil War rages. There exists a mysterious and dealdly mercenary that goes by the name of Madlax, who hunts down her bounty with almost invincible and supernatural skill. In another country lives a girl named Margaret Burton, who lives a peaceful life. And then they meet.
As fate would have it, the two appear to have a mysterious connection despite their different lifestyles. The clues to their past lies with a mysterious book that is also being hunted down by the mysterious organization of Anfan. Madlax and Margaret follow their destiny to seek out the truth of their pasts. No matter how harsh the truth may be...

Madlax focuses on the adventures of Madlax, a beautiful assassin making her living during a civil war in the country of Gazth-Sonicka; and Margaret, a rich student living an easy life in the country of Nafrece. Although their lives might seem completely unrelated to each other, both come together in order to find the truth surrounding the mysterious origins of the war in Gazth-Sonicka, with their only clue being a book called Secondary written in a language that no one can understand. This same book is coveted by the organization, Enfan, who will do anything to have it.

related.name: Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: The Movie

description:
Thirty-five years after 
 helped bring a peaceful end to the devastating war with the Zentradi, humanity stretches out and explores the farthest reaches of the galaxy. Macross 7 tells the story of 
 and his famous band known as "Firebomber." They live in the Macross 7, a ship that is searching for other worlds.
However, the peace doesn't last and City 7 is attacked by a mysterious alien force called the Protodevilin, who attack their victims by stealing their Spiritia rendering them in a zombie-like state. However, 
 believes that his music holds a greater power and heads out into the battlefield expecting both friends and enemies to be moved by his music. Will 
 be able to hold his own against this new enemy, and will his methods of dealing with the Protodevilin truly be the key?

related.name: Choujiku Yousai Macross II: Lovers Again
Gekijouban Choujiku Yousai Macross: Ai, Oboete Imasu Ka
Super Dimensional Fortress Macross Flash Back 2012

description:
Psycho divers are a special class of psionic investigators, utilizing computer technology to augment and enhance their natural abilities. The job does have it's disadvantages, though. The process is rough on the cardiovascular and nervous systems, which can lead to an early death. And then there are other occupational hazards... like someone trying to hide the truth.
Juhta Bosujima thought he had retired from the diving business, but a job from the Iris Talent Agency had came up. A young and talented singer in a dry spell was showing signs of incredible psionic talents. As it turned out, a diver that was Bosujima's friend had tried... and his head blew-up as a result.
At first, he wasn't interested. But after his apartment was broken into and his dog was killed, he took the job. But what is the real purposes? And what does it have to do with the singer's involvement with a mysterious cult?

Pumpkin Scissors takes place in an alternate world where war raged between two factions known as the Royal Empire and the Republic of Frost. A ceasefire is currently placed between the two opposing forces. Three years have passed with the ceasefire still in place, however the Royal Empire is plagued poverty, starvation and pestilence. Even worse is the fact that many soldiers have gone rogue.
This is where the "Imperial Army State Section III" or "Pumpkin Scissors" comes in. Created by 
, the Pumpkin Scissors aid war relief by facing the corruption of those who abuse their power and ultimately restore order to the chaos of the Royal Empire.

Ryo Takatsuki used to be a regular High School Student, until the day two new transfer students, Hayato Shingu and Takeshi Tomoe, arrive at his school, all with a history of disciplinary problems and a very huge secret. Soon Ryo discovers that they all have one thing in common, they all have powerful nanomachine weapons called ARMS that were mysteriously put into their bodies. ARMS is designed to be the ultimate human weapon and can often go out of control if put in inexperienced hands.
Together, Ryo and the other ARM bearers set out to discover the secret of ARMS and the reason why it was put into each of them. However, a powerful and dangerous organization is after living samples of the ARMS. They send out dangerous assassins that are willing to do anything it takes to take down Ryo and his friends in order to get them. Ryo's normal life soon becomes increasingly chaotic as he and his friends fight for survival and try to learn the truth.

creator: Kyoichi Nanatsuki, Ryoji Minagawa
title: Project ARMS
director: Junichi Takaoka, Hajime Kamegaki, Hirotoshi Takaya

description:
There is one name whose mention strikes fear in anyone's heart. His name is synonymous with quick, efficient death: the world's most lethal assassin, Golgo 13.
However, this time around, the hitman has become the hit when he takes out the son of a wealthy oil tycoon. Leonard Dawson is now sparing no expense and taking no chances. He wants Golgo 13 dead...
Created by Takao Saito, the world of Golgo 13 is a world of international intrigue where his bullets punctuate the atmosphere. Though not the first time Golgo 13 had appeared on film (there was a live-action feature titled 
 made some time prior), 
 is his first appearance in anime, faithfully reproducing all the aspects that have made Saito's manga popular. Golgo 13's effectiveness, ethics, and ways with women (which could rival that of James Bond) are brought to life in vivid (and sometimes lurid) animation.
NOTE: Orignally released in the US by Streamline Pictures, the rights have been acquired from the defunct company by Urban Vision, who has since re-released it.

Before I even knew what Japanese animation was, I knew of Golgo 13... not the anime, and not the manga, but the 1988 
 game, Golgo 13: Top Secret Episode for the original 
 home console, the Nintendo Entertainment System. Ah, memories. And now, seventeen years later, I've finally watched The Professional: Golgo 13... and I thought the game was mature! This has more violence that 
, and more sex than... well, no, hentai titles do have more sex... but still, this guy gets laid more than James Bond! At what's even worse is that he acts like he doesn't eve care. I mean, come on dude! Seriously, loosen up! Show the women some emotion here! But I digress.

Okay, now when you're watching the opening credits, you have to keep in mind that this was made in 1983. Why? Because they use the latest in 1983 3-D technology! Wow. It kind looks like what the 3-D animators use today... when they're creating a mock-up of what they'll eventually be creating. Seriously, junior-high students can now make better 3-D just fooling around in their spare time after school. Then this awesome 1983 3-D animation also actually shows up in the film itself, towards the end. And just... wow. Seems like it would have been easier, cheaper, and better looking just to draw the scene by hand. But hey, back then it was awesome! But I digress... again.

Alright, alright, on with the story! We first meet Duke Togo, codenamed Golgo 13, on a job. His job? Assassin! He pulls the trigger, and next thing you know his target happens to have an extra hole in the head. Then we jump right into his next job. Again, it's the same deal. Target sighted, trigger pulled, bullet enters head. And wouldn't you know it, but it all takes during a ceremony, right in front of the guy's wife, daughter, and most important of all, his father. It was Leonard "Petroleum King" Dawson's 62nd birthday, and just as he was about to hand the Dawson Corporation over to his son, Robert Frederick Dawson, Golgo's bullet it's mark. What timing! Now Leonard's on a non-stop mission of revenge to take out the man who killed his son!

Of course, Mr. Togo still has jobs to do! He can't stop just because some rich and powerful guy has enlisted every resource at his disposal to kill the assassin. And by every resource, I'm talking FBI, CIA, US Military, and any other hand willing to pull a trigger. But there's not time for Mr. Togo to think about all that, he has to get on to finding and killing Dr. Z, head of a Mafia that killed some guy's entire family. And since nobody seems to know who this guy is or what he looks like, that's gonna be difficult. The best lead he has to go on is Cindy, Dr. Z's only daughter, who lives in a castle-like mansion with the tightest security available. And not to ruin it or anything, but yeah, Golgo sleeps with the girl, takes out his target, and moves on to his next job.

Golgo continues with his jobs, but Dawson's constant attacks begin to take out every ally Golgo has. Finally our little assassin has to give in and go after Dawson to finish it once and for all. I know, it sucks to take a job that doesn't pay, but sometimes you just gotta do it. Of course, Dawson's obsession with the man that killed his son just begs the question, why isn't he going after the person that hired the assassin? For the assassin it was just another job, but for the person who hired him it was personal. Anyway, with creepy villains galore all trying to take down our persistent hitman, this battle is going to get worse before it gets better. But if you can make it to the end, then all will be revealed.

Speed Racer was titled "Mach Go Go" in Japan. It was produced and created by Tatsuo Yoshida and released worldwide in 19671968 through Trans Lux who was also responsible for 
. It was first shown on Melbourne TV in December 1969 on channel 2 at 5:05pm weekdays.
A total of 52 episodes were made. Peter Fernandez (other work includes The Space Giants, Ultraman, and 
 [
] as well as most of the Godzilla films) coordinated the English version and was the voice of 
 and 
 as well as Piper and Dr. Mariner from 
 and a number of other characters. Corinne Orr (female) was the voice of 
, Mom Racer and Spritle after her success as the voice of 
. Jack Curtis was Pops Racer and Inspector Detector, after playing Bulton in 
. Jack Grimes was the voice of Sparky and Chim-Chim as well as Professor Fumble and Splasher in 
. The worldwide rights to the series are held by the Rocknowski family of Santa Monica, CA in the US (production info from Andy Shepherd)
Speed Racer was the story of 
, an 18 year old racing driver and his adventures on and off the track. On his helmet was printed M, originally standing for "Go Mifune" his original Japanese name. His girlfriend was 
, his younger brother Spritle, and Spritle's pet monkey was named Chim Chim. 
's mechanic and best friend was Sparky. 
's older brother was 
, who also played 
- a masked racer with even 
 not knowing his real identity, and was an undercover agent. He had left home years ago and none of his family had seen him since.
's car was known as the Mach 5. It was designed and built by his father "Pops" and was equipped with incredible features, operated by 7 buttons on the steering wheel.
Carloco (Stallone and Shwartzenegger) purchased the rights to do a live action Speed Racer. They paid $10 million for the rights. The script was finished and even hired a casting agency and cast the parts. After the failure of Cliffhanger and Last Action hero, nothing became of it and so their licenses have expired. Too bad. I would have enjoyed it (from Dave Stenberg).
A new series titled "New series of Speed Racer" was produced by Fred Wolf films from Teenage Mutant Turtle fame and released in 1993, but was not as popular as the original, for a few reasons. The animation was done by American cartoonists, losing that great Manga effect; the storyline and animation seems only to appeal to small children and not to adults as the original one did. The artwork is nowhere near as good and the theme song was changed. The only things remaining are the original names. A big disappointment!
Now a live-action film is in production, starring Emile Hirsch, Matthew Fox, Christina Ricci, John Goodman and Susan Sarandon. Learn more at 
.

The beautiful Saki Azuma, a teacher at an all-girl school, is deeply in love with the handsome yet sadistic Takumi Mikami. She would do anything for him, and therein lies the problem. You see, Mikami was fired from his previous teaching job for molesting a student, and now he wants Saki to get him a job at her college which is so ripe with sexy, innocent schoolgirls. Saki knows what he will do, and she hates it, but her love for Mikami and his threat of a breakup prevents her from disobeying. And so the Professor Wada, the art teacher, mysteriously falls ill, opening a position for the perverted Professor Mikami.

Well, it doesn't take long after being hired that Mikami begins his lecherous ways. And as if wasn't hard enough on Saki just knowing that Mikami was capturing and raping these lovely young women, he forces her to stand idly by and videotape every last bit of the sexual action. And when one student, Minori Sakurano, discovers what Mikami is up to and confronts Saki, Saki has to help Takumi in his plan to abduct Minori and her sister, Mao, in order to keep Takumi out of trouble.
Saki was happy when Mikami's temporary teaching position finally ended. Mikami told Saki that when it was over, he would once again start having sex with her. But immediately following the announcement of Mikami's departure, it is announced that another teacher, the lovely Harumi Shiraishi, would also be leaving the school... because she would be marrying Takumi Mikami.
A shattered and devastated Saki, whose love once enabled her to the most horrific things just to please Mikami, now would do anything to destroy him. And she had the means. So at Mikami's wedding, she let his bride and everyone else attending see exactly what kind of man Mikami was... by showing, on the giant television screen, the videos of his sexual escapades which he had forced her to make.

The OVA anime series of 
 is an adaptation of the original arcade/Console game that was released in 1996 Japan/US and 1997 Europe.
A group of people who possess supernatural powers have begun to spring up all over the world. These individuals became known as so called "Psychicers", who possess powers such as the ability to manipulate fire or wind or ice. However the humans who currently inhabit the world who do not possess such power seek to eradicate and oppress such individuals, with some governments even seeking to use them as weapons or even artificially produce them!
The basic rundown of the story is that all the Psychicers all over the world are brought together by a self deemed leader of the psychicers known as 
. 
 and another individual called Richard Wong set up an organisation called Noah, the aim of Noah is to form a new world in which Psychicers can live in without the oppression of humans.
This leads to the psychicers fighting against the humans and eventually gaining an advantage. At first 
 simply has a vision of a perfect world for the psychicers, but the influence of Wong, and his own hate for humanity due to the torture and experiments performed on him by humans, his dream quickly turns into a twisted vision in which 
 wishes to totally wipe out all of humanity until only Psychicers are left.
The only set back to 
's plans, lays in the form of his best friend Burn Griffith, who upon learning of 
's plans and what 
 wishes to use him for, rejects 
's vision and acts against him. But can Burn stop 
 from exploiting his fellow psychicers and the potential destruction of mankind.
The basic plot of the series for the most part does run parallel with the storyline of the game, although there are a few minor differences in character backgrounds.
All in all, the anime may come as a disappointment to the people who have played the game prior to watching the anime, due to its shortness in length and lack of detail. The ending also leaves a few questions unanswered.

Princess Tutu is a magical girl anime, other such anime include 
, and 
... the genre was of course made famous in the west by Naoko Takeuchi's 
.
Ahiru is our main character. She is a clumsy, friendly, girl who daydreams of dancing with her 'Prince' Mute (according to some sources his name is 
). She then find out that Mute actually IS a prince and she is both his saviour - the magical ballerina Princess Tutu - and no more than a little yellow duck (note her name means duck) transformed into a girl by the late storyteller Drosselmeyer.
In the story that Drosselmeyer was writing when he died, a prince was fighting a monster raven, but as the story was left unfinished it would seem they were doomed to fight an unending battle. Neither could accept this and they both came out of the book.. and the prince took out his heart and shattered it in order to seal the raven away.
This worked, but it meant that the prince's heart scattered throughout the village, and that stories started to come to life.
Editor's Note: Princess Tutu lasted for two seasons on Japanese television. The first season consisted of 13 30-minute episodes, while the second season consisted of 24 15-minute episodes. However, every pair of 15-minute episodes tells one 30-minute story. Additionally, there were also 3 specials, but I'm not sure if those were 30 minutes or 15 minutes each. If you know, please 
.

Princess Tutu is a dramatic and fantastic anime about a clumsy girl named Duck. She attends a ballet school and she works hard to achieve her dream, to dance with the handsome 
.
 (Mytho-sempai) is a emotionless young man who has lost his heart. The reason for this is because he is an incarnation of a Prince inside of a story called The Prince and The Raven by the story teller, Drosselmeyer.
The Prince and the Raven is about a young prince who journeys to fight an evil Raven. Drosselmeyer died before he finished the story so the Prince and the Raven continued to fight for many years. The Raven and the Prince both decided they had enough so the Prince sealed the raven away with his heart. Now the pieces of the prince's heart are scattered.
Duck discoverers that she is Princess Tutu, an amazing ballerina who collects the shards of the prince's heart and returns them to 
. But there is always a catch. There is another side of Duck. Since Duck is not perfect, she sometimes acts like a duck and has the same mannerisms as ducks. So every time Duck does something that resembles a duck, she actually turns into one. The way she can turn back into a human is by dumping water over her head, but when she turns back in a human, she is naked.
I would give this anime a 4.5 out 5 stars for the story and wonderful scenery.

Dr. Sara Iijima is a psychologist whose heart is as big as her enormous breasts... and she knows how to use them to help others. She can use them to induce a state of hypnosis in her patients in order to find out what is troubling them.
Along with her assistant, the perverted loser Tamine, Sara uses her wits, talent... and her boobs... to get to the bottom of what's troubling two people: a young college student who moonlights as a prostitute, and a female colleague whose talents may be causing more harm than good.

Directed by Tensai Okamura (
), Project Blue Earth SOS is a throwback to classic cheesy 50's Science Fiction. Billy Kimura and Penny Carter are two kids who witness the testing of a new bullet train utilizing a material called G-Reactive. However, the train mysteriously disappears. Billy and Penny investigate the train's disappearance, eventually leading to a terrifying discovery on an imminent alien invasion of Earth! Teaming up with Captain Clayton and other allies, they use a special plane called the Sky Knight to help fend off the alien attack. Will they be able to save humanity from this extraterrestrial menace?

This is not Japanese Animation! I have, however, decided to include it on this site anyway. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
Professor Utonium attempted to make the perfect little girls but accidentally added Chemical X and thus the Powerpuff Girls were born three girls with amazing superpowers they devoted there life to fighting crime and the forces of evil.
The Powerpuff Girls have many adventures (such as Bubbles getting turned into a boy) along the way, and eventually decide to make a fourth Powerpuff Girl named Bunny, who died.
The girls always win in the end, and the villains like Mojo Jojo normally get beaten up.

Project A-ko consists of two different OVA series- the normal series and the Versus Battle series. In both series, Project A-ko is the action-packed and hilarious parody of just about every known genre of anime in the 1980's. The focus of the entire regular series of stories are three girls who attend Graviton High School. There is 
, the supposed heroine; 
, her rival; and cute 
, the object of the whole mess...and I do mean MESS. Then you have hilarious extras, such as 
's little spy force, the crossdressed aliens from outer space, the suave-looking 
, Graviton teacher 
, and a whole lot more.
You want hardcore action? Giant mecha robots? Alien invasions? Superpowered girls? Bitter conflicts? Lots of damage? How about all this wrapped around a hefty chunk of humor? Then Project A-ko is just the thing.
The Versus Battle series of Project Ako has the same characters, but in a totally different setting. We now take you to a space story where the fate of the universe as we know it is at stake. The focus of the conflict is (once again) 
, who is kidnapped by space pirates who crash on a sandy planet, losing 
 in the process.
Meanwhile, the huntress 
 is heading back to the house to rejoin her friend and partner 
 (this is NOT a mistake) when 
 literally drops in. They soon realize who 
 is and were preparing to take her back (for probably a big reward) when the pirates literally wreck the place and take 
 away again. The opposition is tough, including their leader, 
. But 
 gets help from the Space Patrol, in the form of tiny 
.
All the action, all the metal, and all the hilarity you come to expect from Project A-ko is still there. The stakes have just become infinitely higher.

description:
Princess Princess is based on a manga of the same name.
The main character is Toru Kouno. He transfers to an all boys school so he won't be a burden to his uncle, who had adopted him after his parents died. When he first arrives, everyone keeps commenting on his beauty. He's weirded out by this until he hears about the princess system. It's where boys dress up as girls. It's to liven up the dull life of an all boys' school.
Not everyone can be a princess though. It must be a first year student because they have more free time from studies, their bodies haven't fully developed yet, and it's easier to dress them up in girls' clothes. From all the first-years, only the ones with the best looks and most suited personalities are chosen to be princesses.
Their duties are to wear girls' clothing to morning meetings or school events, to encourage others at school, and cheering at school events.
There are some luxuries. When there's a conflict between a princess' work and school class, absence from class or leaving early can be considered as school vacation. It wouldn't show up on their attendance record. Every month they receive 30 school lunch vouchers. Therefore, when they eat at school, they don't have to pay. All necessary school supplies are all covered by the princess budget. The photography club takes pictures of the princesses and sell them to other students. For being the model of the photographs, they receive partial profit for pocket money.
Toru meets the fellow princesses, Yujirou and Mikoto, who becomes his closest friends, along with Akira, who is to be the next president of the student council.

Tooru Kouno, an orphan taken in my his uncle, decides to transfer to Fujimori High school, so he would not be a burden to him. When he arrives, Tooru is surprised to see a pink-haired girl near the entrance, considering Fujimori is an all boys school. The "girl" Tooru met, was actually a boy disguised as a girl.
At Fujimori high, they have something known as the "Hime (Princess) System", which they use to enrich the dull lives of the boys at the school. Only beautiful first years may become a princess because their bodies are not fully developed and are easier to dress as girls.
Tooru accepts the job as a Hime, and now joins Mikoto Yukata, the Western princess, and the pink haired "girl he saw, and Yuujirou Shihoudani, the Eastern princess, as beloved princess of Fujimori High.

Seishun Gakuen Middle School (or Seigaku for short) had a tradition to not take first year students as regulars until after the summer. Then came 
, a genius first year student, son of a world famous pro!
Beating a few older students with amazing tennis moves, 
 won a seat in the Seigaku regular team! The team's dream is to go to the All Japan Tournament and, of course, win!!
The team has a wide variety of players; from tennis prodigy 
, to hyper, acrobatic 
, to calculating Inui. All of them have cool moves and, of course, are unbelievably good at tennis! (Most of the guys are really cute too!)
This sports anime is a blend of sports, comedy and maybe a bit of romance. The many amazing matches are punctuated with side-splitting laughter! A lot of it is because of Inui's evil veggie/anything else juice, called "Inui's Special Vegetable Extract Juice" (and he has others, like "Inui's Special Golden Power Remix", "Blue Juice", "Red Juice", and "Hyper Penal Tea"). And of course 
 has his own mini fan club and a shy little girl that has a crush on him.
Pick up your racket and watch Prince of Tennis!

This sequel seems to have nothing at all to do with it's predecessor, except for the fact that it takes place in a school and is about a teacher who enjoys molesting students. This time around, our perverted professor is a guy named Tomoya. We first see him in a classroom having fun with two female students, inter-cut with some scene taking place in a bar where he's talking to Ishiguro, a new student teacher that happens to look exactly like Tomoya, and have his same last name. This is where we see Tomoya drug Ishiguro so that he can impersonate him at the College of Sacred Maidens, where Ishiguro was supposed to start the very next day.

Apparently Tomoya's very good at turning sexy young women into his sexual servants, because he's only there for two weeks yet seems have two sex slave students as soon as he starts out. He decides that his third servant will be Yumi Kurichi, who is the younger sister of Karishima, another teacher at the school. Saejima, the gym teacher, is Karishima's boyfriend, but he can't seem to keep his hands of her sister, which gives Tomoya what he needs to make Yumi his. All he has to do is wait for Saejima to make his move, which doesn't take long. Then to the rescue he comes! Yumi is so grateful, that she even gives herself up willingly... well, mostly.

Next on the list is Seira, the swim team captain. She had seen him come to the girls swimming pool, and thought he was a total pervert. Actually, she didn't just think it, she flat out told him so, which pretty much sealed her fate. And Tomoya already had what he needed to make her his pet. Earlier, he had overheard that she takes "herbs", which were, unbeknownst to her, illegal drugs. Unfortunately, when he reveals to her what she knows, she decides she'd rather go to the police than be blackmailed by a pervert. Needless to say, this infuriates Tomoya, and he takes Seira anyway.

Next up is Asuka, track start turned lead actress in the theater club's show. Something happened between her and Miki Tachibana, which caused Miki to lose the role of lead actress. Whatever it was, it was apparently Asuka's fault. Jealous that Asuka took her place, Miki pretends to have forgiven Asuka, but secretly stashes some stolen tickets inside Asuka's pocket so the lovely young lass would get blamed for the theft. Of course, the devious Tomoya sees this, and decides to raises the sakes by adding about $1000 in cash to the pocket. Then, after the rehearsal, Tomoya calls Asuka into his now vacant classroom, and has her reveal the bulge in her pocket. We all know what happens next.
And then we move on to the second episode, where the honorable Mr. Tomoya has his way more of the girls, including Miki and Satsuki. There really isn't any kind of story in either episode, just various reasons contrived for the sole purpose of having Tomoya molest the women of the campus... as if Tomoya needed any reasons? I can just picture him saying "Oh, look, your shoelace is untied, guess I better rape you now". Compared to the first title, the art style is similar, the sex is about the same, but the story of the original is just way better (because there actually is one).

Pokemon Advanced is sixth season of the TV series, and is about 
's continuing adventures to become a Pokemon master. In this series he joins with new characters 
 and 
 to defeat Team Rocket and earn more badges.
 is in the Hoen region now and seems to know much more than usual since he went from Kanto to Johto. A new professor also arrives called Professor Birch. Team Rocket is as wacky as ever in this series. Unlike Johto, every episode isn't always filler.

description:
This is not Japanese Animation! I have, however, decided to include it on this site anyway. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
The feature length movie based on the Powerpuff Girls goes back to the beginning, when Professor Utonium first created the girls after an accident involving Chemical X. However, the three superpowered girls have trouble finding their place in the world and end up going overboard with their powers, eventually gaining the mistrust of the citizens of Townsville.
After being deceived by the evil Chemical X-created monkey Mojo Jojo, the girls try to set things right by saving Townsville from the evil plans of this mad monkey. Will they save the day before bedtime?

A dashing and brave WWI Pilot is transformed into a pig by a mysterious curse. He is now employed as a paid mercenary/problem solver and sea plane pilot in the Adriatic Sea for the side of good. He is forced to do combat with a band of air pirates who never bathe and call themselves Mama Aiuto (Mothers Helper). Anarchy and war are coming to Italy and the adriatic pilots are being forced to join the Air Force or become fugatives from the law. Our hero Porco is shot down in a dogfight with a self styled air ace called Curtis.
Porco must rebuild his plane, Fight Mama Aiuto, run from the Italian government, engage in a final showdown with Curtis whilst courting the lovely Gina and saving young school girls from the clutches of Mama Aiuto, pay back Papa Piccolo for the renovation of his airplane, win a bet, break the curse, and save himself in the bargain.
Is this too much for our hero Porco? Can he face up to the challenge and come out with style and grace? You just have to watch this charming and amazingly well drawn, written, funny film to discover the conclusion. From the man who brought you "Tonari No Totoro" (My Neighbor Totoro), "Kiki's Delivery Service" and "
". Its worth the wait !!!

Popotan is the story of three sisters, 
, Mai, 
, (sorry, no 
 here), as well as their pet ferret, Unagi, and their housekeeper, Mea. 
 has very large breasts and the ability to speak to plants. She is a bad cook as well, but that doesn't stop her from doing the cooking. 
 dreams of being a magical girl and can heal people. She also has a very unhealthy fixation with anything soft and round. Mai is the most sensible of the three. She is very sensitive about her smaller bosoms, and gets angry when references are made to it.
They run a Christmas shop out of their home, which magically transports through time and space. Mea is their maid. She is usually the calm in the storm of their lives. Unagi is a cute ferret that can transform into a human girl. Their adventures consist of them going around and helping others while searching for an elusive young woman known as "The One." Popotan, it turns out, is their word for dandelions. 
 spends a lot of time talking to the dandelions, as they guide her on the quest. Mea has a very dark secret that could destroy them all, and how does the mysterious Keith fit into all of this?
I don't want to spoil too much, but I will say the ending is a heartwarming tearjerker.
The 
 classification is for nudity by 
, Mea, and Mai.

This is a tale that takes place in the Japan of lore, where the gods of nature walk the earth in the form of beasts, and where the progress of mankind threatens to topple the delicate balance that remains.
 slays a boar god maddended a mysterious plague, but not before he himself becomes infected by the same plague. Searching for answers and a cure, he journeys west, where he encounters an industrial village that threatens the sanctity of a sacred forest watched over by wolf gods.
He also encounters a girl, 
, and learns that she goes by another name: Princess Mononoke [Mononoke Hime]. She stands with the wolf gods in the fight against the villagers. Now, 
 must choose sides in this rapidly-escalating war... and he must decide soon, for even now the plague continues to ravage him. Can this war explain the plague... and provide a cure?

The raccoons of Tama Hills have long lived the peaceful life, coexisting with humans, inhabiting the areas nearby the farmhouses, and enjoying the perks that humans provide them, such as convenient and tasty food. Their days were easy and carefree... and then one fateful season all the humans just left. Although the raccoons didn't know quite what to make of it, they eventually settled into the fact that they had all the land to themselves. At first it was actually kind of nice, as they got to move in to the comfy old houses that were no longer occupied. Ah, but soon they realized exactly what was happening... it all became clear on that day in which the humans' giant machines started tearing down the old houses and tearing up the forest.

The humans were starting to develop the land, destroying the raccoons' forest home, transforming the once quaint rural area into suburbs for which many more humans would occupy. As the land shrank and food became more scarce, the raccoons began to fight amongst themselves... but eventually, thanks to a wise old raccoon, they realized that if they continued in this manner, they would wipe themselves out. The raccoons knew that something had to be done to stop the humans' development, not just to protect their homes, but to ensure their survival. And so they held a meeting, and together with the village elders they came up with a five year plan to stop the humans from destroying their habitat.

The meat of their plan involved resurrecting their ancient technique of transformation, in which the raccoons can morph themselves into anything they wish, pots, trees, foxes, and even humans. They figured that by mastering this technique, they could easily convince the humans to move on to other places. And so the elders began the hard task of training all the raccoons in this art form. It soon became clear, however, that not every raccoon could learn this technique, and not everyone who could learn it could do it well. But there were those who did, and they practiced hard, fueled by the determination that they would be able to help save their home as well as future generations. However, the humans' development moved faster than expected, and so after only a year, they raccoons had little choice but to start taking action.

And so they began. It was a dark and stormy night, and they used it to their advantage, by transforming into things such as a falling trees and false roads which caused the truck drivers to wreck their vehicles. Several humans were killed, but to the raccoons it was a glorious success which warranted a celebration, because raccoons love to celebrate! But the tragedies only barely slowed down construction of the suburbs. And so, not wanting to hurt any more of the humans, the raccoons turned instead to playing pranks in order to scare them into thinking that the spirits were against the development of their land. But no matter how many people the raccoon scared off, more were trucked in.

Left with little choice, the raccoons had to go and seek out help from the ancient transformation masters, and so they sent two of their most adept shape-changers to find these masters and bring them back to the village. It will take a lot of endurance and more than a little luck to locate the masters in time, and even if they do, will it be enough to save the forest from the overbearing and determined humans? I know, I know, this sounds like some kind of heavy drama, but believe me, there really is a lot of comedy in here as well. I mean, just think about it, raccoons morphing into pots, ghosts, and even humans... how is that NOT funny, especially when the strain of holding the shape begins to take its toll and you see them start to revert to the normal shape.

Yeah, this film does have serious overtones, but it also has a lot of comedic characters and silly situations. For instance, when one of the major raccoon players was extremely upset and spouting on and on about how all humans need to be destroyed, all of them, no matter what, he soon becomes distracted by the thought of tempura and other human foods, causing him to recant his statement because he misses the food so much. Or during another part of the film when some raccoons user their transformation technique to enlarge their testicles to enormous proportions in order to squish people with them. Hmm, I think now would be a good time to tell a bit about the folklore that's used heavily in this film.

First off, the raccoons... well, they're not actually raccoons. They're really a creature called a tanuki (タヌキ) that's native to Japan and is very similar in many ways to raccoons. In Japanese lore, tanuki have two distinctive features, the first being the magical ability to shape-shift. There are many Japanese stories about tanukis transforming into all sorts of different things, like tea kettles, tree branches, or even monks. The second distinctive feature are their very large testicles, which in the US dub are called "pouches". You can see this in many of the tanuki statues, and even more so in character art where they will even have their scrotum flung over their shoulder like a pack or bang on them like they would their belly.
The Disney release of this DVD was done pretty well, as one would expect, except for one thing... the second disc is completely worthless. The first disc contains the movie, with both a well done English dialog track and a Japanese dialog track with English subtitles. The second disc contains "all" the bonus features, which are Original Storyboards, TV Spots, and Trailers. Yep, that's it. A whole entire second disc just for that. Where's the making of featurette people? I mean, they didn't even include anything on Japanese folklore! What's the point of including this second disc and driving the price up for no reason?! Bad Disney! Bad!
