 however, turns into a rather buxom read-haired girl. When splashed with hot water, they return to their original form.
To complicate matters, 
 has promised his old friend, 
, to marry his son 
 off to one of 
's three daughters. 
, age 19, 
, age 17, and 
, age 16. When 
 and 
 arrive in cursed form, nobody knows WHAT to think. To make things worse, 
, a tom-boyish young girl, gets defeated in practice by 
 (female form), then stumbles onto 
's secret when she encounters 
 (male form) in the shower, both of them naked.
After sorting things out, 
 and 
 decide 
 should be 
's fiance, because "
 hates boys, and since 
 is half-girl...". 
 and 
 get in a fight immediately, which ends up with 
 calling 
 "un-cute", and 
 smashing 
 over the head with a table. A beautiful start to a beautiful relationship.
Ranma 1/2 is a romantic comedy, and things only get worse for 
 as fiances and people continually pop up to fight 
. Will Ranma ever get rid of his horrible curse?
Ranma 1/2 lasted 7 seasons on Japanese television, and then spawned 11 OVA episodes and 3 movies. The first two movies (
 and 
) were feature length films, while the third movie was only a half-hour in length. Thus, that one was compiled into the OVA set when released by VIZ. When VIZ brought out the TV show in America, they gave each season a unique title:

The story starts out as a young girl is yelling at a panda that she doesn't want to get married. She starts fighting with the panda, but the panda wins and hoists the girl over his shoulder.
Meanwhile, 
 is telling his three daughters that one of them is going to marry a young boy named 
. 
 doesn't seem interested in the idea. Then, a panda arrives with the girl on his shoulder, kicking and screaming. The girl introduces herself as being 
. 
 faints, and 
 asks 
 if she would like to have a sparring match. 
 agrees.
 is easily beaten by 
, but they are so sweaty that 
 tells 
 that she should take a bath. 
 declines at first, but then finally goes to take one. When 
 goes to the bathhouse, she thinks that it would be all right if she took a bath with 
 since they are both girls.
When 
 goes in all the way, she sees a boy in the bathhouse. She runs down the hall screaming, "THERE'S A PERVERT IN THE BATHROOM!" When the boy comes out, he introduces himself as being 
. All of a sudden 
's dad, 
, starts explaining that while on their ten year training trip, he and his son both fell into a cursed spring. 
 fell into the Spring of the Drowned Panda, while 
 fell into the Spring of the Drowned Girl.
 does not think that it's so bad. So, he asks 
 which girl he would would like to marry. The two sisters elect 
 since she doesn't like boys and 
 is half girl.

Raimuiro Senkitan is a 13-episode anime that's like 
, 
, and any magical girl anime like 
, 
, 
, and 
, but with marine girls with a psychic link to unmanned mechas. Some people don't like this anime, but many others favor it. It's considered a cute anime.
The anime takes place during the Russo-Japanese war in the year 1904 (37th Meji Era year) where Shintaro Umakai, a former Japanese diplomat, becomes a teacher for five young girls aboard a flying navy boat named Amanohara. But these are no ordinary girls; they have special powers, known as Konjiki, which allow them to operate their mechas, called Raimu, against Russian Raimu units led by Grigori Rasputin. These Russian Raimu often attack Amanohara during its travels to Port Arthur for the final battle.

Akazukin Cha-Cha is the story of a young witch-- around fourth grade-- who lives atop a mountain called Mochi-Mochi Mountain with her mentor and 'father' of sorts, Seravi. Her close friends are Shiine, an exceptional wizard-in-training, and Leah, a boy with the ability to turn into a white wolf, and they are constantly vying for her affections. Her other acquaintances, Blackhooded Yakko, Orin, and Marin, attend the same school that she herself does, Urara's School (literal translation from the Japanese name for the school). There, they learn to cast spells, conjure up potions, and survive their eccentric professors just in time to come home for dinner.
In the manga version, Cha-Cha and her friends are only young people learning magic at Urara's School, but in the anime, Shiine, Leah, and Cha-Cha each possess a magical item that allows Cha-Cha to transform into the magical princess Holy-Up. Holy-Up is an older version of Cha-Cha, who appears to be around 15 - 16 years old. She constantly battles against the dark minions of Daimaoh, a demon king whose past is intertwined with that of the Cha-Cha and even Seravi. Of course, there is still much room for the humor that's a hallmark of this series.

The story as I've been able to put together is that the series 
 was licensed and dubbed by Joe Oriolo at Oriolo Film Studios initially for the U.S. market in 1971. 52 English episodes scripts were written and the lines dubbed. Unfortunately, the business arrangement between Joe Oriolo and his then partner, Burt Hecht, fell apart, and as part of the settlement, the Hecht departed with the "Princess Knight" masters never to be heard from again. For over 20 years anime historians were unable to confirm whether Hecht or subsequent owners of the property ever got it into any of the U.S. markets. This is why most people have never seen it, or know of its existence.
The series, however, was marketed to other English speaking countries where it ran in syndication for years as it did in Australia beginning in November of 1972 at 4:30pm on channel 7.

It has been recently established that Princess Knight did indeed play in select U.S. markets in the 1970s. It showed up in Hawaii in the early 1970s, in Texas in the mid 1970s, and the Minneapolis/St.Paul area first in 1978 and again in 1982-1983 on KSTP-TV, Channel 5. Other information that it may have run on Nickelodeon many years back as a part of a retro/nostalgia marathon, but this has yet to be confirmed.
An interesting note: Before the split between Joe Oriolo and Bert Hecht, Joe's son, Don Oriolo, and a fellow named Roger Grod, managed to edit several of the episodes together for a theatrical release, giving it the title "Choppy and the Princess". Don managed to get it into a few cinemas, but it didn't do too well. It also had a weak video release. We also know that it was released on home video in both the U.K. and in Australia in the early 90's.
In 1996, the Princess Knight masters minus the opening and closing credits turn up in the hands of some company in the Netherlands. Streamline Pictures in California got the masters and was busy negotiating with Orion for the distribution when the deal fell through. Orion was in financial trouble at the time and has since been bought-out by MGM. Now, MGM holds the "Prince Planet" and "Johnny Sokko and His Flying Robot" masters which had been in the Orion library. As for Princess Knight, the masters are back with the folks in The Netherlands and Shawne Kleckner at 
 (a company committed to rescuing classic anime from oblivion) is trying to negotiate for the series release.
Another interesting note: In 1967, Oriolo's only other attempt at the anime market in the U.S. was a series christened "Johnny Cypher in Dimension Zero" to be released and distributed through Seven Arts. Again, episodes were licensed, scripted and dubbed, but before it could be released Warner Brothers bought Seven Arts and squashed the release in the U.S. for unknown reasons. Don Oriolo gave me some vague explanation but it is still unclear why it was done. He still has all the masters in his archives but can't do a thing with them unless WB gives the OK and they obviously have no plans to do so. (Actually, several people saw this show broadcast in the U.S. More info can be found at the 
.)

The king and the queen have a daughter, and the queen can't have more children. Since only a boy can be king, she is disguised and trained as such. Enemies in the court, such as Neelon, spy her every move, and there is a Duke that always caused problems as well. A little angel, Choppy, is her companion as she goes through a total of 54 (?) episodes, meeting such characters as a very mean and powerful sorcerer and his daughter, who becomes her best friend.
In the last episodes, her parents are killed by a powerful invader, and she has to retake the kingdom with the help of her few remaining friends, after which her parents are given back to her.
I forgot to mention that she sometimes acts under the disguise of the Phantom Knight -- or something like that, I saw the series in French -- and the young prince of the neighboring kingdom marries (or gets engaged to) her when he finds out that she's a girl, therefore providing for a happy ending.
All in all, a wonderful series that I would LOVE to see on DVD someday.

The story at the start shows babies in heaven ready to be given a heart, which will decide whether they will be male or female (pink for girl blue for boy). The angel kid was mischievous and changed the princess' heart from a blue one to a pink one, hence she is born a girl.
The angel was then sent to retrieve her soul and give her the right one. Also, as the story progresses the king is deposed (I am not sure why or how, I think it was a invasion) and the Queen and the princess are sent into prison. The Princess finds a way out of the prison and begins to fight for justice in the surrounding countryside (a la Robin Hood, Zorro) as the Phantom Knight.

A message from Lazar West, who used to watch Princess Knight religiously on Sky-Channel in Switzerland, tells us that the basics of the show involved a princess who would dress up in disguise as a lad to fight bad guys, while trying to keep her identity a secret.

According to a message from Reece, he lived in Hawaii during the early 70's, where they showed a lot of anime and live-action Japanese shows. Because of this, Reece has been able to confirm that Princess Knight also aired in Hawaii, on 
 television, between Kikaida and Kamen Raida (two popular, live-action sci-fi Japanese shows). Someone else noted that they watched it in the early 1970s on 
, Honolulu as part of an afterschool children's show called 
.
An email from Al says that he can also verify that Princess Knight aired in the US, both in Hawaii (from 1970-73) and Sunday mornings in Texas (mid 1970's). Then Anthony says that he distinctly recalls watching it as early as the late 1970s and as late as 1983 to 1985 on 
. Dustin confirms that it was airing around 1982-1983 where he watched it early Saturday mornings in Minnesota (near Minneapolis).
Some info sent by Adam sheds some new light on the story of Princess Knight. He says that her father is king of their country, and the law only allows men to take the throne.  The Queen either died or is unable to have more children, so they must hide the fact that she is a girl.  She had some sort of companion/guardian named Choppy (a little angel I think) to help keep her out of trouble.

They call him the Road Buster. He's wanted by the police, but they have been unable to stop Chicago's most famous courier.
It doesn't matter if it's legal or not. For the right price, he'll get you or your cargo where it needs to go.
However, when 
 is offered $50,000 to take a girl to safety, little does he and his partner 
 realize that they are about to be framed for kidnapping and pursued by the police like never before.
This time, it's become a race for survival!

In 2387 the planet Maris, considered a Second Earth, is attacked by the Noza Empire. The Nozas need Maris to lay the eggs of the next generation of its race, before all the current generation perishes. However, they are unaware of the whereabouts of three pistols of immense power and the only ones capable of eliminating the Nozas. These weapons are discovered by the colonists and dubbed the Zillion weapon system, named for the ancient civilization that created them. Powered by an element dubbed Zillium that is generated by power packs, the energy from these strange yet powerful weapons can engulf and disintegrate even a Noza. A team of three forms to wield the Zillion guns and fight back: the White Knights.
The movie "Burning Night" [Kakiyakyoku Burning Night] takes place after the Noza war, when the White Knights have become a rock band. It is then that a new threat has appeared, and with very bad timing, for the Zillion pistols can't be found!

Continuing the story of 
 along a new track, 
 is the story of three sister sleuths who live in Hong Kong. They run the self-explanatory "Three Sisters Detective Agency". Their current charge is 
, an author who has suddenly become the target of a mad bomber. What 
 will discover is that her new protectors have something special about them, something she's seen in one other person: 
. These sisters have the power over paper!
Note: The "sisters" actually have no relation or common bond except for their paper powers.

is a young 17 year old boy whose life changes in a single day. Living in a world called Tokyo Jupiter created by a mysterious force name Mu. All he learned was a lie, that the only civilization on the Earth is Tokyo. Instead, Tokyo Jupiter is a barrier to the outside world were time stands still.
 and a mysterious girl name 
 discover a robotic deity name RahXephon, and now 
 must learn the truth. Who is he? Who is RahXephon? Why is the enemies' blood blue?
This anime will boggle your mind and takes several times over to get all of it.

Ragnarok is an anime based on the Famous game "Ragnarok Online". The story begins in Midgard, in the city of Prontera at a cemetery. After 
's brother Keogh's death, 
 is very sad but promises that she will not feel bad! 
 is her childhood friend who hangs around with her (and obviously likes her). Since he is a swordsman, he is much stronger then 
, who is an Acolyte (healer), so he protects her. It's funny when someone asks "are you two lovers" and 
 says "No, we are just childhood friends", 
 gets disappointed.
After they visit Keogh's grave, they come across an alley where a thief and a blacksmith are harassing a mage called Takius. Takius decides to join 
 and 
 on their journey. Along the way, they meet a cute little Merchant called Maya, though she prefers to be called Ma-chan. When they meet her in Geffen, the city of magic, she hangs around them.
When they all get to Geffen tower, they encounter a bunch of Whisper's (ghosts/monsters). 
 and Takius aren't able to hit them with physical or magical attacks, and Ma-chan seems to abandon the group, but then comes back with a Flamberg (special sword) and hands it to 
. After that, she decides to stay with them!
Soon after, 
, 
, Takius, and Ma-chan meet one of 
 and 
's friends, Irruga (an assassin) and a newcomer Judia (a hunter). 
 and Judia fight over Irruga at the beginning (note: 
 doesn't love him), but later they become friends!
Through the series, 
 advances from an acolyte to a priest, and 
 to a crusader, and finally Takius becomes a Sage.
But who is the mysterious person who looks like Keogh? Will they ever find out? Guess you'll just have to see it for yourselves.

Mysterious figures known only as I-Jin, who appear to be the clones of history's most remarkable individuals, attack! In response to these attacks, the Royal British Library's Division of Special Operations sends one of its most unique operatives: 
, a mild mannered bookworm with the unusual ability to manipulate paper in any way she sees fit. 
 is aided by the likes of 
 and Drake Anderson to face the threat of the I-Jin.

Noein, also known as 
 (
) is a 13 volume manga and 24 episode anime that revolves around the amazing discovery of a group of seventh graders on one fateful night. Haruka, Yuu, and their other friends go out ghost hunting at a cemetery near town. Yuu is forced to go to cram school after his mother picks him up from the cemetery when she finds out he didn't go. Then, the group left off where their investigation took place. Haruka spots blue snow, but Ai remarks that it's impossible since it's summer. The rest of the group except Haruka go further up the cemetery and by an amazing shock they've found a ghost!
The group comes running back and Ai grabs Haruka's hand to make sure she catches up on the running. Haruka realizes the ghost is after her, she is known as the "Dragon's Torque", posseses it, and that's what the "ghost" wants. Actually, it's a human from the future. Haruka follows another path to lead them away from her friends. Yuu comes back to save Haruka, as he knows something's gone wrong. In an attempt to save Haruka, he finds out that the "ghost" is actually him in 15 years (his name is Karasu). And there is another Yuu known as "Karasu" from another timespace. He, on the other hand, is most likely to be on the bad side. Both Yuu and Karasu agree that Noein is nothing like them.
Haruka and Yuu have been led on an adventure to further learn about the different time spaces and the future. La'cryma is one of the timespaces that protects humanity, and Shangri'la wants to destroy them. The key to stopping Shangri'la is the Dragon's Torque, aka Haruka Kaminogi.

creator: Kazuki Akane
title: Noein- Mou Hitori no Kimi e

description:
An ancient Japanese legend speaks of the flesh of the mermaid.
If one were to partake of this...and survive...that one becomes an immortal.
It's not easy, being timeless and invulnerable to practically everything save decapitation.
Yuta partook of the Mermaid's flesh 500 years ago, and to this day he has been wandering, searching for a way to become mortal again.
The year is 1936, and Yuta has been alone all this time.
Now, he finds himself caught in the middle of a scheme by one who desires that which Yuta wishes to get rid of.
Rumiko Takahashi is better known for her comedy works, but Mermaid Forest is based on the second of Takahashi's uniquely macabre "Mermaid" series of manga, which began with A Mermaid Never Smiles and continues on with 
, another title that eventually became an anime OVA.

"Noir, it is the name of an ancient fate.

Two maidens who govern death.

The peace of the newly born, their black hands protect."
 is a professional assassin for hire who has left her past behind. 
 is a girl who has lost her past, but knows only that she is an assassin called "NOIR", one of the most feared assassins in the world. They team up to make a pilgrimage to the past to find 
's memory under the name NOIR. Together, they travel around the world, being hired to kill and hoping to find the answers they seek.

It is said that one who eats the flesh of a Mermaid will grant a person eternal youth. It's been 500 years since Yuta has eaten a Mermaids flesh and has spent much of his Eternal life trying to find one in order to make him age again.
However, Yuta eventually finds one, but discovers she and her companions have been raising a girl named Mana in order to devour her so they can keep their youthful appearance. This is how Mermaids stay young.
Yuta kills the mermaids and rescues the girl, however fails to find the secret to grant him time again. However, Yuta quickly gets over it and finds companionship with Mana. Together, they both try to find the secret of lifting their immortality.

After a severe ankle injury prematurely ends the promising ballet career of Rin Ogota, she enrolls in college. While there, she encounters a club dedicated to ridebacks – transformable mecha resembling motorcycles. She soon finds that her natural talents are perfectly suited to these machines, and enthusiastically becomes a member.
However, Rin soon finds herself enmeshed in a global conspiracy involving the ruling Global Government Plan (GGP), and the radical Borderless Military Alliance (BMA). At the same time, Rin discovers some startling secrets involving her rideback Fuego... that it is of a special design!

Awesome characters combined with stunning animation make Night Warriors one of the best Anime films I've seen. It is based on the PlayStation One videogame Darkstalkers.
Donovan is half-human and half-Darkstalker, and travels from country to country fighting different characters because he has hated of his dirty blood for as long as he can remember. He spends his days using his great power to destroy all the Darkstalkers.
The sisters, Hsien-ko and Rei-ling, fighting the Darkstalkers to avenge their mother's death.
Demitri and Morrigan are the rulers of their own domains, seeking to control the Dark's world.
Then there is Felicia, a cat-woman who wants to be a good person and lead a normal life, free of prejudice.
And finally, Pyron, an alien who only wants to be the absolute ruler of the universe.

Based on the third installment of Rumiko Takahashi's macabre "Mermaid" series comes this continuation of the story of an immortal who doesn't wish to be so anymore.
For 500 years, Yuta has been searching for something that may relieve him of this curse of immortality that came when he ate the flesh of the mermaid.
At least now, he doesn't have to travel alone.
Mana, an immortal like him, travels alongside.
However, their travels now take them to a place with many mysteries...a place where one who is like them has his own plans for Mana, plans which he is willing to do anything to achieve.

Narumi Jinguji is the chief of medicine at a respectable hospital, and things are going well. But Narumi has a plan to make things even better... at least, for herself. She has decided to open a new ward in a building disconnected from the hospital, a ward in which the nurses will cater to the patients' each and every desire... and I mean 
 desire! But in order for this dream to come to fruition, she'll need nurses that are willing to take on these special tasks. Of course, those kind of nurses are definitely not easy to come by. So since "Willing Sex Slave" is not a part of the standard employment application, she decides to enlist an old acquaintance from 10 years ago to help her out, a one Dr. Ryuji Hirasaka.

Dr. Hirasaka is a gynecologist, but hasn't been practicing in 10 years, so when he receives an offer for a month-long contract at the hospital, he doesn't ask any questions. We're not sure why he hasn't worked for so long, but were given glimpses into some kind of "experiment" he was supposedly doing at the hospital with a busty, naked, green-haired woman. Anyway, as he arrives, he spies a young nurse outside picking flowers. His imagination begins to run wild with fantasies, until she snaps him out of it by speaking to him. It turns out she works in the gynecology department... lucky him!

Soon afterward, Dr. Hirasaka heads up to meet his boss. As he enters the chief's office, he is shocked and speechless to see Ms. Jinguji sitting in the big chair behind the desk. His thoughts immediately turn to the conclusion that she must have called him here to take revenge, but she soon calms the panicked fellow. As she reveals her plan for the ultimate sex ward, he begins to understand why she called him. He has a talent that not very many people have, which is being able to turning innocent young girls into willing sex slaves! Eagerly, Dr. Hirasaka agrees to participate in her scheme, but says he needs a contract. Not willing to put anything in writing which would leave a paper trail, Narumi seals the deal with an "oral" agreement, if you know what I mean. And if you don't know what I mean, then you probably shouldn't be reading this!

The first assignment Narumi gives Dr. Hirasaka just happens to be the young nurse he met earlier. He finally locates her in a patient's room, where he sees her talking to the muscular young man in way more fitting a girlfriend than a nurse. But it's when he sees them kiss that he becomes enraged with jealousy, and even more determined to make her his sex slave. When she is then called to the front to meet with some visitors, he follows, and discovers that she's paying these tough looking fellows to keep quiet about an incident which would disgrace her patient, who's apparently a famous young boxer.

This is exactly what the doctor needs to blackmail the young nurse. So before she heads home for the night, our good doctor calls her into his office for a little chat, which quickly turns into an uninvited grope session. Hirasaka reveals to her what he knows as she continues to struggle free, and when she pleads with him not to tell anybody, he stops for a moment, and agrees. We get to see her eyes light up and a smile cross her face for the first since she entered the room, at least until his hands begin wandering again. C'mon girl, how could you have not seen that coming?! You seriously think he would bring you into his office, feel you up, then agree to keep your secret and let you leave?

Well, it's not long before sex slave number one has started her "training" that Narumi provides Dr. Hirasaka with his second assignment, a young nurse (aren't they all?) involved in some kind of mistake that caused a patient to end up in the ICU (that's short for Intensive Care Unit, where you go when you're really bad off). And if that wasn't bad enough, the patient eventually died. Thus once again the good doctor has the blackmail he needs to make distraught young woman into a nice little sex slave. Her initiation goes pretty much the same way as the previous one, with a little variation in the sex and the props involved. And wouldn't ya know it, but so far both girls have been virgins.

The problem comes the day after, when she runs into him outside on the hospital grounds. She reveals to him that she's decided to go and tell the police everything, her involvement with patient's accident and Dr. Hirasaka's assault. That's when he pulls a little digital video cassette from his pocket, explaining that if he had their entire experience on the little tape, and had no problem making it public if she talked. So what does she have to do to get the tape back, you ask? Yeah... you know... yeah. And if you don't know, then go away, 'cause you shouldn't be reading this! So Dr. Hirasaka figures why wait, and pulls her through some bushes where they immediately start going at it. Surprisingly enough, when he finishes he actually gives her the tape. Maybe he's not such a bad guy after all... oh wait, you mean that tape was just a copy? Yeah, he's still such a bad guy.

For the doctor's third assignment, things get a little trickier. With nothing on her to blackmail, the doctor has to set her up and 
 something to blackmail her on. It takes some ingenuity on his part, but of course he succeeds, and once we get past that, it's back to the same method of training for the young lass. Then, just when you're ready see what's going to happen to these nurses now that they're "trained", the anime ends. Just like that. Yep, I trained me some nurses, the end. In order to find out what happens with the young ladies, what Narumi's real intentions are, and what happens with the creation of the sex ward, you'll need to pick up the sequel... or at least I would hope so, because it's obviously frustrating when something you're watching just ends without closer.

Mankind is under siege by "nightbreeds" – carnivorous, manipulative demons who often prey upon human weaknesses in order to seek the "light." It is up to Tatsuhiko Shido and his friends to stop these demons before they wreak havok.
With a story almost reminiscent of the novels of Anne Rice, "Night Walker" is the tale of a vampire with no memory of his past, and his battle to save mankind from hell on Earth – as well as finding the puzzle of his past.

In the 21st Century, aliens have finally arrived on Earth and are co-existing with humanity. However, with this huge event NieA focuses on a small one. Specifically, a girl named Mayuko Chigasaki, who lives in the small peaceful town of Ehohanawho and has an alien named NieA for a roommate.
Mayuko is a literally starving student, and NieA is a low-class (Under Seven) alien. However, while Mayuko makes strong efforts to make ends meet and get through each day, NieA misbehaves and has no concern for the consequences of her actions, constantly putting her at odds with Mayuko. Will this literally "odd couple" earn their living and make it to tomorrow?

is a 21-year-old guy who dropped out from a university. He had been thinking that everything that happens around him is a conspiracy, so because of the conspiracy he goes into a life as a "Hikikomori" (people who shut themselves in).
He ends up finding out who is behind this conspiracy, and it is the N.H.K. The Nihon Hikikomori Kyōkai is a broadcast company that shows many programs and even animations. "When you think anime, you think otaku. When you think otaku, you think people that dislike other people."
Suddenly, a neat and cute looking girl Nakahara Misaki appears. She feels sorry for 
 being a hikikomori. She wants to help him with her "Project" of rehabilitation. 
 tells her that he has no problem and lies that he a programmer of computers. Masaki ask to see the so-called program he is making. He told her it's not done yet.
In a month's time, he has to make a program. Kind of hard, seeing as how he knows nothing about programming. Then he found his old high school classmate, Yamazaki Kaoru, was living next door... and just happens to be a programming student and an Anime Otaku who's into dating games.
Would Kaoru help him make this program? Or will he do Masaki's Project?

title: Ninja Nonsense: The Legend of Shinobu

description:
Ninja Nonsense tells the wacked-out tale of Shinobu, a young Ninja hopeful in training. In order to test her Ninja abilities, she is given the rather twisted test of having to steal all the High School girls panties. At the first house she stops at, she is caught by an ordinary High School student named Kaede Shiranui.
Becoming the voice of reason, the two become good friends. However, a strange round yellow creature named Onsokumaru (who claims to be a Ninja Master) keeps getting in their way. As it turns out, this lecherous creature was the one who sent Shinobu on her mission. But Shinobu is far from excellent in her Ninja abilities. Will Shinobu ever become a true Ninja? And will Onsokumaru be exposed for the lecherous fake that he is?

related.name: Tenchi the Movie: Tenchi Muyo in Love
Tenchi the Movie 2: The Daughter of Darkness
Tenchi Muyo! GXP: Galaxy Police Transporter

description:
A bright light in the sky, then a crash catches 
's attention one autumn day. When he gets to the crash site, he finds 
, a space pirate who's on the run from a ditzy Galaxy Police woman. What happens next turns 
's life upside-down as more beauties from the stars, as well as a mad genius buried in the cave near the family shrine, show up on his doorstep.
This TV series, which differs greatly from the OVA series, follows the Masaki clan as they run afoul with a beautful bounty hunter, then the whole Galaxy Police and Jurai navy as they head into one big adventure for in which 
 finds his ultimate destiny.

related.name: Tenchi the Movie: Tenchi Muyo in Love
Tenchi Muyo! in Love 2: Haruka Nara Omoi
Tenchi Muyo! GXP: Galaxy Police Transporter

description:
In a far-off land, a competition is held every four years. Women from all around compete is this tournament, the prize being the winner is declared queen of the continent. Now the rules are clear: the competitors must be 12 years of age or older, they don't have to be human or citizens of the land, any weapon can be used... and killing is allowed! The winner of each match is the woman who either kills her opponent, disables her, or forces her to flee for her life.
Reina, a vagabond warrior, never intended to enter the Queen's Blade tournament, instead using her skills to bring justice to the land. But a chance encounter with the thief Listy – as well as her disappearance – causes the girl to walk a path which will eventually lead her to the city of Gainos, the seat of the contest!

related.name: Captain Harlock and the Queen of a Thousand Years

description:
hardly does justice to this work, a rather unique title set 1,000 years before the tales of 
 and 
.
There is a planet that drifts through space, a planet known as Lar Metal, home to an advanced civilization. Every 1,000 years, Lar Metal passes close to Earth, bringing chaos and disaster to Earth. During this time, one of Lar Metal comes to Earth see her homeworld through this passing and to await the time when it will come again. She is the Millennial Queen.
The time for Lar Metal's next passing draws near, and the signs are not good. Lar Metal is to pass closest to Earth on September 9, 1999, at 9:09:09 (a reference to 
) and bring about near-apocalyptic destruction. Time is running out as Professor Amamori struggles to see what can be done to save humanity. Meanwhile, his assistant, Yayoi, begins a course of her own, one which only she knows. Together with Professor Aramari's nephew, Hajime, she also hopes to save Earth...for though she is the Millennial Queen, she is no longer able to stand idly by and watch her homeworld bring unnecessary destruction.
The queen is also the mother of 
 and Emeraldes. She gets her her body mechnized by the crazed cyborg scientist Hardgear, which turns her into the robot you see in 
. Her full name is Queen La Andromeda Prometheum.
Queen Millennia can be noted for three things. First, Yayoi has an appearance of both fragility and strength that makes her a memorable character. Second, the background soundtrack is very haunting, an interesting feast for the ears. Third, many of the characters in Queen Millennia bear resemblance to characters in 
 (and the connections shown in Adieu Galaxy Express 999 make it even more prominent), so do not be surprised to think that those characters are also in Queen Millennia. It merely appears that way.

creator: Leiji Matsumoto
title: Shin Taketori Monogatari Sennen Jo'oo
The Queen of a Thousand Years

description:
The story starts with two high school girls Mafuyu and Tomo, who are enrolled at the Japanese Eastern Orthodox school St. Mihailov Academy, where they are looked down upon, teased and harassed by other students, that especially from the daughter of the current principle Miyuri Tsujidou.
However, this all changes once they find a white-haired Russian boy, and nursed him back to full health. Soon, they learn that the boys name is Alexander "Sasha" Nikolaevich Hell, and he too, ends up being transferred into their class. Also, his cool-attitude somewhat repays Mafuya and Tomo as he repels all the other students but them.
His only reason for staying is due to the fact that he is a qwaser; One who possesses super-natural powers to control one type of chemical element.
Being the qwaser of Iron, he was unfortunately discarded by the Adepts, a private organization who experiments on creating qwasers.
Now living in the academy, he must prevent the Adepts from retrieving the 'Theotokos of Tsarytsin' from Athos.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam Wing
Gundam Wing
Mobile Suit Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz

description:
"I am 
. Just as this vast ocean of stars is
never-ending, so is the pledge I have made together with the 
. I have made this pledge to honor the ones I trust and the
one I love. In them, I find the reason to live the way I do. I hope to
reflect this to others. My oath will never fade. I know my fate. I know
my destiny. I was born to fulfill this purpose. I am Emerldas."
For the first time, the universe of Leiji Matsumoto brings us an
adventure featuring the woman who, alongside Captain Harlock, is a
legend in her own right. Despite the loneliness in her heart, she fights
for justice and peace, as much a necessity in this universe as the stars
though which she roams.
An innocent space colony has come under the attack of a would-be master
race. It is now up to 
 to help free the colonists and stop the
tyranny, but she faces a devious enemy, one who is willing to hold the
colonists hostage and who has become determined to stop 
 no
matter what it takes.

In Shanghai in 1931, following the events of the First Sino-Japanese War, the Russo-Japanese War and World War I, the Sakurai Organization is investigating events and intrigues going on in that city. A few young people in that organization, all with fantastic powers, are trying to fit together the goings-on as best as they can – all which will inevitably lead Japan to World War II!

Pretear is the story of 16 year old 
, who just happens live an anything but ordinary life. Her father, a struggling author, has just gotten married to the wealthiest woman in the city. Now 
 has to struggle with being the outcast, living with two strange sisters, and having to save the world.
On her way to school she runs into 
, literally. She bowled him over coming out of some bushes. It is then that 
 realizes 
 is the girl they have been looking for all along.
 is a knight of a place called Leafe. The Princess of Destruction is beginning to make herself known once again, and it's up to him and his band of anything but ordinary fighters, to stop her. But to do so, they need the great power of the Pretear.
Now, 
 is being dragged into the ride of her life, as she discovers, she is the Pretear. As she goes through battling hords of demon seeds, she will figure out that life, and love, come in some of the weirdest forms ever.

In this TV series,

Along the way,

description:
is the first anime of a long running series in Japan (from 1990 - 1997 for the whole series, OVA and all).
We, however, are interested in the very first series!
Lamune is a normal young boy who apparently loves playing video games. One day after school, however, he encounters a mysterious young girl selling a video game called "King Sccasher". Lamune helps the girl to sell all the copies before taking even a small gander at the game, and realizes she had just disappeared.
When he came home he immediately started playing the game and beat it on the same night he started. After beating it, the girl he saw from earlier introduced herself, saying her name was Milk, and pushed him into the game!
Now Lamune has to save their world, as he is the direct blood relative of Lamuness, the hero of their World. He is helped by Cocoa, Da Sider, and Miruku.

 and the heroic Tank Police.
This time, the Tank Police must contend, not only with political problems, but with the intrigues of a corrupt corporation who wants to kill the mayor.
As well, those sexy cat girls, the 
, 
, are there to add their unique blend of chaos as

The end... and the beginning.
The battle with the Angels is over, but there are more casualties than victors. 
 is catatonic,

SEELE, no longer trusting 
 to fulfill its agenda, forces the issue. When a takeover of the MAGI computers fails, the mysterious organization then has NERV's protection revoked. This prompts a bloody attack on NERV's Geo Front headquarters by the JSSDF, with the lives of the young pilots at stake. As events unfold during the attack, both NERV and the JSSDF unleash what both had fought so very hard to avoid... the onset of Third Impact... with 
 in the middle of it all!
Meanwhile,

.

description:
Shizuka only had a week before her family had to move. It was a difficult time for her, yet in that week she met a boy named Kosuke who befriended her. Twelve years later, the 17 year old Shizuka returns to Tokyo in order to find Kosuke.
What she find is that Kosuke is now a terrible lecher. But still, she holds out hope that he can solidify the flashes of decency that he shows (when he isn't getting it on with other girls in a variety of bizarre and comical situations), and commit himself to her. Episodes 2-4 of New Angel are possibly the most explicit non-violent hentai ever released here. Based on the controversial manga by U-Jin.

Nearly every hardcore anime fan knows the name Jubei Kibagami, from the extremely popular anime film 
... well, anyone whose old enough to watch the gruesome tale, that is. Anyway, now the masterless roaming swordsman is back, and this time he finds himself in his very own TV series. Hard to imagine, but it's true, and what's more amazing is that the television series retains a lot of the adult material found in the movie, such as creepy monsters, fountains of blood, and naked flesh. I doubt you'll be seeing this on US television anytime soon, but thanks to Urban Vision you can catch this action-packed series on DVD, and this way you get it uncut, and with both an English and Japanese language track.

All poor Jubei wants is to get a good nights rest. Is that really too much to ask? Well, according to the creatures battling it out over yonder, yes, yes it is. So Jubei heads on over to politely ask the warring parties to either keep it down or take their battle elsewhere, to which the fighters gladly comply... yeah, as if. But don't worry your pretty little head about Jubei, 'cause that guys knows how to take care of himself. With one swipe of his blade, Jubei splits one of the baddies straight in half, which causes another one to flee. The only remaining warrior, a strong, masked, werewolf-like creature named Roga, attempts to hire Jubei on as a bodyguard, but Jubei refuses, saying that he doesn't trust anyone who hides their face.

The next day we meet Shigure, a woman with some serious fighting skills whose trying to train the rest of her village to become great fighters... and things don't seem to be going to well. What she wouldn't give for at least one person to finally beat her in a match! Then she hears one of her homemade alarms go off, signaling that an intruder is entering their village. She rushes to the scene in a heartbeat, only to see our Jubei easily catching and defecting the arrows shot out by her booby trap. Amazed at his talent, the villagers allows Jubei to stay for a while and rest... but of course as soon as he does trouble comes about. Can we cut this guy a break people?!

It seems the female baddie that escaped the fray last night has enlisted the help of some kind of giant cyclops creature to help in obtaining the sacred Dragon Stone, a small pendent like item. The villagers immediately rip off their work clothes to reveal karate outfits underneath and start flicking ninja stars at the giant beast like it was second nature... seems like somebody's been holding something back from Shigure! While the cyclops monster takes out the village, Jubei takes on the evil female baddie from last night, and the werewolf warrior takes off after Shigure. He catches up quick, though we then see he's there to protect her. Unfortunately, he becomes fatally injured in the process.

After Jubei finally slices his foe in two, he comes across Roga, who hands him the Dragon Stone and asks him to deliver it to the Maiden of Light... aka Shigure! Jubei makes a promise that he will, and sets off after her, Shigure... the Light Maiden, and the last survivor of her village... but really, doesn't it seem like that's always the case? Anyway, on his journey to find her, he instead comes across some kind of cat woman who is just bound and determined to take the Dragon Stone... and she has friends. Meanwhile, Shigure is fleeing for her life from that giant cyclops creature from the other night... and fleeing along with her are two guys she had just recently met, a young thief and an old priest.

Now, we all know that Jubei easily takes out all of his adversaries, but what's surprising is that Shigure and her new posse are able to take out their foe, the giant cyclops that could easily crush them all with one stomp of his foot. Good work guys! So Jubei eventually catches up to the gang and hands over the Dragon Stone to Shigure, however he continues to travel with them... more or less... as they make their way to the city of Yagyu. It makes sense, as what kind of Ninja Scroll series would this be if Jubei just left for most of the series? Of course, it's also a good thing he stuck around to protect Shigure and the Dragon Stone since all kinds of very imaginative and creatively designed monster creatures are trying to get the blasted thing.

The DVD's include a bunch of extra features, like audio commentaries, various interviews, behind-the-scenes, a trivia game, clan profiles, the top ten battles, watching the creation of the cover art, an art gallery, and storyboard to feature comparisons. And these are spread out among the four discs, not just all crammed onto the last disc. The four disc 
 DVD set also includes a little booklet insert that gives short summaries for each of the thirteen episodes, plus lists all the chapters for each episode as well as some art scattered around. The DVD's are all single sided, too, with some nice artwork, so all in all, it's a nice package.

title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: Death and Rebirth

related.name: Neon Genesis Evangelion: End of Evangelion

description:
When the last chapter of 
 aired on Japanese television, many fans were put off with what appeared to be a very confusing ending... including Evangelion's creator, Anno Hideaki. As a result, Hideaki went back through the series and put together two motion pictures, which depict an alternate ending to the Evangelion saga... what some would say should be the TRUE ending.
The first part of the movie, "Death," recounts the series through episodes 1-24, with new footage added to clear up unclear spots in the series. The second part, "Rebirth," is actually the first thirty minutes of the second movie, 
, which sets the scene for what is to happen next.

description:
New Getter Robo is an alternate retelling of the original Getter Robo series. In this new version, humanity is under attack by frightning demonic creatures called Oni. The only thing able to stand up to this monstrous threat are the Getter robots.
Created by Professor Saotome, the Getter robots harness the power of Getter Rays, which are the only things powerful enough to destroy the Oni. The strongest of them all is Getter Robo, and Saotome enlists in three men to pilot the Getters. They are martial artist Ryoma Nagare, crime boss Hayato Jin, and monk Benkei Musashibou. Together, they form the Getter team and band together to save Earth from the threat of the Oni.

It's been three years. Three years since the lovely Mariko Misowa broke up with her boyfriend, Harukiko Shimatsuki. In that time, Harukiko, or Haru for short, finished school and is now going to be teaching at college... well, in the English version at least. The US companies have a habit of transforming high schools into colleges for hentai titles in order to make the girls more "legal". So I'm positive this is actually a high school in the Japanese version. Anyway, back to the story...

Haku enters his apartment, and is stunned to find the pink-haired Chitose Misowa, Mariko's younger sister, waiting for him inside. Chitose shows him the key to his apartment that Mariko had thrown away. She had been keeping it, she tells Haku, because all that time she has been deeply in love with him. After exposing her feelings, she feels that perhaps she shouldn't have revealed herself in such a fashion, but Haku quickly dissolves all doubts as he eases her clothes off and takes her virginity.
The next day Professor Haruhiko is introduced to his class... and who does he see is one of his students? Why Chitose of course! And when Chitose discovers that that Haru will be her professor, her thoughts instantly flow to the previous night when he taught her all about becoming a woman. Of course, she can't say anything to anyone, but that doesn't stop her from smiling! Besides, as long as she has him, it doesn't matter if nobody else can know.

But Chitose isn't the only woman on campus that has feelings toward Haru. Well, at first Ms. Tagami had a crush on another man, but on the same day she made him a special lunch from her heart, she finds out that he's getting married ... or so she says. I wasn't sure if that was supposed to be real or just an excuse to offer the lunch to Haku. Whatever the reason, he accepted the invitation, and if she didn't have an infatuation with the handsome Mr. Shimatsuki before, she sure did after the lunch.

There is also a subplot going on involving Chitose being on the swim team and having a lot of pressure to lead the school to victory. Oh yeah, and Ms. Tagami just so happens to be the swimming instructor, certified by the Aquatics Assosciation no less. I'm sure that will probably makes things get weird later on. I've only seen the first episode though, so I can't tell you for sure.
And while this is probably just because I've only seen the first episode, I have to mention that this is the first hentai title I've seen where only one couple has sex. I assume we are treated to more variety in the additional episodes, but for this one episode it just seemed very sweet. Oh, and speaking of sweet, Haku normally seems like such a sweet guy, but get him in the bedroom and his kindy side starts to come out. Of course, his kinky side is still extremely mild compared to a lot of other hentai titles.
This was a nicely drawn title. The characters looked great and were all nicely proportioned, without any extreme exagerations. The animation was also smooth, and you could tell they didn't cheap out like other titles tend to do. The story looked like it could have gotten pretty good, but it seems I'll have to wait until another time to find out for sure.

After the first episode, Haru has used not only the lovely young pink haired Chitose, but also the swim coach, and the long haired blue haired girl. Also, Haru, it seems, is very stupid, or dense, when he is teaching.
As for when he is about to use the Chitose for sex, he turns into something a little bit more. He likes bondage, I can tell you that, and likes to celebrate Chitose's accomplishments in odd ways, which I can describe with one word... "Candles".
In the end, it turns out that Haru has sex with Professor Tagami and Hotori, and later on Haru has a threesome with Chitose and Tagami.

Ten year old 
 is a graduate from Magic School and in order to complete his training, he must teach English in Japan...to a all-girls classroom in a Junior High all-girl school! Not only that but because of shortage of room, he has to bunk with 
, the one girl that doesn't adore him. Will 
 be able to survive despite all his magical mistakes, being creamed by 
, and constantly being cuddled by every girl who sees him?

Mahou Sensei Negima is about a 10-year-old-kid who is practicing magic to become a master wizard.
Ordered to be a teacher in one of the high schools in Japan for his training, our magician Negi is tasked to help his class of 2A, which consists of 30 cute yet underachieved girls, to pass the final examination.
And the problem is: all the time he has is just two weeks! So can practical magic be of any help or can they come out of the exams with flying colors relying on their own magic?

When a class of all girls get's a 10 year old boy teacher, well things get a little wild. He can't even keep his control his class without getting hugged, or shoved out the way. But, don't get tricked by his cute looks, Negi is very powerful with magic strong enough to blow down a building! And he has great control over his powers, but what about his class? Let's say they have perfect control over him.

Once, in a small Japanese village, a nine tailed fox demon terrorized the people of the village. Then 
 sealed the fox away in an orphan baby named 
. 
 is now 12 years old and training to be a shinobi (ninja).
 is an inept ninja-in-training. He has failed the final ninja academy test three times. He passes, though, when an evil ninja teacher tricked 
 into stealing a forbidden shinobi scroll. 
 uses a technique from the scroll, multiple doppelgangars (the art of creating flesh & blood copies of himself), to defeat the evil teacher. He is then passed.
 then moved on to the next leg of training. 
 meets a girl named 
 and a very serious ninja-to-be named 
. Then the three meet an elite ninja named 
 who is to be their sensei.
The squad began their training with 
-sensei, and took part in various low-level missions. Then, soon after the completion of one mission in the Land of Waves that was more than any of them expected, 
-sensei nominated them to take the Chunin exam. Even though some protested, 
 felt his students were ready.
The Chunin exam consists of multiple tests. The first was a written exam, for which the proctor was 
 (who is in charge of interrogation and black ops). The second test took place in the Forest of Death, and the proctor for that one was Anko. The object for that test was for the squads to each obtain a heaven scroll and earth scroll within five days, and then successfully bring them to the building in the center of the Forest of Death. And that area is rightfully named, as it is quite a deadly place. Normally, after this test the remaining students would move on to the third test, but because so many had passed, some preliminary eliminations were held to reduce the numbers. These were done as one-on-one battles. The rounds went as follows:
The third part of the chunin exam started a month later. The reason for this delay was so the remaining candidates could recover and work on some new tricks. The 
 tells them that they will be judged by the leaders, kages, fuedal lords of the five shinobi nations. The judges would select either all, some, or none. The only person that doesn't hear this is 
 because he's in the hospital.
Shonen's Jump ran a poll in Japan, for subscribers of the magazine, on the popularity of the Naruto characters. Here is the page with the results:

There was once a 
 who attacked the Hidden Leaf Village of the ninjas. A swipe from one of its nine tails could cause earthquakes and crumble mountains. All the ninjas in the village tried to fight it in vain, until the Fourth Hokage sacrificed his own life to seal the Demon Fox away...within the navel of a newborn baby boy. That boy's name: 
.
It is now twelve years later, and 
 has grown up to be a very mischievous young boy, painting graffiti on the monuments and pulling pranks on everyone. He seems to enjoy bumming around, and is not taking his ninja apprenticeship too seriously. In fact, his teacher, 
 tells him that he is the only one in the class who hasn't yet passed the final apprenticeship test, and 
 has already failed the test three times!
But when a devious plan by an ambitious "Chuunin" (middle-level ninja) places 
's life in danger, 
's determination manifests itself and he saves his teacher. 
 passes, and he now begins his journey towards being a true ninja!

Neo Ranga is about the three sisters of the Shimabara family. They live alone in West Musashino, Tokyo. Their parents are since long dead and their older brothers left them ten years ago.
One day, a young boy calling himself Joel shows up at their house. They have been invited to the island kingdom of Barou, all expenses paid.
Of course, they had to go. But when there, the natives elect them kings of Barou, and the island's protector and god awakes from his slumber to serve his kings.
They are shocked, but decide to live as they had before, and so they hurry back to Tokyo. Three months later, the guardian of the sea, 
, descends upon Tokyo....
On a side note, the sexy black body suits with the red patterns that are seen on the video and DVD covers never actually show up in the anime. They are censored versions of the original covers that feature the girls nude with the red pattern tattoos, which also never show up in the anime.
The secret behind the patterns lies within the race known as the Suura. 
 is one of them. The other gods in the series are Kyoshins. They are dead Suuras. The Suura race is, except for 
, extinct.
Anyways, the tattooed art exist because of the fact that the Shimabara family originates from the Suura of 
. Therefore these patterns.

Our favourite Number one Knuckle Headed Ninja is back and better than ever!!! Almost three years into the future, 
 returns to the village of Konohagakure completing his three year training with 
.
When 
 returns home he returns to some big changes. First of all, he's the only Genin left in his age group, 
 is Kazekage, 
 and 
 are getting "closer", 
 has a new "punch" to her physique, and 
 STILL won't stop reading Make Out Paradise!!! Too many changes for one ninja to grasp??!! Where's the rest of the genin- oh, I mean Chunin - to laugh off 
's humiliation!?
As we all may know, 
 has the 
 sealed inside of him and is labeled as the "Akasuki's" desire. But who will the Akasuki kiss first? 
 or 
?
This second adaptation to the popular manga series and animation series "
" will give you quite a jump. 
's older, stronger, and slighty more mature, but still working on his "Sexy Jutsu" to blow away 
 and 
's minds. "Naruto Shippuden" is funnier, scarier, and more "Ninja Tastic" than ever before.
Naruto... what did the village of Konohagakure do without you for three years? *sigh* It must of been quieter and "duller" without you around... Now the question is "When will 
 share her feelings for him?"

Fourteen year-old junior high student 
 is just your normal student, kind-hearted with a rather passive personality. He doesn't show much interest in girls, unlike his friend, "Mr. Ladies-Man" 
. But this would all change one day when Kazuto meets 
, a 14 year old girl studying in the same school... and an alien. Yes, that's right, an ALIEN... or actually half-alien.
 saves 
 from an alien attacker one day, and before he could thank her, she disappears. Being the grateful person that he is, 
 searches for 
 and when he finds her, thanks her and invites her for tea. 
 then tries to discourage 
 from courting her since she feels that it wouldn't work between the two of them. 
 tells her that he doesn't mind whether she seems to act weird or strange, or anything else... including even if she were really an alien. This touches 
 so much that she agrees to let 
 accompany her home.
When an alien assassin tries to attack 
's father at home, 
 valiantly tries to help out. 
 is so happy that 
 didn't seem to mind what had happened, only that she and her father were all right. So she teleports him high above Earth, into space, to show him hundreds of starships in orbit, saying that this is her (alien) world. 
 now has an alien girlfriend!

This was not the ideal assignment that Kate Curtis wanted. A young officer assigned to her first undercover case, Kate must go to the desert world Doone, a planet where young girls had been disappearing... and she has to go disguised as an airheaded slut!
So it's off to Doone, wearing skimpy clothing, carrying a purse that says "Rape Me" filled with all sorts of sex toys and a doubtful feeling in her gut that Kate goes. But soon, Kate loses her backup, her freedom, her virginity... and her heart, as she's captured and forced to endure all sorts of degradations, not to mention falling in love with her captors.
However, will the love survive when the big raid happens?

It has been 50 years since the third World War. In the center of Tokyo, a contaminated sector of the city where the atomic bomb that destroyed the city had hit, known as 'The Black Spot', has given rise to a new form of mutated humanity called 'Needless' by normal humanity. The Needless look normal, but possess fantastic abilities, or 'fragments' as those powers are called.
But now, a mysterious organization known as 'Simeon' has established their world headquarters right in the center of The Black Spot – and they have now engaged in Needless hunting for unknown reasons. Adam Blade, a Needless priest with a weakness for cute girls, is fighting this organization alongside the cute and perky doppelganger Eve Neuschwanstein. Lately, though, the group has picked-up Cruz Schild, a Needless boy with no powers after he lost his sister to Simeon's forces and has enlisted him in their battle – not to mention making him as their occasional errand boy!

Fifty years after World War Three, where the great city of Tokyo once stood, now stands a large crater called the Black Spot. It is here where outcasts dwell. Outcasts who have powers which separate them from ordinary humans. These outcasts have been dubbed "Needless".
After losing track of his older sister, a young boy named Cruz Schild has ended up joining with two Needless: Adam Blade and Eve Neuschwanstein, two powerful fighters.

Nanaka 6/17 is an anime about the 17 year old Nanaka Kirasato, a bossy, studious girl and her friend, Nenji Nagihara (also 17). Nenji is sloppy, not serious and always getting into fights with Jinpachi Arashiyama. One rainy day after a fight, Nanaka nags Nenji about growing up. He screams to her, "I never want to see your face again!"
Nanaka has always grown up with Nenji. They were always best friends, up until now. This exclamation shocks Nanaka. She accidentally falls down a pair of stairs nearby.
Later, in the hospital, she wakes up and Nenji apologizes. But, because of the fall, Nanaka starts suffering from a severe head injury. Her memory reverts to when she is 6 years old. Now Nenji must help Nanaka keep a normal life, so when she goes back to her normal 17-year-old self, she can continue to live her life. Along the way Nenji and Nanaka meet some pretty interesting people. Its a really good anime.

Nagasarete Airantou has a nice atmosphere that is quite funny.... a must watch anime for those comedy lovers.
The main character, 
, finds himself lost at sea until he winds up on an island called Airan. After being in the sea for five days, his rescuer, a girl named 
, sure is a sight for sore eyes! 
 is then surprised to learn that the island doesn't contain any other men besides himself... and thus, all the girls on the island chase him...
Of course, this anime isn't entirely about the comedy; there is some romance contained within as well.
There would be too many spoilers If I reveal any more, so just go watch yourselves and you'll know what kind of anime this is.

related.name: Neon Genesis Evangelion: Death and Rebirth
Neon Genesis Evangelion: End of Evangelion

description:
It's impossible to say enough good things about Evangelion. GAINAX studio, the company behind such groundbreaking projects as 
, 
 and 
 returns to television work with this series.
An excellent story frequently told with furious abandon, this series of 13 tapes documents (among other things) beings coming out to the sky one day intent on showing humanity the error of its ways, and of humanity fighting back with everything at its disposal. That includes buildings that slide underground and piloted prototype robot warriors...with extension cords.
The only criticism that can be made is that unlike 
 and 
, the ending of the TV series is pretty disappointing. Fortunately, they made 
 to replace the final two episodes of the TV series, which more than made up for the original disappointment.

Ok, here's the story folks. Evangelion takes place in the future 2015, 15 years after the famed, "Second Impact". 
, a somewhat lonesome boy, is standing around in the deserted streets of Tokyo-3. This openeing scene marks the beginning of a voilent, dramatic, humorous, and just plain, heart-touching series. The movie itself is centered around one of those "secret" organizations. This particular organization is called NERV. Their mission is to defend the planet from unknown threats.
I won't say too much 'cause my friend wanted this to be an intro not a spoiler. Some of the characters are 
, the lonely kid; his father, head of NERV; 
, 
's guardian and friend; Rei, a mysterious pilot; 
, an egotistical pilot; and of course, the EVA units! The series is made up of 26 half-hour episodes. The Movies are called, "Death and Rebirth" and "The End of Evangelion"

I will be contrary here and disagree slightly with the very enthusiastic reviewers.
NGE is one of the most impressive things ever animated. The effort that was put into it on every level, from music to voice acting to art to animation, is awe-inspiring. The script and plotting are intelligent without being pretentious--at first, anyway.
But the series gets derailed right around Episode 24 and goes spiraling down into the Black Pit of WTF. There are rumors about the reasons for this, and if you're an anime fan you've probably heard them already. And if you didn't like the way NGE ended (and most viewers didn't), then "
" and "
" will probably leave you so frustrated that you may want to put your fist through the TV screen. Likewise, there are rumors about why Hideki Anno made these artistic choices, which I won't repeat here. You've probably already heard them anyway.
Ultimately it's a flawed masterpiece. When it is good it is breathtaking. It isn't hyperbole to say that, once you've seen it, you will probably never look at animation quite the same way again. But the end of the series is ghastly, and the movies are everything that was bad about the ending multiplied a hundred times, combined with even more impressive animation, art, voice acting, and music.
It's extremely frustrating and it could have been so much better than it was.

Neon Genesis Evangelion contains many religious connections and connotations. Here are a few, so take from them what you will...
According to the Old Testament of the Bible, Angels are the servants of God. It also represents the 12 disciples of Christ in the New Testament.
Based on the Old Testament of the Christian Bible, Adam was the first man to have been created by God in his own image.
The organization called "Seele" means "Soul" in German.
Evangelion is a word taken from the German word: evangelium, which has religious connotations meaning Gospel. It is also used as a slang to mean Absolute Truth.
Eva is a German word for Eve, a religious word derived from the Old Testament of the Christian Bible. According to the Bible, Eve was the wife of Adam, the first man to be created by God in his likeness. She tempted Adam into eating the forbidden fruit in the Garden of Eden, and was exiled forever as punishment for disobeying God.(You probably already knew that)
The A10 nerve, the nerve 
 uses to synchronize, is also the nerve that produces natural morphine in our brains, also known as the pleasant section of the brain. It is also the section that manages our long term memories.
The word Muldock, from the Muldock Report, is a word taken from one of the gods of the Babylon Empire
The four main eva's (
, 
, 
, 
) are based on the Guardians of one of the gate's of hell. One was a Cyclops (
), another had a horn and gnashing teeth (
), another had four eyes and the worst temper of them all (
), and the last one was black in color and had unusually long arms (
).

description:
The Adventures of the Little Koala was about a Koala named Roobear and all his friends and family. Roobear's mom and dad were Mommy and Papa, and he had a little sister named Laura. His friends were Floppy and Mimi (rabbits), Pamie and Nick (penguins), Betty (a koala), Walter (a kangaroo), Duckbill (a platypus), and Kiwi (a kiwi bird).
This show was mainly about Roobear and his daily life and such. I assume that he also learned a life lesson in every episode, but I don't quite remember. The only thing about this show that I remember is that Roobear and his friends go to a museum and he gets his finger stuck in a vase (which I see now must be "The McGillicuddy Vase" episode). He doesn't tell anyone and when dinner time comes he can't eat (or else he might reveal the vase stuck on his hand). I just remember that this was a great show.

The main story of Kodomo no Jikan is centered around twenty-three-year-old Daisuke Aoki, who has just landed his first teaching job as a grade school instructor at Futatsubashi Elementary School. He is placed in charge of Class 3-1, where one of his students, a mischievously precocious nine-year-old girl by the name of Rin Kokonoe, develops a crush on him and goes so far as to proclaim herself Aoki's girlfriend. She aggressively pursues her efforts to be with her teacher despite the fact that he will lose his job if she gets too close, a situation further complicated by the often complex, intertwining relationships existing between them and their respective friends, families, and peers.
If someone would like to 
 for this anime rather than "borrowing" from Wikipedia or some other website, I would greatly appreciate it.

is an apprentice nurse/maid who works at the hospital of her employer, the young Dr. Koyji Ogami. She's not very bright, is very clumsy, and the only redeeming qualities in her is her... er... upfront talents. She continually suffers the abuse of Dr. Ogami, mostly through his continual physical training of 
, not to mention threatening to make the poor girl the subject of his experiments. However, this training is essensial for the girl to survive an upcoming operation... one which is part of the secret of 
.
In the meantime, Dr. Ogami has some shady dealings going on as well. He's often called upon to do very secretive work involving extraterrestrial life, which has some connection between the United States and the Vatican. And some of those experiments somehow have poor 
 in the middle of it. And yet, for all of the abuse she suffers, somehow Dr. Ogami has some affection for her... but what... and why?

An extraordinary scent and the fragrance of destiny.
 is an employee of the CRI Corporation. By day, she designs the world's most exquisite perfumes. By night, she uses her incredibly keen nose as a secret agent, receiving her assignments with a single rose: glorious missions lovelier than a bullet and more dangerous than love itself.
Together with the artificial humanoid 
, she travels the world in a series of unique and dangerous (and at times a bit twisted) missions to help protect the world order in the chaotic future.
These missions make up the series called 
.

Well, to put a long story short, Nana is about two girls who are the same age, have the same name, and share an apartment together, yet they are both totally different, or so they think.
Nana "Hachi" Komatsu is a ditsy girl who, in her head, thinks she's easy and can never find a job because of her lazyness. She went to Tokyo to live with her high school sweetheart, Shoji.
Then there is Nana Osaki, a singer in the rock band Black Stones, or BLAST for short. She travels to Tokyo to make her big break and maybe reunite with her old love, 
, who moved to Tokyo two years before her to join the band TRAPNEST.

If you happen to be a fan of "fan service", then this is your fix!
Parfait, a Holy Virgin-in training, along with her childhood friend, the more accomplished Cacao, and her training droid P.Q., are transported to a planet which is being invaded by a race of nomads called Gigo Genos. Once there, they discover that the leader of the invasion might be a prophesized hero from their own world, as well as joining up with Lemon, a plucky orphan. Can this unlikely trio save this besieged world... as well as guiding their savior from madness?
Note, the name "Ramune" is a brand name for a Japanese soft drink, noted for it's very unusual bottle, which is sealed by a large marble rather than a crown cap.

Kirari Tsukishima is a 14-year-old who can seem to think of nothing but food, and loves to eat. Her whole life revolves around food until she meets Seiji, of a popular male idol duo called SHIPS, and it is love at first sight. She decides that she would have a better shot at him if she becomes an idol herself, and with the help of SHIPS, she starts her crusade to enter the japanese entertainment scene.
Kirari and Na-san, her cat, work to get to the top dispite the numerous challenges on her way there. If she wants to keep her love intact, she must climb to the top and become a popular idol, which isn't as easy as she thinks.

and was the star Kendo champion of Koei High School. He competed in the National High School Kendo Competition, and won the individual competion. Yet due to a cruel turn of fate, his promising kendo career ended quickly on that night he was struck down by a speeding car. This hit and run was by no means an accident, however. It was clear and deliberate, but the target wan't 
, it was 
, 
's lover. 
 just happened to spy the speeding car accelerating right toward them, and with no thought for his own safty pushed Enjyoji out of it's deadly path. Thanks to 
's actions, the car missed Enjyoji. Unfortuantly, 
 wasn't so lucky. He survived, and he was even able to walk again, but alas he would never be the Kendo star that he once was.


 and Enjyoji are now in college, and 
 has a part time job working for Professor Fumio Sakada in the research room. One night after work, Professor Sakada invites 
 out for a drink at some new place. Although 
 doesn't drink, he eventually agrees to accompany the Professor out, and boy what a mistake that was! 
 quickly realizes that it's a gay club, but before he can leave, he starts feeling kind of woozy. That's because when 
 wasn't looking, the Professor sliped some kind of drug in 
's tea. When 
 can no longer stand, the Professor moves in and then attempts to molest him! Thankfully, the Professor doesn't get the chance to continue. A nearby man, who someone calls Sagano, leaps into action and pulls the Professor off of 
, and beats the crap out of him.


 seems to instantly recongnizes the name, and drags himself over to get a look at the guy. Sure enough, it was the same Kai Sagano from back in high school, the only first year student who really stood out in the Kendo club. And apparently Kai had a crush on 
. Or perhaps it was more than a crush. At any rate, his feelings have intensified by now, but of course 
 is in love with 
... or should I say 
?! That's right! Kai and 
 are half-brothers! 
 is two years older than Kai, but was born to his father's mistress, not his wife, and so he couldn't take his father's last name. Oh yeah, and did I mention that their father was a Yakuza boss? Sorry, must have slipped my mind!

So talk about a crazy situation, two gay brothers who have a mob boss as a father happen to fall in love with the same man! What's in store for 
, 
, and Kai? Where in the world is this story heading? Those who have already enjoyed the popular manga from Kazuma Kodaka on which this anime is based should already know, but the rest of us will have to wait until the next episode to find out anything more since each DVD contains only one episode just over 30 minutes long. On the back of the DVD case there is a suggested age rating of 16 and up, however when you actually play the disc there is a parental discretion age warning of 18 and up. Personally, I'd say the 16 and up warning is more on the money. There is only very brief (and shadowed) nudity, sexual situations that are only really hinted at, and some violence but very little blood.

Saint Seiya is a story from Masami Kurumada about warriors called 'Saints' whose task is to protect, and to fight against evil forces. There are also evil Saints in the story who are on the hostile side. It is said that every 200 years an evil will come back to Earth and try to rule the world, and at the same time, the Goddess Athena will be reincarnated to prevent the evil from accesion to power on Earth.
The story has five main chacters: 
 the Pegasus Saint, 
 the Dragon Saint, 
 the Andromeda Saint, 
 the Cygnus Saint, and 
 the Phoenix Saint. The task of these Saints is to protect Athena, the Goddess of peace, and to defeat the evil forces.
The Saints wear special armour, which each has deserved after years of hard training. Their armour not only protects them from external impacts, but also gives them special abilities. The armour represents a star constellation, from which a Saint also gains his power, called 'cosmo'. The cosmo of a Saint is like an aura. According to the story, everyone has a cosmo, which he/she is able to discover.
The story consists of 114 episodes made for TV, and can be divided into six main parts:
Saint Seiya brings the subjects of "friendship" and "holding together" to you in an amazing way. The feature also demonstrates that the "bad guys" can have their good sides, and needn't be only mad, dumb, and ugly. The enemies are not just there acting as "cannon-fodder", but they are fighting for an ideal they believe in, thus they have a reason to be. This makes them just as interesting and enoyable as the main characters.
Saint Seiya has now been released in America by DiC, in two versions: a version of the series edited for television under the name "Knights of the Zodiac" (this is incidentally the title of the series as seen in Europe under various languages), and an uncut version released only on video (though A.D. Vision) which retains the original "Saint Seiya" title.

In the distant future, the Earth is split in two. The southern hemisphere is in another dimension, while the people of the northern hemisphere develop the ability to morph into humanoid beasts.
Three unlikely companions, Wan, Bud, and Mei-Mer, along with Tuttle and Yuni, must find the legendary Gaia before their human enemies do. Fortunately for the beasts, they have the mighty machines called Jinns: the Earth Totem, Sky Totem, and Sea Totem, which form the powerful God Totem.

Ten years after the adventures of 
 and his friends, Duel Monsters had become so popular, that education areas like Duel Academia High were established. 
 was on his way there for a entry exam when he encountered the legendary duelist 
, who gave 
 a special card with the knowledge that the boy was no mere duelist.
After getting accepted, 
 was assigned to the Slifer Red (Osiris Red in Japanese) dormitory, which is mainly composed of delinquents. 
 makes friends with some of them, and together have to deal with the Obelisk Blue house students, studying, and the strange events taking place in their school...

Yu-Gi-Oh GX is a series that takes place after the 
 series. This series is a boy named 
 who attends in the Duel Academy a school which students learn the basics of dueling and learn how to become great duelists. 
 will face many challengers in the Duel Academy and hopes to become the next Duel King.

creator: Kazuki Takahashi
title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters GX
King of Games! Duel Monsters GX

description:
A beautiful anime about a young traveler named 
 and a talking motorcycle, Hermes. Together they spend three days at each location and learn valuable lessons.
The places they visit are: country where people understand others' pain, country of majority decision, country of adults, country of prophecy, country of sadness, country of peace, country where everyone doesn't need to work, country of kindness, and colosseum-avengers.
This anime is based on a novel created by Keiichi Shiguresawa, published on July 10 in 2000. The novel about 
 and the adventures had been a bestseller hit in Japan. I recommend this anime to everyone, with parent/guardian supervision, because of some violent scenes. But for those of you who don't really like serious anime, it'd be better not to watch this anime, which needs some moral explanation.

When the moon rises, the four young men of Weiss become the most vicious assassins the world has ever seen. The team consists of 
, a somber and silent type, 
, a wide-eyed former athlete, 
, a young computer specialist, and 
, a suave ladies man.
The assassins fight against Reiji Takatori for the first part of the series, then in the second part, their enemy is a party of three elderly people.

From the creators of 
 comes Kill la Kill, an outrageous new series about the exploits of Ryuko Matoi, and headstrong young student who wields a sword shaped like a half a pair of scissors.
