 took one look at her and knew right away.)
Working with the Host Club in this unusual (and adorable) romantic comedy, 
 discovers just how wealthy the boys are and how different they are from everybody else. Everyone's fathers at Ouran High are prestigious people in famous companies, so therefore the parents pressure their children to get along in order to make allies for their own purposes. Not just for the "HOST" members, but the entire school's children have to do this also.
For the climax of the series, Tamaki's past returns to haunt him. His grandmother shows up and forces him to escort a lady all day. She's apparently Tamaki's fiancee. Tamaki's grandmother tries to get him to marry her, to DISSOLVE the "HOST" club, and to go back to France. What could possible make him do this? Perhaps the chance to see his mother again. Will he do it? Will he leave everything and everyone behind? Or will he go back to the girl he loves, 
, and the rest of the gang?

is a former student of the most prestigious magic school around, The Tower of Fang. Yeah, former. Did he graduate? Flunk out? No, he ran away! Why? Simple! One of his closest friends, love interest, and fellow student, 
, was trying to draw out the full power of a legendary sword the Tower had gotten a hold of, and turned herself into a terrifying dragon known as the Bloody August! The Tower saw this as a disgrace, and set out to kill her, so 
 changed his name to 
 and ran away to find the sword again in order to turn her back and save her. Did I say simple? Sorry if I misled you.
The anime begins five years after this occurred, and much has changed. 
 has now taken an apprentice under his wing, an aspiring sorcerer named 
. When he and 
 track down the sword, known as the Sword of Baltenders, to the house of rich heiress 
, two pesky little dwarf brothers named 
 and 
 steal it. Once they run off with the sword, 
 tags along with 
 to get the sword back, which was the last present she received from her father before he died. So begins the epic tale of 
.

Riku is a 12 year old boy who lives with his grandfather. His grandfather taught him all of these weird hand movements that seemed to have no purpose, but their purpose becomes clear soon after his grandfather is attacked at their shrine.
In an attempt to save his grandpa he makes a contract with Byakko no Kogenta. Kongenta is a Shikigami monster that follows the orders of a human master. As time passes, they become best friends.
In order for Kogenta to fight, Riku must learn "In" (signs that you make with a drive).
Now they must stop the Chi-Ryuu from opening the four Taiten and freeing Utsuho who has the power to contort yokai or demons.

lives in his parents abandoned house for years by himself. He has only vague memories of his family. Then one day two girls show up, 
 and 
, and both claim to be his twin sister. Which one is it? 
 must decide. There is some fan service that is quite funny. Check this one out.
Some characters from 
 make brief appearances.

From the creators of 
, comes Uta~Kata, which is about a 14-year old student named Ichika Tachibana who is arriving at her last day of the school year. She comes across an old mirror in an abandoned campus building. A mysterious girl named Manatsu steps outside of it, offering her friendship and special powers to boot.
However, Ichika must undergo training and unlock the powers of the 12 Djinn. She is also given a special amulet to help unlock all of them. As she hunts for the Djinn, reality still sets in for her and she still deals with the issues of growing up.
However, her quest for the Djinn also brings deception, and the clues may be mere mirror images of what Ichika is searching for....

This wonderful anime is all about a band, known as Lucifer, trying to be the best ever. 
 (
 for short) and his friend, Santa, both decide to quit their first band and start one together. Thus, starts their search for band members. They first recruit Towa, then 
, and lastly 
.
After 
 and Santa gather their new members, which takes up about the first 20 episodes or so, a girl named Aine comes into the picture. Aine Yukimura becomes Lucifer's lyricist and she starts a relationship with the lead singer, Sakuya.
The manga focuses mainly on the relationship of Sakuya and Aine.

Mihashi is a highschooler who played pitcher for his previous school, Gunma's Mihoshi Academy, where he was also the ace player as a favor to his Grandfather who owned the school.
After transferring to Saitama, the baseball coach, Momoe Maria, drags him onto the team. Mihashi throws a few pitches to Abe (catcher) who soon sees why everyone on Mihashi's previous team didn't like him... his pitches are slow.
When the coach decides to have a practice game against Mihashi's former school, Abe finds out just how much the team hated Mihashi, and the things they threatened to do to him. So Abe helps Mihashi by telling him that he is a good pitcher.

Kuromi and Baku break out of Mari-land Prison, stealing the Legendary Melody Key and Melody Bow. They escape to the human world to gain 100 Black Musical notes that if played would unleash the Dark Power. My Melody is sent by the king and queen of Mari-Land to capture Kuromi with the use of the Melody Tackt, Melody Candy, and Melody Box.
Kuromi uses her Melody Key and bow on Uta Yumeno to have one of her nightmares come true on her violin. My Melody hears Uta crying and comes over to check on her. Uta thinks My Melody is Kuromi at first until she helps her with her problem. She ends up running into Uta's friends Miki, Mana, and her older sister who take her back home to stay.
Meanwhile, Kuromi runs into Keiichi Hiiragi, Uta's crush, walking home at night from school. Kuromi's bow is snatched and as he holds it it grows. As he played it on his violin, it glowed, charging the Melody Key Kuromi had. They join up to try and get the dark power.
Kuromi falls in love with Hiiragi hard and constantly tries to please him. Will My Melody be able to stop this trio and collect 100 Pink Notes? Watch and find out!

Life is normal again for Uta and her family, but she misses My Melody. For setting free the Dark Power, the king of Mariland puts a curse on Hiiragi. For if Hiiragi didn't fulfill his new role as Usamimi Kamen (Rabbit Ear Mask), he would get turned into a taper. Kuromi and Baku escape prison again, this time with a new Melody key and a dark looking guitar pick.
My Melody is sent to capture Kuromi, only this time she has to only collect 8 pink notes. After she collects "Do Re Mi Fa So La Ti Do", she can have any wish she wants to help her on her quest. Kuromi discovers that she can do the same if she collects 8 black notes.
Hiiragi's younger brother Jun Kiiechi arrives at his mansion on behalf of their grandfather, and Kuromi gives the pick to Jun after she finds out it charges the key. But something odd is happening every time Jun uses his new guitar pick. What will happen next? Watch and find out!

Moe Katsuragi, a young girl, is approached by Risky, an apprentice shinigami, on the day Moe's boyfriend leaves town. Noting the girl's depression, Risky tries to impress upon her to commit suicide, so that Risky can take Moe's soul. But Risky has one BIG problem... Risky shares a body with Safety, an apprentice angel, who appears whenever someone says something nice to Risky.
And ever since then, the two are engaged in a comedic battle of wits, Risky trying to get Moe's soul, while Safety always stops her. And if that's not bad enough, Safety has the unenviable task of keeping Risky from making mischief with Moe's friends.

This is a series called Ojamajo Doremi Mo~tto. Ojamajo is a made up Japanese word and it stands for Ojama (Bothersome) Majo (Witch). The title itself is a pun to say that the main character is an Ojamajo. This is the sequel to 
, which sequels 
.
With this new series comes a new character named Momoko Asuka, and with Momoko comes a problem. Momoko is Japanese but has always lived in America and speaks only English. Momoko used to be the apprentice for another witch but she passed away and in her final moments gave Momoko an earring. Momoko refuses to take it off and when the teachers tells her to take it off she refuses and slaps the teacher.
The only way the girls can communicate with Momoko is with there TWO new costumes. This season their shop is a pastry shop and the girls have pastry outfits (along with there witch outfits). On the pastry outfit is a head set that translates the two languages.

War has started between Lunaria and The Shadow Lands. A farm couple named Izu and Marlin are stuck in the middle.
Izu gets tricked into a mission of destruction by a mysterious man. Meanwhile, Princess Ahnas of Lunaria and Prince Jil of the Shadowlands are forced into war due to they're parents' deaths.
This is a story of two couples who are stuck in a Romeo and Juliet type situation, and how their love is doomed.

Magical DoReMi is an incredibly kawaii girl's show that is one of the most popular in Japan (besides 
).
, 
, and 
 are three witchlings, witches in training, who have their very own magic shop, the DoReMi magic shop, formerly known as the Rusty Broom magic shop, which was owned by a witch named 
. It was Dorie who turned 
 into a small green blob by calling her a witch, so now she and her friends are training to become full-fledged witches with help from 
 and her fairy, 
. And while they do, they get into some mischief as well.
4Kids did not obtain rights to anything more than the first season of 51 episodes, and because of a dispute with Toei Animation over the alterations 4Kids made, Toei is unwilling to let them have more.

Hiromichi Kojima, the star batter of the Lycaons, heads to Okinawa to train and bring himself out of a slump. There, he meets Toua Tokuchi, a 134 km/h (83 mph) pitcher and the undisputed king of a gambling form of baseball called "One Out". At Kojima's urging, Tokuchi signs up with the Lycaons. His contract differs form the usual, though, in that he gets 5,000,000 yen for every out he pitches, but loses 50,000,000 yen for every point he gives up.

Hakuoro is a person without a past. He wakes up injured and in the care of a grandmother and her family. Stuck with an unremovable mask on his face (which yields terrifying visions) and a bad case of amnesia, he is taken into their care and is raised as a member of their village.
However, this village lives under the oppressive thumb of a corrupt Emperor. Hakuoro leads a rebellion against the emperor, which in turn leads him on the path to becoming the new ruler of the nation, which he names Tuskuru. However, Tuskuru gains more and more enemies, and the price of peace becomes heavier with each battle. In the midst of this chaos, Hakuoro's hidden past will soon come back to haunt him as well....

This is the romantic and amusing story of two strange lives forced together by chance.
One of them is 
. Three years of his 18-year life have been frozen in what he calls a "standstill". The other is Mizuho Kazami, an alien who has come to Earth to observe as a (pretty hot) high school teacher. When 
 discovers Mizuho's secret, they're forced into marriage to keep the secret. And that only sets off a chain of amusing events involving prying friends, jealous in-laws, and lots more silliness...even as the newlyweds begin to sort out their feelings for each other.

Meet Milk-chan, the weirdest superheroine you've probably ever seen. Be warned: she may look cute, but she's no poster girl! She may not have super powers, but she's rude, crude, and doesn't give you-know-what about what you think about her drooling. Living six months behind on rent with an obsolete robot, a slug, and an out-of-control pet, Milk-chan answers whenever the President calls...
.
The President's clueless, her missions are insane...but then the bad guys are nuts and so for that matter is our "heroine". The world is screwed...and it doesn't care. Welcome to 
.
 got its start as a segment in the Fuji Television show 
 back in 1998. Its 14 episode original run developed a bit of a cult following, which precipitated Milk graduating from training pants to her own television show. When A.D. Vision acquired the rights to 
, they and Industrial Smoke & Mirrors (the dub studio upon whom ADV frequently relies) proceeded to do a little work on it. Since it's only two baby steps away from the average American animated crude comedy (ie. 
), they made the jokes and plotline fit better to American tastes.
The original version of the show also had live action footage. They decided to replace them with behind-the-scenes skits from within Industrial Smoke & Mirrors. They also inserted the original 8-minute 
 segments from 
 into the show as 
. But to be fair to the purists, ADV made sure to keep the original footage. 
 is packaged with two discs per volume. One is the aforementioned "Made for America" version; the other is the original Japanese version.
Just remember, keep the kids away from this. It may look cute, but it's cute in a 
 sort of way, with the language out of 
 thrown in for good measure.

The year is 2099, and man has discovered ways to traverse the vast distances of space and has reached as far as the asteroid belt.
And now the Starlight, the greatest space cruiser man has built, is beginning its maiden voyage, a voyage which will be unlike anything ever anticipated.
It all began with a distress call.
The Starlight, racing to the rescue, manage to rescue a survivor.
Suddenly, the ship is hurled through a space cleft and right into a great mystery, one in which an ancient legend unfolds and an alien civilization is discovered.
What will happen next will take the Starlight and its crew to places never dreamed of and pit them against dangers they couldn't possibly imagine.
All this in pursuit of the planet known as Odin.
Will the crew succeed?
Odin: Photon Space Sailor Starlight introduces an interesting possiblity of the origins of the Norse myths, tying in some of the ancient stories (such as the cataclysmic battle Ragnarok which destroyed the old world) with the possibility of alien contact.

director: Toshio Masuda, Tekashi Shirado, Eiichi Yamamoto

description:
Ojamajo Doremi # is the sequel to a series called 
. The word "Ojamajo" is Japanese meaning Bother (Ojama) Witch (Majo). Doremi is a pun of the main character's name saying that she is an Ojamajo. The sharp piece (#) is just another piece off the music pun of the series.
In the begining of this second series we start out with our four main characters now with no witch powers (they loose them at the end of season one). When they end up sneaking into the Magical World, they witness the birth or baby witch Hana (Hana means flower in Japnese). Because of this, the Queen re-grants their powers and they are put in charge of Hana-chan.
But of course what's a show with a happy ending. Introducing the Flat4, Fugio F, Leon L, Akatsuki A, and Tooru T. The Flat4 group turn out to be a pain because they are trying to capture Hana-chan. But what's this Counterparts: Akatsuki and 
 both have a thing for each other. Fugio and 
 are both so nice and sweet. Poor Leon is always getting beat by 
 in sports. Also last is Onpu and Tooru. Tooru is jealous because he can't sing (but he can dance).
The changes made in this season are: new outfits, new Wands, new shop (it's a flower shop), and a new way to get to the magical world.

title: Lupin the 3rd: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine

description:
Has anyone wondered how in the world did 
, the grandson of "The Gentleman Thief", ever crossed paths with the busty and beautiful 
? This series, based upon the classic series by Monkey Punch, answers that question, as well as showing how the alluring 
 also managed to get the attention of the rest of 
's crew, as well as 
.

creator: Kato Kazuhiko
title: Lupin the Third: Mine Fujiko to Iu Onna

description:
There's a lot of sexual dysfunctions going on in Tokyo, and it's up to Dr. Ogenki and his nurse Tatase to stop them. Dr. Ogenki cures various patients with various sexual disfunctions. His methods are not conventional.
Be warned: This hentai is VERY graphic. It should not be seen by children. The average person may consider some of the subjects (and implied actions off camera) to be offensive.

Call him what you will: "The Wolf", "The world's most wanted". Just watch your valuables when you're in the presence of 
. With his two partners by his side, a pretty rival in his heart, and one persistent Interpol agent on his heels, 
 travels the world in search of fame, fortune, and fun.
The storyline was inspired by 
, a series of stories written by Maurice LeBlanc at the turn of the 20th century, but the art style was inspired by the shenanigans of America's own 
. Today, Lupin III and company are some of the most recognized figures in anime and the series probably the most popular anime series in the history of the genre. It remains a favorite among fans of action comedy.
Lupin III, as seen in Japan, was a pioneer in anime: the first series to actually be set in the real world (instead of imaginary locations, 
's adventures take place in Australia, Hong Kong, Europe, etc.), with recognizable landmarks and brand names, and the first to be directed at an adult audience (in this case, a college-age audience full of the liberalism of the late 60's-early 70's). It actually comprises 3 different series.
The first series was the shortest (called off at 23 episodes) and shows some signs of crudeness, violence, and antagonism between the characters. The second series, 
, is the longest (155 episodes) and most recognizable: released mostly by public demand for more Lupin after the first series gained momentum in reruns. It focuses more on simpler action and over-the-top hijinks, giving it a lighthearted air similar to what you see in the original 
, and it comes off being very entertaining. Little is known stateside about the third series, 
, generally because it isn't held in high regard.
Originally, Streamline Pictures released select episodes under the label 
, and then produced a dub of one of the most popular Lupin III movies, 
. Now, Pioneer has acquired the rights to publish 
 series.

creator: Jody Schaeffer, George Krstic
title: Megas XLR
Lowbrow
director: Kelsey Mann, Sue Perrotto, Chris Prynoski

description:
Notice: 
 is not Japanese animation! It is a cartoon produced in the US, though it was animated and broadcast in Japan. Because it has a style that is strongly influenced by anime, and because it parodies and references a good number of classic anime series, I have decided to include it on this site. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
What would you do if a Giant Robot suddenly landed in your backyard? That's what happens when a giant robot lands in the good ol' land of New Jersey, and in the hands of a video gaming slacker named 
 and his best friend Jamie. 
, also being a real auto enthusiast, soups up the robot and customizes it.
The robot originally came from the future, where the Earth is oppressed by war-mongering group of aliens called the Glorft. The robot, originally known as the Megas, was created to turn the tide of the war. A female pilot named Kiva is sent back in time to retrieve the Megas, but eventually winds up teaming with 
 and Jamie, mostly due the robot being changed beyond recognition.
The Glorft follow Kiva to the same time and also intend to take back the Megas, but to dominate Earth from the past. With the help of Megas, 
 uses his mad-video gaming skills to save Earth from the Glorft, and any other nasty villain of alien that happens to threaten it. With a little collateral damage on the side....
Note: Not only does this show reference and parody lots of anime series (I've noted the 
 as examples of known parodied animes), but well-recognized voices from the American anime world lend themselves to the series (Jamie's voiced by Steven Jay Blum and Kiva by Wendee Lee, two of the dub world's most recognized voices).

As a child, 
 could see strange lines everywhere. These lines, which he could cut, would destroy whatever they intersected. Thankfully, a woman gave him glasses which would prevent him from seeing the lines, thus enabling him to lead a relatively normal life.
Years later, after his father dies, 
 comes home to live with his sister, 
. Soon enough he ends up meeting a woman named 
, who turns out to be the immortal princess of a clan of vampires....
Tsukihime, like 
, is based on a game by Type-Moon (it's actually a game of the... erotic variety, but the series itself is supposed to be clean).

related.name: Ah! My Goddess: Everyone Has Wings

description:
Ah! My Goddess is a 5 video OVA which has the story revolve around two people, 
, a goddess, and 
, a freshman at Nekomi Institute of Technology. They meet each other when 
 tries to order out for food and discovers that all the restaurants are either closed or will not deliver. After a while he gets extremely frustrated and accidentally calls up the Relief Goddess Office. What happens next is a little strange.
A goddess (
) is sent to Earth to meet with 
 (this is putting it bluntly- he was more than a little shocked to see a girl pop out of a mirror). She offers him one wish and, not believing her, he wishes he had a girlfriend just like 
 to stay with him forever. Well, you know what happens next.
 grants his wish and a wish contract is made (which is enforced by the omnipotent "Ultimate Force") stating that she has to stay with him forever. Unfortunately, 
 lives in a men's dorm which does not permit any women inside, so he and 
 are literally tossed out by his sempai. They head out house hunting but turn up nothing, so they head to an old temple where they permanently settle down.
After this point, the story gets more entertaining and more characters are introduced, including 
's younger sister and 
's sisters. Ah! My Goddess! gets more romantic and funnier as the story goes on, which is the reason why I consider this to be one of best anime that I have ever seen.

The three sisters, 
, 
, and 
 are all part of the Nordic legend known as the Fates. The Fates were part a group of Valkyries.
In the legend, the keeper of magic and judge of men's fate was Urthr. The Nordic used the "th" and a "d" to represent the same sound. So, Urthr and Urdrth would be on the same line. Like 
 in the anime, she was older and commanded lightning.
The other side is Skuld. The name never needed to be changed in the legend or in the anime. Skuld was the Fate responsible to create Men and to give them knowledge on the battlefield. She also helped with the crafts of war. Skuld commanded water and rain. Skuld would create the Thread of Men (explained below).
Verthanthi was the Fate of the Present. She would watch over the men on the battlefield and direct the Valkyries accordingly. On rare instances, she would hold the Thread of Men too long, giving someone longevity. The keeper of the sun's warmth and song made Verthanthi the more liked Fate. The translation to Japanese was difficult. A pure "R" sound gets blurred into a "L" sound ("fried rice" would sound like "flied lice"). The "V" sound was replaced the less harsh "B" sound, and the "th" was again replaced with "D". So, the translation went like this:

Ve(l)thanthi --> (B)elthanthi --> Bel(d)an(d)i --> Beldandi --> Belldandy
Most Nordic Legends can be found in 
. The World Ash Tree of Knowledge that shades the Fate is known as Yggdrasil. In the anime, Yggdrasil is the all-powerful computer in Heaven.

related.name: Aa Megami-sama: Chicchai tte Koto wa Benri da ne

description:
I dove into the four-disc DVD set of this French/Japanese animated series known as Oban Star-Racers having absolutely no idea what to expect. Would it be an awesome series of animated perfection like 
, or would it turn out to be just another bland TV show made for children that lacks real drama and fails to establish a real emotional connection? Thankfully, Oban Star-Racers turned out to be the former, an excellent series that will easily hook both kids and adults into the arcing story and keep them entertained up until the final episode. The only disappointment here is that the series has to end. I seriously hope a second season will be considered.
The story starts in the year 2082, where we meet a girl named 
, who has just turned 15 years old. Living at a boarding school, 
 is desperately hoping for some kind of contact from her father, 
, whether it be a birthday present or a simple phone call. But it has been years since she has seen her dad, and she's fed up with waiting, so 
 decides it's time for an early graduation and takes off on her hover bike. As 
 is the well-known owner of Wei Racing, she knows exactly where to find him, but when the two are finally standing face-to-face, he doesn't even seem to recognize her. 
 quickly makes the decision to provide him with a false name, taking the name "
" from a nearby poster.
After she fixes one of his racers, he agrees to keep her on his team, though soon he learns that his team has been selected to represent Earth in an intergalactic race, and she is not invited along. But 
 is one tough cookie and refuses to lose her father again. Stowing away aboard the starship that transports the team to the distant planet on which the first rounds of racing take place. And it turns out to be a good thing she did, because the team's pilot, 
, becomes injured during the first race when their racer explodes.
Now 
 must take over as pilot for the Earth team, much to the dismay of 
, who apparently feels that women have absolutely no place in racing. All is not smooth-sailing from here on out, however. Not only does the Earth team does not win every race, but even for the ones they do win, they don't necessarily come through unscathed. But pulling out of the race is not an option, as the fate of the entire world, and possibly the entire galaxy, depends on the Earth team coming through to the very end. Friends and enemies, pitfalls and perils, mystery and loyalty, they all play a part in this action-packed series.
The art style is quite unique (such as how none of the characters have noses drawn on them), but it works extremely well. The aliens are all interestingly designed, and even the specific individuals of the various races have uniqueness, so they're not just one design that's cloned over and over. The character designs, mech designs, and even backgrounds all have great attention to detail, which goes far into helping the audience feels as though we are in a real universe.
The two-volume DVD release contains all twenty-six episodes, uncut. Since I hadn't seen the show on television, I cannot tell you how the uncut episodes differ from those that were broadcast. But it shouldn't really matter, as either way you'll most definitely want to pick up this series on DVD. There are also some extras features on board. Each volume contains a making-of featurette, star-racer profiles, and original concept art. Volume one gives you a sneek peek at volume two, while volume two gives you the original MIPCOM presentation (MIPCOM is a trade show) and a complete opening title sequence.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone and everyone!

is French/Japanese collaboration.
In the year 2057, after a devastating attack by a ruthless race called the Crogs, Earth is invited by the mysterious Avatar to participate in the great race of Oban, where the winner will be granted any wish.
Representing Earth is a racing team owned by one 
. Unknown to him, his estranged daughter, assuming the name 
, joins his team. After the team's top pilot, 
, is injured, 
 decides to take his place.

Just when you thought it was safe to go back into the hot springs, the shenanigans of Hinata return with a vengeance!
 should be happy. He's finally in Tokyo University...but a broken leg gives him cause to reconsider himself, and he decides to set off abroad with Seta instead of continue through college.
Meanwhile, there is little joy in Hinata. 
's "sister", 
, is taking over as manager for the Hinata apartments, and things just plunge downhill from there.
It is a time of introspection and re-evaluation, misunderstandings and missteps. Can 
 put his life together once and for all and find that which he was truly seeking from the beginning?

Three female warriors are looking for a Magician as an ally to round out their dungeon adventure party. The female team is comprised of the strong Amazon-warrior Genie, the thief Merrill, and the cleric Melissa. However, the only person who can possibly be of help is a clumsy student named Louie.
Safe to say, Louie is far from what they were looking for in a dungeon companion. Louie spends most of his time dodging his studies, getting drunk at bars, and constantly hitting on the ladies. And he enjoys fighting more with his fists than with magic. Much to their dismay, the female warriors have him join as the final member of the group.
Louie's ineptitude gets them into a lot of tight situations, however none of them would seem quite as bad as they unravel a sinister plot within the Kingdom. Will Louie and the girls stand up to the challenge without strangling Louie in the process?

In this anime, people have cat ears, but they lose them when they lose their virginity (there is no hentai in it).
 is a 12 year old boy who lives alone with his mother, Misaki Aoyagi. His brother, Aoyagi Seimei, was killed in an accident. Since even before Seimei's death, however, 
 lost his memory and had a complete personality change, and his mother went insane saying he's not her son- that he doesn't look like him.
One day, 
 meets somebody by the name of Soubi Agatsuma who claims to be a friend of Seimei. He knows the reason of his death and is ready to lend his help to 
. By searching for the cause of his brother's death (because Soubi can't tell him), 
 will find much more than only that.

The story centers around a twelve year old boy named 
, who has a mysterious run-in with a man named 
 on his first day of school. 
 claims to have been close friends with 
's recently murdered brother Seimei. 
 says that him and Seimei shared the true name of "Beloved" and were involved in magical spell battles. He also tells 
 that he was the "Fighter" unit to "Beloved" and that Seimei was the "Sacrifice", and now that Seimei is dead 
 is to be the "Sacrifice" for "Beloved".
In addition, 
 is told that his own true name is "Loveless" and he is soon dragged into intense spell battles, which can be more or less described as magical chess matches. In these battles the "Fighter" uses word-spells to defeat the other pair of opponents and the "Sacrifice" takes all the damage of the attacks. 
 is determined to figure out why his brother was murdered and concedes to the spell battles in order to find out what 
 knows about the organization "Septimal Moon"; who Seimei blames for his death in a will that was left to 
.
As the story progresses more is revealed about 
, Seimei, 
, and the other characters involved in the spell battles.

When he was just a kid, 
 lived in the Hinata apartments (run by his grandmother) when he met a girl who would become a childhood sweetheart. She told him that if a young couple were to meet again in Tokyo University, they would enjoy a happy life together. Before the girl went away, they promised each other that they would fulfill that dream and meet again in Tokyo University.
Now, we turn to the present...where 
 is 
 trying to get into Tokyo University. Just then, his grandmother calls. It seems she wants 
 to come back to the Hinata apartments. Needing a better place to study, 
 agrees.
There's just one problem. The place has since become a girls' dormitory! And when hapless 
 stumbles into the lives of the residents, he gets beaten a hair shy of a bloody pulp...until the news comes in. Girls, say hello to your new manager!
Then, to top it all off, one of the girls at Hinata bears an uncanny resemblence. Could she actually be his childhood sweetheart?
Such is love, such is life, such is 
, a re-emergence of the romantic comedy genre that had taken a back seat after such memorable works as 
 and the 
 series.

Lovely Complex (sometimes called Love?Com) is a story of an unlikely romance between Risa Koizumi, a very tall Japanese girl, and Otani Atsushi, a very short Japanese boy. Risa is self-conscious and loves gaming, while Otani is rather loud and a comedian.
Within the course of the anime, they appear to think they are friends, and even help each other try to get dates with crushes Chiharu Tanaka (Otani) and Ryoji Suzuki (Risa).
Yet, Risa falls in love with Otani on the way.... I won't spoil any more, but overall Lovely COmplex is very enjoyable!

High school love is not so kind for the All Hanshin Kyojin Koizumi Risa-who is taller than the average girl-and Ootani Atsushi-who's shorter than the average guy.
It all begins when Koizumi, Ootani, Nobuko, Rakao, Chiharu, and Suzuki all go swimming, thanks to Koizumi's brilliant idea to get Suzuki to like her, only to spend the entire time with Ootani. Thus, Chiharu and Suzuki make the second couple, with Nobuko and Rakao being the first. Skip a few episodes, and Koizumi starts to like Ootani when they go to an Omibouzo Christmas concert.
From there Koizumi puts all her heart into winning Ootani's, with obstacle after obstacle in her way. These include: a victim of childhood bullying that Koizumi defended who's till in love with her moves back to Osaka, Ootani's ex trying to win him back, and a homosexual transvestite who goes by the name of Seiko-chan whom gives Ootani his first kiss being the most hilarious. When she finally does tell him, he thinks she's making fun of him. It does take quite a few episodes for him to figure it out, after she puts it so blatantly, again. Turns out he just can't think of her as a girlfriend for being best friends for so long.
Skip ahead. Yeah, he can, so they start going out, but then College Exams are coming up and Ootani has to go to cram school, taking up all his free time. Koizumi wants to walk with him more often, so she gets a job as a waitress-a very clumsy one at that. Here she meets her haggy boss, and her friend Kohori. But he thinks of her as more than a friend. One day she stays at work late and falls asleep trying to memorize the menu. Kohori is just about to kiss her when she wakes up, and at the same moment-as luck would have it-Ootani shows up to walk her home only to find her cheating. She pleads and he gives her a second chance. She blows it when Kohori asks her as a friend to see the latest Omibouzo concert. Against her better judgement she goes, and once again is caught. Ootani dumps her, but she's persistant to win him back.
After all the hooplah, they end up together again, and it's the day before exams. Everyone in Ootani's house has the flu, so he's kicked out of his home, and none of his friend's will take him in. He ends up going to Koizumi's, where he meets her extremely tall-and nutty-family. That night it snows and they're all locked in, but Koizumi won't let him give up on his dream to become an elementary school gym teacher. She bike-rides him to the nearest subway, and he goes, and takes the test, and PASSES! YAY! She fells bad because she doesn't know what she wants to do with her life. On the way to celebrate, they come along their model friend Mimi during a photo shoot. The photographer demands she be a model for a bit, and she reluctantly agrees. While she is amazingly cute, she is stiff in front of the camera, but she meets the stylist, and she finally realises her call in life. SHE'S GOING TO BE A STYLIST!
It all ends with the cutest kiss scene ever, they're in the park walking on stairs and he asks her to turn around and he kisses her. Cute why? Because that's the one time he's taller than her!

Based on the classic comic by Winsor McKay, this cult classic film adapts the adventures of a young boy named Nemo, who is plagued by frightening and vivid nightmares. He is eventually sent an invitation from the the King of Slumberland to visit and meet his daughter Princess Camille. However, during his stay, he unwittingly unleashes the Nightmare King, a great evil that's been locked away for centuries. Now, not only is Slumberland in danger, but reality itself, and Nemo is trapped in a nightmare he can't wake up from! Will Nemo be able to set things right and save Slumberland from the ancient threat of the Nightmare King?

Fame...fortune...power...
The one man who had it all in this world was the great Pirate King, 
...whose fateful last words drove men to the sea.
"My treasure? If you want it, I will give it. All the riches in the world await the person who can but find it."
And so, brave souls set sail for the Grand Line in search of their dreams. The Great Age of Pirates had begun.
It's a pirate adventure like no other you've ever seen.
Now, 
 has set out on his own grand adventure. His goal, to fulfil a promise he made to his idol, the pirate 
, to seek out the Grand Line and find the Pirate King's treasure: One Piece. He is both blessed and cursed by having eaten of the Gum Gum fruit, known throughout the seas as the "Devil's Fruit". Though now unable to swim, his body is now able to stretch like rubber. With his newfound powers and the crew of the 
 at his side (famed pirate hunter 
, crafty pirate thief 
, compulsive liar 
, and suave but kicking cook 
), 
 sets out to follow in the wakes of the great pirates and write his own name in the pages of history.
Take note that despite its recent release, 
 can be considered very "retro" in style. The style and the somewhat whimsical storyline appear to take a page from Akira Toriyama's classic 
.
The manga version of the story can be read in the pages of "Shonen Jump" magazine.

Linebarrels of Iron is a Sci-Fi Mecha saga that takes place in an alternate future, where a young student named Kouichi Hayase is left in a coma after an accident involving a crash landing of a Satellite in the year 2016. After waking up half a year later, he awakens to find himself possessing powers and superhuman strength. He also discovers a mysterious robot known as "Linebarrel." (These machines are called "Machinas.") This robot was the source of the crash landing and has transformed Kouichi into a "Factor," which gives him the ability to pilot the Machina robot.
Kouichi also meets an amnesiac girl named Emi Kizaki and discovers that her past might be related to Linebarrel. Together they join the organization of JUDA, a medical equipment maker that is secretly developing Machina robots. They wind up in a war against a mysterious threat that is invading from an alternate dimension.

The Deep Sleep Capsules...technology that has allowed man to reach out to the stars.
These chambers slow the aging process by 95%.
A 20-year trip passes, and the traveler has only aged 1 year.
It definitely has its advantages...but after you've been on a few trips, it sure gets very lonely.
Right now, however, that's not the big issue.
The year is 2264.
The Syncam Corporation has sent the Saldes and its crew of 13 (and 1 cat) out into deep space to explore the potential of a newfound planet 20 years away.
Soon after they awaken from their stasis, however, things are happening one after another.
First, the crew learns that two of the crew are not who they claim to be.
Then, one by one, crewmembers die suddenly.
Then, the ship begins to turn against them.
And as if it couldn't get any worse, they find another mess on their hands...and it is ugly.
What was supposed to be a simple exploratory mission has become a struggle for survival in the depths of space.
20 years from home, they're all alone...and no one can hear them scream.

Lucky Star is about the everyday lives of several school girls at a Japanese high school with a very loose humor tone. The main heroine is 
, an athletic and intelligent girl who, despite this, is not in a sports club, and constantly gets low grades. This is mainly because of her love of anime and video games.
The serialization began with the four main characters in their first year of high school: 
, 
, 
, and 
. As the story progresses, they move onto their second and third year.
The anime has no underlying plot line (yet at least); it is mostly just humor.

is a spinoff series from the 
 series, and is about a normal student named Nozomi Yumehara. She finds Coco, a cute little creature that is looking for a magical book called the Dream Collect. Coco comes from a different world called the Palmier Kingdom.
Nozomi decides to help Coco restore his world, which is in the hands of an organization called the Nightmare Company. A pink butterfly that changes Nozomi into Cure Dream. Of course, she can't work alone so she must choose four students that will help restore the Palmier Kingdom.

Scientists have made an outstanding discovery... that creatures once thought to be mystical actually, physically exist! We're talking creatures like dragons, werewolves, and mermaids... and guess what? It's possible for any kid to raise them and train them to play an ultimate role-playing game called "Legendz".
Legendz is a fun game, sort of like 
. The Legendz are actually alive... or, well at least some people believe they are. Necrom Legendz are certainly alive though. If you are a saga sometimes your Legendz can come alive even without the Talispod.

Will is a young man, about college age, who we find returning to his home town of Little Monica after having been away for quite some time while he partook in his studies and attempted to become a worldly man. Along the way, he meets a sexy young woman named Meow who is also traveling to Little Monica. She is dressed in an erotic skin-tight cat outfit, complete with tail. She tells Will that she is a performer making her way to Little Monica to put on a show at some exclusive club, and Will is excited to hear it. Will thinks back to the town he loved, how full of artistic expression it was, and specifically how much he loved the performances that were showcased in the exclusive amphitheater she mentioned. So Will decides to check out the show before heading over to meet his old "girlfriend".

As he waits in the dark room with all the other patrons for the show to begin, he immediately notices something different about the place. Instead of smelling all elegant from all the lords and ladies dressed up nice to take in a lovely, cultured evening show, the room was ripe with a stench like that from a crowd of fat, sweaty men. Then the stage lights flick on, and reveal the lovely Meow, still dressed in her skin-tight kitty outfit... though not for long. The realization that Ms. Meow is actually putting on a strip show quickly overwhelms our young, homesick boy, though that doesn't stop him from watching, of course! And it's a good thing too, because then he might have missed out on the second part of the show....

Once the stripping portion was over and Meow was completely bare, she then moved on to the next part of her routine: selecting one of the men from her captive audience to come up on stage, get naked, and have sex with her right then and there! Hmm, I wonder who she'll pick... fat, sweaty guy number one? No... old, sweaty guy number two? No... handsome, young Will? Bingo! At first he's nervous about doing this in front of a whole group of horny guys, but one whisper from Meow about how she'll make him forget all about them hits the mark and they start going at it without regard to anyone else. And apparently Will is "the man", because when it's over she lets him know that this was the first time she ever had a real orgasm up on stage. You go, Will!

Will's next stop is to find his old friend, Celia. He reaches the house, and her two sisters, Tina and Mei, answer the door, though it's not long before Celia herself arrives home. Each of them has grown into beautiful young women, and they're all very happy to see that Will has returned. They invite him to stay with them while he learns about what kind of place their town has become in his absence. Oh, and they also introduce him to some weird floating puff-ball creature that apparently just showed up one day. They don't know where it came from or why it showed up, and it really doesn't even seem to serve any purpose, at least until this one day when Will, Celia, and her sisters were all sitting around and Kajo burst through the door!

Kajo is the evil man who runs the town nowadays. He removed all culture from the once elegant city, and replaced it with debauchery. He also banned all music for some odd reason, except for during the strip shows for which the announcer was able to convince him that she show would be no good without it. So now Kajo and his two henchmen make a surprise entry into Celia's house and demands that all three of the girls get naked at once! Will tries to fight them off, to no avail. The floating blob, however, begins to play a tune on its violin, which seems to cause Kajo to become instantly ill. Not being able to stand it, Kajo takes his leave, and has his henchmen follow, while Will and the girls are left wondering what the heck that was all about.

Soon another plot starts to develop, which has something to do with the spirit of Little Monica, the woman for whom the town was named after, hiding in someone's body, and a prophecy about obtaining complete control of the city which Kajo is after. It all seems to make sense when your watching it, but mostly I think you'll just be focusing on all the sex scenes, which are extremely well done. This is a very light hearted title, with all the sex being consensual and enjoyed. A lot of pastels are used, which fit the tone nicely. The character designs are also well done and properly proportioned. If you're new to the 
, this would be an excellent film to start with, and if you're not new to the genre, this would still make an excellent addition to your collection. Very highly recommended!

Orphaned thirteen years ago, young Will is returning to his hometown of Little Monica, where he hope to bring what he learned from his studies abroad. In Will's memory, Little Monica was a happy town, a cultural center that was brimming with music and smiles.
But when Will returned, he is shocked that the town, which was now run by a sleazy, music-hating dirtbag named Kajo, had degenerated into a sad place, where the former concert hall had been turned into a strip joint. Can Will... with a little help from a sexy stripper whose heart he stolen... save Little Monica and turn it back into the happy place it was?

"The era of the Gods was closing. Their once eternal rule had come to an end.
The heavens trembled as the armies of Falis, God of Light, clashed with those of Falaris, God of Darkness.
Their perpetual battle ensued. The earth wept.
The seas boiled.
In the end, each side had but one survivor: Marfa, Goddess of Creation, and Kardis, Goddess of Destruction.
They met in a final battle that echoed to the ends of the earth.
When it was over, a new land was born, broken away from the rest of the continent, and the last flames of the once-invincible forces of the Goddesses of Light and Dark flickered and died away.
Thousands of years have passed, and now the land to the south of the continent of Alicrast has become known as Lodoss, the Accursed Island." - The Prologue of RoLW.
Lodoss has always been in turmoil, wars the norm and not the exception for thousands of years.
Now, the tide of this bitter conflict is about to turn drastically for the worse, which is where an unlikely party of six join together under a common cause.
There is 
, the young fighter with an incredible destiny; 
, the beautiful elf with deadly skill and a crush on 
; 
, 
's old friend and a priest of Falis; 
, a powerful wizard; 
, a tough old dwarf with secrets; and 
, the cynical but otherwise good-natured thief.
The story is set in a war between 
 of Marmo and 
 of Valis, once the closest of friends.

 is ready to send armies of darkness to strike without mercy.
Meanwhile, the wizard 
, 
's advisor, intends to revive the Goddess of Destruction, Kardis, by stealing an ancient scepter.
And all the while, the Grey Witch, 
, makes her moves behind the scenes, manipulating everyone so that no one man has all the power.
This is what these six must face ad they see sights, meet allies, and face enemies beyond imagination.
It's Light vs. Darkness.
The future of Lodoss is at stake, and the war has just begun.

title: Record of Lodoss War: Chronicles of Heroic Knight

description:
The Record of Lodoss War: Chronicles of Heroic Knight TV series is a sequel to the first seven episodes of the 
 OVA series, which were based on the Lodoss books. The five remaining OVA episodes were not based on the books, but rather were simply a conclusion created from scratch to tie up the series, since continuing with the story from the books would have either ended the series in the middle of a story arc or have taken way too many episodes to reach a spot with a satisfactory conclusion. Thus, the TV series completely ignores those final five episodes in order to continue the story as it happened in the books.
It has been five years since the War of Heroes ended, and now the evil 
 is out looking for a magical item called the scepter of domination so that he can rule all of Lodoss. He visits Neese at the Temple of Marfa, hoping that this was the treasure that the ancient dragon Bramd gave to her, though when he learns that she sold the dragon's treasure to pay for upkeep of the temple, he realizes it could not have been what he was after. But at least Neese now knows that 
 is back, so she can give fair warning to 
 and the gang. Let's just hope there's enough time to stop him!

Meanwhile, 
 and 
 arrive in town of Zaxon on a mission to collect taxes for the kingdom, though the villagers claim that they are independent and not part of the kingdom. 
 expected as much, and came prepared to fight. So apparently they're not aware that this is the home town of 
, the heroic free knight. Initially, a sorcerer named Cecil that 
 left in charge while he was away came out to face the mercenaries. The dope quickly falls into a trap they set for him, but is soon rescued when 
 and 
 arrive on scene. After a quick battle where 
 turns into a raging berserker, unable to tell friend from foe, they all become friends and head into town.

While there, 
 arrives and gets the gang up to date on what 
's up to, so they all head out to Flaim in hopes of sign up the great 
 to join their quest. It's not long after arriving in Flaim that 
 finds himself helping out a poor civilian being terrorized by a group of soldiers. When the military actually realizes who 
 is, they immediately feel stupid and escort the group to Castle Akroyd. After a discussion on the current situation, they figure that since they don't know which of the two most likely dragons has the treasure that 
 is after, there is no other choice than to split up into two groups, with each taking a dragon.


 leads the first group, consisting of 
 and 
, and they head off to Fire Dragon Mountain to find the dragon called Shooting Star. 
 is put in charge of the second group, and he, along with 
 and Cecil, head off to Blue Dragon Island to check out the water-dragon Abram. Unbeknownst to both parties, 
 has decided to try his luck at Blue Dragon Island first, though 
's group is unable to make an attempt at him due to the fact that they were captured by pirates! 
, 
, 
, what are we gong to do with you? But on the bright side, 
 doesn't find what he's looking for at Blue Dragon Island. Of course, with every bright side, there's a dark side....

But wait! This fantastic adventure all comes to an exciting conclusion in episode eight! And there are still 19 more episodes to go! What's a show to do? Well, if you're this show, you'll start a completely new storyline, this time focusing on the youngster named 
 whom we met briefly earlier in the series, though now it is ten years later and 
 is well on his way to becoming a knight like his idol, 
. This new adventure sends 
 out to stop an evil sorcerer named 
, who is bound and determined to resurrect the mega nasty Kardis! Sure sounds exciting! But honestly, I much preferred the first part of the series. The second part got me a little confused....

At the end of each episode there is a little short called "Welcome to Lodoss Island" in which cute, simply-animated child-like versions of the characters play out a funny little skit. The first was great, with them giving a simple, easy-to-understand summary of episode. The following skits were also funny, but they didn't summarize the plot in any way, which is unfortunate because both my wife and I thought that was a great idea, so that's why after the first one, we found the rest were a bit disappointing. Oh yeah, I should also point out that the animation isn't a good as the OVA series, but that's pretty typical, as TV series usually aren't due to budget and time constraints.
On a side note, Central Park Media has recently repriced the DVD set of Record of Lodoss War: Chronicles of Heroic Knight to $39.99. Also, Central Park Media has made the first episode available for 
, along with many other of its titles.

title: Lodoss Tou Senki: Eiyuu Kishi Den

description:
Ronin Warriors was originally called Yoroiden Samurai Troopers in Japan. It was produced as a joint effort by Sunrise Animation Studio and Nagoya Television. It first aired in Japan on April 30th, 1988 and ran weekly through March 4th, 1989. Yoroiden Samurai Troopers (YST) was a far bigger success than was Ronin Warriors (its American dub). YST was originally planned for only 19 episodes but the popularity of the show prompted the producers to extend it for another season for a total of 39 episodes
Yoroiden Samurai Troopers is the story about five teenage boys, given mystical armor to protect the world from the evil 
. The story begun 1000 years ago, when 
 wanted to take over the ningenkai. He almost succeed when 
 managed to defeat him. However, although 
's soul is banished to the Youjakai, his armor is left intact. The armor therefore becomes a link for 
 to come back to Ningenkai.


 divided the armor into nine separate armor suits. Each armor will choose its bearer, and together they will fight 
. At least that's the original intention (well, you know what happened next, don't you? ^^). 
 finds out 
's plan, and thus attempts to find the armor himself. He manages to find four suits of armor with their four bearers, and persuaded them to follow (and serve) him. Those four are 
, 
, 
, and 
. After they follow 
, they become his MaSho (demon general).
The rest of the armor, however, is still safe within 
's protection. The bearer of these fives suits of armors are called Samurai Troopers. They are 
, 
, 
, 
, and 
. Each represents an element of nature and has a "kanji" that suits their personality.

There are 3 OVA series. The first is a two-episode series called 
 (Ronin Warriors Gaiden). The second is a five-episode series titled 
 which introduces a tribal warrior from Africa who wears a mysterious Black Armor that looks eerily similar to 
's Inferno Armor. At the end of this series, the five armors, as well as both Inferno Armors, are completely destroyed. The Third OVA series is called 
, and it introduces a strange woman from the Edo period who was involved with a play that actually foretold in striking detail the events of the Samurai Troopers battle with 
 and the forces of the netherworld.
The play ended when the government accused everyone involved with it of treason and executed them, leaving behind this woman, who vows revenge against the armors. The series is mostly composed of images from the main series and the "Legend of the Inferno Armor" OVA with characters talking about various things that usually have absolutely nothing to do with the scene you're watching. By the end of "Message" each one of the five has a brand new Armor, born from this woman's hatred and sorrow. The Armors are still called the same things as the old ones and bear the same symbols, they just look different.

creator: Hajime Yadate
title: Yoroiden Samurai Troopers
Legendary Armor Samurai Troopers
director: Masashi Ikeda, Mamoru Hamatsu, Kazuki Akane

description:
Oji Tanaka has hit the point all men fear at some point in their lives, the mid-life crisis. With a wife, son, and a mundane office job as a salary man in Tokyo, life has become extremely dull for him. He reminisces back to his younger days, 15 years ago to be exact when he was known as Gabriel, the leader of the short lived Rock band known as "Black Heaven."
However, all of that changes one day when a beautiful woman named Layla invites him to use his Gibson Flying V guitar and his "legendary" music skills. As it turns out, Oji becomes a vital weapon in an intergalactic war against an evil alien race. However, this is one job that makes life a bit too exciting and complicated for Oji to handle....

creator: Hiroki Hayashi
title: Kachou Ouji - Hard Rock Save the Space

description:
There was a battle between the world of angels and the world of devils. The devils, lead by Rain Devila, wanted to take away all of the love on earth. They wanted something called saint something four, which was supposed to be a very powerful item that can be used in the battle against the world of angels.
So Aphrodite, the queen of the world of angels, gave powers to normal junior high school students to fight against the devils. She also needed the saint something four to protect her world from the devils. The three girls who transform into the fighters were 
, 
, and 
, who were first year students of Sei Hanazono Gakuen junior high school. The three girls received items that enabled them to transform into 
, Angel Lily, and 
.
In the latter half of the TV series, a new fighter angel, Angel Salvia, appeared.
The transformation of the girls goes from normal clothes to wedding dress, to battle outfit. Why is this stage to the wedding dress necessary? This is because they need to build up the power of love, which is necessary for the final transformation. The girls do not do much fighting while they are in their wedding dress outfits, as it is too big and clumsy to fight in. The battle suits that they wear are very sexy, slightly armored outfits.

title: Ai Tenshi Densetsu Wedding Peach
Legend of the Angel of Love: Wedding Peach

description: is a young master swordsman who fights various demonic enemies and his governor The Devil of Wind "Takeshi Onimaru", using the magical sword called The Sword of God of Thunder. He stays with his father's old adversary, Raizo, and goes to the same school as Raizo's cute daughter, Sayaka Mine.

Le Chevalier D'Eon presents a unique anime take on the history of Louis XV. During his reign, many women have mysteriously vanished. D'Eon de Beaumont's sister Lia is one of the many victims, until she is found dead in a coffin down the Seine river. Determined to find out how she died, D'Eon believes the Duke Orleans is involved, but he uses his power as a member of the secret police to help investigate.
However, things take a strange twist when the Duke and the police are mysteriously murdered leaving D'Eon a survivor due to a mysterious cross around his neck. And things proceed to get stranger when D'Eon suddenly becomes possessed by Lia's spirit.

This movie is about young girl called 
. I think she is sad and lonely but she finds 
. I'm amazed what he goes through to prove his love for her. He even pulled out his own soul for her. And he disses all the other girls. He is always spaced out until he finally wakes up to what's really happening.

characters.name: God/ King of the Celestial World

description:
The Law of Ueki stars a strange boy with a large amount of justice in him. Kousuke Ueki always protects the weak. And he has the power to change trash into trees. As he did this, a girl named Mori Ai saw him, and thus started following him around.
Kobayashi, also known as Koba-sen to Ueki and Mori, is the one who gave Ueki's his powers. Then he met Sano, who has the power to change towels into steel. They became good friends after some moments.
Then he met his rival, Robert. They fought, and was the reason Koba-sen got sent to hell. Kobayashi pulled Anon with him, but he failed.
Then he met Robert's group of ten, where he met Rinko. At first they where enemies, but when Ueki was trying to save two of her companions, one of the guys she was with was shooting tomatoes (for his power was to change tomatoes into lava). At first she fired beads at him (because her power was to change beads into bombs). Then she protected him by shooting a bead to the tomato of the guy she was with.
He also met Tenko in a fight. He was out of hell's prison. And because of that fight he discovered that Ueki is a heavenly being.
Here in this show you will see lots of lessons and morals. You will be inspired in every fight of Ueki, for he has a strong will to protect his friends and to follow the justice that Kobayashi showed him.

The Law of Ueki tells the story of the Battle of the Supernatural Powers, to decide who is worthy to be the next King of the Celestial Tournament. One hundred (100) candidates is required to choose a high school student to act as their fighter. Each of the students are given a very unique power-- the power to change something into something else, (i.e. changing cottons into stake, soil into cannon balls, beads into bombs, towels into steel, or even trash into trees!) as considering it to weapon for fighting. The winning student will be given the Blank Talent (or Blank Zai), a talent they can choose whatever they wish. Which lead some students on wanting to gain this Blank Talent for their own thoughts of selfish, and greedy schemes.
There comes upon a young, thirteen year-old student named Kousuke Ueki, with the ability to change trash into trees. Given to him by his teacher Kobayashi or Koba-sen (Mr. K in the jap. version). Joining this tournament, Ueki decided to win the tournament himself; to keep the Blank Talent from falling to the wrong hands, from those who are planning to would abuse it.
He is joined by his friends Ai Mori, Sano Seichiro, Hideyoshi Soya, Rinko Jerrard, and Tenko as they go through the tournament facing opposition along the way; come face-to-face with Robert Haydn, a mysterious being with a very mysterious ability and his ten fighters included in the tournament; and also discover the meaning of friendship, teamwork and justice!

The Law of Ueki revolves around a junior high student named Kosuke Ueki, and it tells the story of battles of power users in order to get the blank talent and to determine who's candidate will be the next God.
Each god candidate chooses a junior high student to be their power user and they give them a power to use in the tournament. Ueki's god Candidate is sent to hell early in the tournament because he interferes in a fight which is against the rules. So Ueki strives for his god candidate, Kobayshi's justice, and wants protect the blank talent from evil users.
With the help of a non-power user, Ai Mori, Rinko Rerrard, Seiichiro Sano, Hideyoshi, and Tenko, Ueki reaches his goal.

From the creators of 
, Last Exile is a Steampunk Sci-Fi adventure that takes place on the alternate world of Prestel, where beyond the creation of its Industrial Revolution where many ships sailed the skies, a long and bloody war between the countries of Anatole ("East") and Dysis ("West") raged. Casting a mysterious shadow on this conflict exists the organization known as the Guild.
The story focuses on two orphans Claus and Lavie, who have inherited a Vanship (a special wingless aircraft) and soon find themselves in the middle of of this conflict after being left in charge of protecting a mysterious young girl named Alvis. After that, they are dragged into the war after boarding the powerful airship known as the Silvania (lead by the stoic captain Alex Row). They soon learn that Alvis may be the key to finally ending the war and deciding the very fate of Prestel itself....

Last Exile is another anime that takes place in the future. I have noticed that it is very similar to 
 except that it takes place in the sky.
The two main characters Claus and Lavie, both 15 years old, accompanied by the mysterious Alvis Hamilton, an 11 year old girl who is completely unaware of what's going on, all find themeselves dragged into an awesome air ship known as the Silvana... which has a historical record of never being "sunk". Captained by Alex Row, they all eventually learn to live with the crew.

La Naki Ko Remi is based on the novel Le Naki Ko by famous French writer, Hector Malot. The original starred a boy as the hero, Remi, but in the anime La Naki Ko Remi, Remi is a girl.
Remi lives in a small town in France. She is a very kind and cheerful girl who has a great voice. But one day her father, who had come back from Paris, told her that he was not his paternal daughter, that she was actually adopted.
Vitaris, a traveling Circus director, discovered Remi's talent, so Remi ran away from her home with Vitaris, Jolly (a monkey), and the three dogs as her only family. But when two of the dogs die trying to protect Remi and the others, it is very sad at the point that it could make any person cry. Soon after that event Vitaris dies, leaving Remi alone with Jolly and the dog.
But before Vitaris died, he told Remi to go to see a man called Mister Gaspard in Paris. When she arrives in France, Remi learns that Mister Gaspard was killed a year before by Gaspard the second, who is a very cruel man. A lot of sad and unfortunate things happen to her, but in the end Remi finds her real family.
This anime is very touching. There are at least five episodes that made me cry. This anime is part of World Masterpiece Theater.

Notice: Lady Death is not Japanese animation! It is a cartoon produced in the US. However, because it has a style that is strongly influenced by anime, I have decided to include it on this site. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
Originally an innocent woman, Hope discovers that she is, in fact, the daughter of Lucifer, for which she is burned at the stake. Now condemned to Hell because of this revelation, Hope (now known as Lady Death) finds strength within herself as she now seeks to destroy her father... and free those wrongly condemned to the pit... namely her mother and former love.

When Lost Universe first came out, it was considered by fans to be Slayers in Space, as it had several similarities to 
. But in time, Lost Universe outgrew that tag.
In the far future, the evil Nightmare Syndicate is trying to conquer the whole universe by any means necessary. At their disposal are special ships called Lost Ships that use Psi-energy as their weapons. Now the only thing standing in their way is the Lost Ship Swordbreaker commanded by the sword-weilding cape-wearing Kain Blueriver and his sidekicks Millenium "Millie" Farrier Nocturne who's the best cook and gun shooter in the universe, and Swordbreaker's mainframe disguised as a girl called Canal Volfield.

is a normal second year student of the general education part of a music school. The school is founded by a musician who loved music and wanted to teach others music as well. He once found a little creature, Lili, of which he saved the life. In return, Lili, who was actually a music fairy, blessed his school with the gift of music.
One morning 
 meets Lili, the music fairy, at the school's entrance. He tells 
 she is a chosen one, since she is able to see him. 
 is shocked to see a creature like Lili and she runs away, before Lili can explain for what she is chosen.
Then suddenly the school bells ring to announce the contestants of the interschool music contest. Along with five others, 
 is chosen to participate in this contest. The only problem: 
 doesn't play any instrument!!
 has a second meeting with Lili in which the fairy explains why 
 has to join the contest. There was an almost legendary rumor about the fact a general education student would be chosen to participate the contest and Lili is going to help her with this. He gives 
 a magical violin, but at first 
 doesn't want to have anything to do with this. She doesn't know a thing about music. Lili then assures 
 she can play whatever she wants, as long as she feels the music in her heart. In the end 
 accepts the challenge of the music contest.
This is a story about

is your typical 16 year old boy who, ten years ago, was promised to marry his cousin

Tony Stark is a scientist, as well as a major weapons manufacturer. But when he is gravely injured by terrorist, he turns himself INTO a weapon, using his knowledge to fashion a powerful armor suit to defend the weak... as well as preserving his life! However, when he decides to dedicate himself to peace, he finds himself using his newfound powers to prevent his technology from falling into the wrong hands!

The starship

, to rescue the ship and it mysterious cargo (and the vice-president of the Tendan Tippedai Corporation while they're at it). Of course 
's little sister and apprentice bounty hunter

They also find the Tendan Tippedai Corporation's mysterious cargo, an unkillable monster know as Zeiram. A battle ensues with 
 while

 lands on a planet where she inadvertantly picks up a tag-a-long little street-kid named

Back on her homeword,

Mie has problems. He works in a convenience store alongside two beautiful women, Fujisawa and Otonashi, yet Fujisawa hates him and he is too shy to ask Otonashi out on a date. The green-haired Otonashi is also a shy one, making any potential relationship seemed doomed from the get-go, and Fujisawa seems to be in a permanent bad mood. But one day after work something happens that makes him forget all his woes... he bumps into a gentleman who drops a bottle of pills with a label that reads "Disappearing Tablets". Before Mie can hand them back to the guy, he begins to sparkle and then vanishes into thin air!
As Mie stands in a daze trying to figure out exactly what happened, two school girls in traditional school uniforms with pleated short skits walk by, and whisper something unflattering about him as they pass. So Mie decides what the heck, and pops a pill. To test it out, he positions himself in the path of one of the girls, and when she unexpectedly bumps right into him, he knows he has something extremely amazing cooped up in a bottle. After lifting a few skirts to see their pretty panties, Mie decides to take it to the next level... and visits a bath house.

Amazingly enough, Mie seems content to remain just a voyeur in this land of beautiful naked female flesh. When the time to interact does arrive, it does so to no fault of Mie... he's just relaxing in one of the baths when one of the girls just happens to come over and sit down right on top of him. Now, I have no idea why she didn't freak at this, I mean even if he is invisible, he would still displace the water so that would look kinda weird. And even if it was too steamy to notice this, surly she would notice when sitting that her seat felt like human flesh rather than hard bath tile.

Next he has the bright idea to check out the Hanazono All-Female Academy. After a few pantie peaks while the girls hang around the classroom, he follows the lovely ladies into the locker room where he watches the do their thing. Once again Mie seems content with simply spectating. Unfortunately, one of the girls, Suzu, was late arriving, and thus is just getting started to change when all the rest are leaving... meaning Mie will have one all alone. As the rest of the girls head out, one jokingly warns Suzu that there is a ghost which attacks girls who are all alone. Immediately a light bulb goes off over Mie's head, and he decides to use this to his advantage, throwing the though of pure spectating out the window.... and I'm certain you can figure out what happens next!

Kenji Tomosaka moved to the country side of Japan from the city with his sister Suzuka. One day at the beach, he met a little girl named Nanami. Their meeting was not very smooth, but they start to become really close and hang out all the time.
Now, fast forward to the future. They are now high school students in the summer time. Many girls now enter Kenji's life who seem to like him... like how Nanami does. It is based on a hentai game of the same title from Nekoneko software

Muteki Kanban Musume, or "The Invincible Poster Girl", is about precisely that... an invincible poster girl! Meet 
, a young adult who works at a Chinese restaurant with her mom selling ramen and the like. 
 is supposed to be the poster girl of the restaurant, but she spends most of her time goofing off and fighting! Seriously! She spends like half the series acting out violently.
Mainly, her acts of violence are directed to her lifelong rival, 
.

Here's an anime like no other folks! L/R (Licensed By Royalty) is a breathtaking anime that is filled with action, adventure, and a lot of comedy.
You follow the story of a famed agent duo: Jack, a smooth talker with excellent gunning skills, and Rowe, the easy-going one and a master of disguise. These two work in an agency named Cloud 7.
Of course you can't expect them to work by themselves. Also working with them is a young woman named Claire, who gives them info on their mission, Des, an inventor for Cloud 7, and Noelle, a young girl who tags along on some of their adventures.
Watch these five people as they go from one mission to another in L/R (licensed By Royalty).

Notice:

If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
Based in the near future of earth and space, the Irkens, a technologically advanced race of alien cyborgs, plan an invasion on the entire universe. But there is one thing holding them back... 
. He destroyed the last plans, and to keep him from performing a repeat, the 
 and

Along with his robot sidekick 
 (who disguises himself as a dog), they try to make plans to annihilate the human race. 
, though a brilliant little boy, is always there to ruin his plans.
Will 
 ever win? Watch and see what happens!

Invader ZIM is about 
, a megalomaniacal (and inept) little alien from the Planet Irk. Lead by the snack-loving Almighty Tallest (on Irk, size determines your role on the Planet), the Irkens are preparing for a mass conquest of the Universe. 
 is incredibly excited to begin his mission, though he has a rather messy history, (Like accidently attacking his own planet on a psychotic spree) and none of the Irkens really want anything to do with him.
The Tallest give him a mission to the "backwater" planet known as Earth (only in order to ultimately get rid of him). However,

. (What

Most of the humans are too stupid to figure it out, but a kid named 
 (who is the son of a famous scientist, and completely obsessed with the Paranormal) quickly sees through his disguise. 
 dedicates himself to ridding the Earth of 
, even though NO ONE seems to believe him. Will 
 succeed in his mission of Doom? Is 
 really the only person smart enough on Earth to see through 
's bad disguise? Will

The first feature length Inuyasha flick once again throws our heroes into a battle for the Sacred Jewel shards. This time they go up against Menoumaru, the son of a Chinese demon who was sealed up by 
 200 years ago.
Awakened by the power of the Sacred Jewel shard, he goes on a vicious campaign to dominate the world and seek revenge by attempting to absorb the remains of his father and every human soul in his path. However, as 
 masters the ultimate attack of the Tetsaiga, they still find a powerful enemy in Menoumaru, and even manages to turn his own friends against him!
Soon enough, 
 and

description: Meet Just Ueki Tylor, an irresponsible guy with no goals in life, no skills and no leadership qualities, though he may just become a galactic hero! Joining the United Planets Space Force on a plan to get an easy life from his career he stumbles onto a Galactic war with the Holy Raalgon Empire. Tylor soon becomes promoted to Lieutenant Commander after winning many life and death situations through sheer dumb luck! He is soon given command of the Soyokaze, the lowliest ship in the Earth's fleet with a team of ragtag misfits at the helm. However, these group of underdogs may end up saving the day, especially with having Tylor's unorthodox methods at work!

The Tenchi Muyo! legend continues with an all-new series, and a new hero with a familiar linage – as well as FAMILIAR problems!
Kenshi Masaki is just like any other boy in Japan – only he just happens to be the half-brother of 
! All of a sudden, the poor boy gets whisked away to the planet Geminar, which has been suffering through a continuing series of wars in its history. Strangely, it seems that Kenshi's heritage has made him a candidate to pilot a bio-mechanical machine that might bring peace to that embattled planet – a destiny that someone (
?) might have known before his birth!

description:
Interstella 5555 is a collaboration between French House band Daft Punk the and classic anime artist/director Leiji Matsumoto (
, 
) resulting in a musical anime experience like no other. Told completely without any dialog, this animated Sci-Fi musical (done completely to the soundtrack of Daft Punk's "Discovery") tells the story of The Crescendolls, a famous intergalactic band from a far away galaxy.
During a concert, the band is abducted by a mysterious army and brought to Earth. Under the control of the evil Earl of Darkwood, the Crescendolls are given human appearances and have all of their memories erased, beginning new lives on Earth as an up and coming new band. They quickly become a worldwide phenomenon. However, all of this doesn't sit too well with a security guard named Shep, who travels to Earth in order to free the band from Earl's control.
Will the Cresendolls regain their memories and regain freedom from Earl's sinister ambitions and return home? The mysteries that unravel reveals that Earl's influence is much wider than anyone could ever imagine.....

, a young woman who enters the exclusive Ohtori Academy, is like no woman you've ever seen. Blowing away any expectations you've come to expect, she carries dreams of her unknown past and one great wish: to be a protector.
And she will soon learn that she will become more of a protector than she had ever imagined, beginning with the mysterious Rose Bride, 
. A drama filled with strange mysteries and lots of shadow, 
 must now stand up against the truth about Ohtori Academy and about her mysterious past: truths that can literally change the world.

A girl with a rose crested ring who doesn't really know her past finds out that she will become a dualist against the student council members of her school. The "Rose Bride" and her become good friends and her heart breaks when she has to give her up. A mystical prince who also has a shady past helps Utena through her battles against the student council members in the secret arena, he stays in the upside down castle on the ceiling of the arena.
