This weapon is so powerful and dangerous that it was supposedly sealed for 700 years. That is, until it mysteriously reawakens in 
's time. Attaching itself to

Both 
 and 
 must put aside their differences, face their past and come together in order to save the world from Sounga's destructive ambitions. However, that's easier said than done.....

description:
Seto no Hanayome revolves around a regular young teenager named Nagasumi Michishio. One day, he is saved from drowning by a mermaid named San Seto. However, there's a catch. If a mermaid's identity is revealed to a human, both the mermaid and human are to be executed under Mermaid Law.
In order to save both their lives, San Seto relies on connections through her family (who are the heads of their own mafia!) and put the both of them under a reluctant marriage. Though all of this doesn't sit too well with Seto's father Gozaburo, who carries a hatred for humans.
Now poor Nagasumi is trying just to adjust and stay alive with constant attempts on his life. This is one new lifestyle that this poor kid is going to find tough to get used to. Let the insanity begin!

The anime starts out with 
 driving early in the morning, doing his normal tofu delivery for his father, Bunta's, shop. He is driving an AE86 (aka: hachi roku, which means 86 in Japanese) Toyota Sprinter Trueno (it's American name is Corolla GTS). 
 has been driving the Akina mountain pass since he was in middle school; he knows every bump and crack on the road. 
 has also learned the art of drifting, which he didn't learn on purpose, to get himself home faster. As well as doing the deliveries, he works part time at a gas station with his best friend Takeuchi Itsuki, and the leader of the Akina Speedstars team, Koichiro Iketani.
Little does 
 know, but he is going to become a very famous person, through trials and tribulations with other car drivers that wish to beat him in a race. His first race is with 
, who drives a third generation RX-7. 
, for some reason that the characters in the anime can't explain, beats 
 and his 340 horsepower RX-7.
 continues winning the battles against rival drivers, until 
 (the second season). He blows the engine in the hachi roku, and gained a technical loss versus Sudoh Kyoichi, who drives a Lancer Evolution 3 (all the Lancer's have been dubbed LanEvo's in this series). 
 then gets a new engine put in the hachi roku, but has some minor problems with the engine, being that it hasn't been tuned properly. He and the others that work at the gas station get the needed parts and put them on the car, for the last race before the movie, which is the race between the hachi roku, driven by 
 (Trueno), and Wataru (Levin Turbo).
The movie has the best overall animation and the races are great and plentiful. You will not be bored with this anime if you love cars, drama, and lots of fast action. I give this movie a 10 out of 10 for the simple fact that the realism factor is incredibly close in this anime. Closer, in fact, than in any anime I have witnessed over the years.

description:
Misono General Hospital sets the stage for yet another sexually charged anime featuring a doctor who fancies himself as god's gift to nurses. In this series, the doctor's name is Jyunichi, and he's one hell of a surgeon. He's so good, in fact, that he has become the reputation of the entire hospital... and though he may feign modesty in public, privately he knows that he is the bomb! Oh, and that whole god's gift to women thing... that part may actually be somewhat true as well. Now, every nurse that he takes "under his pants" does resist at first, but shortly into their session each one of them is begging for more!

Now, about the plot. It seems the president of the hospital is ill, and rumors have it that he's considering retirement, sooner than later. Doctor Jyunichi, with his outstanding reputation, is the forerunner for taking over the position, until the president's daughter, Serika, enters the picture. It seems she was away, training to be a doctor in the same field of medicine as Doctor Jyunichi. Coincidence? Yeah, right. Well, her training is done. She is now a full fledged doctor, and she's not only ready to take over for her father, she's ready, willing, and eager to fire Doctor Jyunichi!

Why would she want to get rid of such a brilliant, upstanding guy? Let's just say that it has to do with a little incident that happened several years prior. At any rate, Doctor Jyunichi isn't going down without a fight. Luckily, the good doctor's talent as a surgeon is matched by his talent as a... how do I say... fulfiller of women's pleasures. One by one Jyunichi turns the nurses into his sex slaves, completely wrapping them around his little finger... or other such extremity. And each slave is fully willing to help bring aboard the next member to their troupe.

Once the doctor's minions, Yayoi, Miyuki, Nanami, and Aya, are in place, it's time to start Operation: Discredit Serika! The nurses begin to secretly sabotage Doctor Serika in order to show her father and the board that she doesn't have what it takes to run the hospital. And it seems to be working! Doctor Serika can't figure out what's going on, and Doctor Jyunichi looks to be back as the front runner for replacing the president. Ah, but since when does a story end that smoothly! Will Serika catch on to Jyunichi's plan? And if so, will it be soon enough to stop it? Who will ultimately win out? You might be surprised....

Infinite Ryvius is about this training school in space that was almost destroyed by some hijackers. The teachers are all killed, and the trainees are all trapped in a ship-type thing called the Ryvius. While all 487 students on board wait to be rescued, they are actually mistaken as terrorists and branded as outlaws. Also on board is a robot called the Vital Guarder. The Ryvius is controlled by 
, Ikumi, and the piloting crew. The Ryvius and the Vital Guarder are always in battles because the government is constantly after them.
Kouji is the main character, and he tries to keep everything sane... but doesn't usually succeed. Kouji and his brother, Yuuki, are always getting into fights.
Neeya is another main character. She is part of the Ryvius, and she gets hurt whenever the Vital Guarder is hurt. She potects the Ryvius with a barrier, sort of.

Infinite Ryvius is a Science Fiction anime that takes place in the year 2225. It's been decades since the Solar System was dramatically changed by the arrival of the Geduld. The Geduld is a cosmic anomaly that originated from the sun, resulting in a deadly sea of plasma that spread out through the Solar System. While this resulted in much detestation for the Earth, it also sped up the process of humanity's exploration into space.
Soon enough the entire Solar System was colonized by humanity, although the Geduld still made Space travel much more dangerous. The story focuses on a group of teenagers preparing to train and study at the Liebe Delta. Koji Aiba is one of the many students leaving for the prestigious school. However, disaster strikes when the station plummets into a sea of Geduld. Things get even worse when all of the adults mysteriously wind up murdered.
Now, only the teenage population remains, struggling to survive with the little experience that they have. They all take refuge within a gigantic and mysterious ship known as the Ryvius. Waiting to be rescued, the survivors become hunted by many of Earth's governments. However, as the battle for survival goes on and tensions mount day by day, the biggest threat to the Ryvius' survival may be within themselves....

InuYasha is about a half-demon called 
, and a girl with a secret named 
. Oh, and many other demons that are trying to get

 has been implanted with the Jewel of Four Souls [Shikon no Tama] from her previous incarnation, 
. And if that wasn't enough, she has also finds herself beening sucked into a magic well, only to land way back in the time of her ancestors.
Shortly afterwards, 
, a giant centipede-like demon, attacks, and she reluctantly releases 
 to help defeat it. Unfortunately, after the demon is taken care of, 
 goes after 
 for the jewel.

Fifteen-year-old schoolgirl Kagome Higurashi, whose family tends a shrine, falls into an old well one day and literally tumbles into ancient Japanese history. On the other side she meets 
, the half demon who claims she smells just like the woman who fifty years ago pinned him with her arrow to a tree, where he's been all this time.
Unwilling allies at first, the two become closer as their search for the sacred "Jewel of Four Souls" continues.

description:
It all started a few hundred years ago and involved two very different groups.
First is the Shikima, a race of well-endowed demons in the middle of a power struggle over how to approach these "delicious" human ladies. Some of them wanna take the Earth by force. Others just wanna have a good time without having to go about it so rough.
Then there's the Mirokshu, a clan of kunoichi (female ninjas) who have turned the art of sex into a weapon against their opponents.
An affair between the king of the Shikima and one of the Mido clan has resulted in a mutual alliance...and a most unusual girl: the blue-blooded Miko.
 is the story of Miko and family, and their erotic adventures on Earth and the Shikima dimension as they protect the Shikima from internal strife, enemy clans, and supernatural forces.

description:
Volume IV of this saga takes place in days of old, where lords rule their kingdoms, knights defend it, and little thought is given to classifying women as witches and burning them at the stake. Maya, as always, is a gorgeous young woman with lovely assets just trying to make her way in the world... except now, she is a knight. She hides her womanhood, making everyone believe that she is just a feminine male. The only one who knows the truth is Count Calvin, who took her as an infant and hid her true past for fear of her life should anyone find out. Thus, she now goes by the name Mayatola Calvin, and is the commanding officer of the First Imperial guard.
The women all adore her, thinking that she is a man, but the evil Count Pickingel despises her. Why do I say "evil"? Well pretty much the first thing we see in this anime is Count Pickingel leading his men into a town where burns all the buildings, accuses all the women of being witches, and has his men rape them all. He stands at the center, surrounded by his men who are violating all the women right out in the open. Oh, but he's not content to just watch it happen; oh no, he joins in on the action too. Had it not been for Mayatola Calvin showing up, we can only imagine how this ugly scene would have played out to the end.

Of course, Count Pickingel still has women chained up in his dungeon, so he's always able to relieve his desire for torture and sex when the need arises. But he's not the only sicko. By his side is a red-haired woman named Isabel, who gets off on the abuse as much as he does; feeling herself up while Pickingel has his way with a completely nude woman bound and chained in midair, haning upside down. And all the dungeon keepers seems to enjoy it as well. All the women there are thought to be witches, but I seriously doubt it matters one way or the other to these people.
Anyway, Pickingel has a ninja-like dude shadow Maya to uncover what he can about her, so that he can destroy her. This is when we learn Maya has a servant girl named Anne, and even she doesn't know Maya is a woman. But unfortunately her secret is soon to be revealed! How it all plays out from here I will not say, but rest assured, just like in previous volumes, men will become powerless to resist desire for Maya, the Erotic Tempress!

description:
A man and a woman make beautiful love on the floor of what looks to be a room typical classic Japanese house. They are enjoying themselves immensely until that final climatic moment arrives... and then for no apparent reason the dude seems to croak. Kinda odd, but then we hear the woman call a familiar name... Maya. A young lady responds, stepping out from where she was hiding, and although very beautiful, she has not the pink hair of the erotic temptress that we have come to know and love. This Maya has long, brown hair, and a very colorful tatoo filling her entire back. At any rate, the two hotties have a little session of their own, and such begins the third volume of the Imma Youjo series.
The scene shifts elsewhere, to some blue-haired guy walking down a road littered with the skeletal remains of dead soldiers. His name is Jyurota, a vassal of Nobutsuna Mochizuki, and he soon crosses paths with Shinbei, a foot soldier of Katsuyori Abe. Apparently that makes them enemies, though neither one seems to care much about that. Rather, Jyurota offers the starving Shinbei his rice ball, which sort of makes them friends, so Shinbei begins tagging along on Jyurota's journey as a guide.

Along their way they encounter and old woman who warns that they should not cross the mountains as there is a demon who seemingly spirits away all men who enter. Of course, that's not going to stop these guys, so they push on. But when they hear a cry for help from Maya who's being attacked by three thugs, their quest is instantly put on hold. The two smaller bandits where no sweat for Jyurota, but the third one was a giant, and was wearing a completely naked Maya like a human shield. This presents a problem, though no problem is unsolvable for these two.

After rescuing Maya, she invites them to come to the palace to meet her master, the princess. And of course the princess turns out to be that woman we met in the first scene. Her name is Akina, and she is the daughter of a noble and his mistress, so for political reasons she was sent to live in this palace located deep in the forest. At any rate, she invites the pair to spend the night, to show her appreciation for them saving her servant. Two guys all alone in a palace with two gorgeous babes? Who in their right mind would turn that down!
Well, both guys get what they were hoping for, but they also end up getting way more than they wanted. The story continues, but I don't want to give away the secret, even though you would have already probably figured it out by now. Apparently, this volume of the series doesn't have any connection to the first two, but on the plus side the story is the easiest one to follow so far.

description:
A city burns in flames while a white-haired man runs for his life, fleeing from men determined to use his as target practice. As he escapes, his mind drifts back to him and his girl, and then to a group of guys taking his girl for their pleasure while holding him back and forcing him to watch. But theirs is not the only horror. Another young man tries frantically to escape an attack helicoper with his pretty young pink-haired girlfriend, but it is not to happen. After being brutally gunned down by the chopper, the girl is left standing all alone, right in its sights. But instead of firing, the copter simply explodes in mid air. This is the opening to Immage Youjo.
Definitely not your standard hentai opening scenes. But then this doesn't seem to be your average hentai series. Taking place sometime in the future, in what feels like a Mad Max type world, our young pink haired girl, named Maya, somehow makes her way through the blistering desert until she finally comes across a city. Well, it isn't long before she's confronted by a gang of five punks, and we all know what they want. Unfortunately, they get it.

Afterwards, she awakes to find herself nude, blindfolded, and bound to a chair. Five men surround her, though they are different than the others. These guys are all dark gray, and all have the same lean muscular body type. They're all bald, and apparently chained to the chair that Maya is bound to. But still, they want exactly what you'd think they want, and they don't hesitate in going after Maya. But then, right in the middle of it all, Maya begins to glow, and before you know it all of the guys disappear in what looks to be scraps of gray paper, which all come together to form some kind of huge, muscular monster with five "tentacles" located you-know-where. And I'm sure you can guess what it does.

Fortunately, Maya soon wakes to realize it was just a nightmare. As if laying in a bed, not knowing how she got there, isn't confusing enough, then some dude starts pushing a little cart towards her bed while introducing himself as Halda. He looks striking similar to the white-haired guy we saw at the beginning. At any rate, he informs her that he will be taking care of her, and that she has been sold as a prostitute to this place, the city's giant tower which is a house of pleasure. And apparently, she was sold for more money than any other prostitute had ever been sold for in the tower. Bet she feels proud! I don't know if she resisted at first or what, but after a quick montage of still frames, she seems to have embraced the lifestyle.

Then, one day, a client enters her room... and he knows her name. It's Chaos, the white-haired dude from the beginning! Hah! I tricked you! I made you think her servant guy was that dude, but nope! But to be fair, they do look alike. Well, he has a grudge against her for some reason. Of course, that doesn't stop him from having his fun. While he does, he tells her about how there are no young women in the city, and that nobody seems to care. On top of that, apparently nobody has ever seen the master of the tower. The tower holds a secret, he feels.

Ah, but Maya soon will, for once each month every woman in the tower has the honor and privilege of being pleasured by Lord Bazus. Inside his chamber there are women everywhere, being pleasured by each other and what looks to be mechanical tentacles. Shocking? Most definitely, but not more than Bazus himself, who looks strikingly similar to the monster in her nightmare. I'll stop here, but trust me things get even stranger. It seems she has some kind of almost magic-like essence about her that makes men go absolutely wild, and unfortunately this is never explained, which kinda just leaves you wondering in the end.

description:
While Imma Youjo Volume I may have felt like it could have taken place in the future, Volume II most definitely is set in the future. It's the flying cars and androids that give it away. So Mr. Ichiro is some kind of robotics wizard, as he makes android women who are not just anatomically correct, but also have voices and personalities. And apparently he's now working on creating the perfect woman! Mu-ha-ha-ha-ha-haaaa!
Meanwhile, we meet some creepy looking dude with an evil mustache who runs some joint which caters to men's fantasies, if you know what I mean... and we're talking about a hentai here so I'm sure you do. And of course, all the girls are androids, so they can be programmed to do whatever the guy wants. And the guys get to where this stupid looking helmet which makes them feel the pleasure that the android is feeling. A lovely invention by Mr. Ichiro.

And speaking of Mr. Ichiro, back over at his place it seems he's finally finished his masterpiece! But instead of activating it, he leaves it in some man-sized chamber filled with a clear liquid, while he naps on his desk. But that doesn't stop his android! She awakes anyway and steps out of the chamber, revealing a beautiful and totally nude pink-haired girl. It's Maya! So that means this must be a prequel to the first volume.

Anyways, it's happy days for Mr. Ichiro! Now he has a hot young lady to run around and frolic with, and that's exactly what he does. This being a hentai you'd kind of expect him to go straight for the sex first, but nope, this guy is a real gentleman with his Maya. Oh, but don't worry, the sex does come eventually. You knew it would, he just had to actually make sure she fell in love with him first. Yeah, apparently this android can do that! And they even have a fake wedding!
Ah, but of course there's gotta be trouble brewing, though I think this is a good place to begin concluding this profile. You wouldn't want me to give everything away, would ya?

Innocent Venus is a dystopian Sci-Fi tale that takes place after series of massive ecological disasters ravaged the planet. In the year 2010, a series of Hyper Hurricanes devestated the Earth and wiped out 5 Billion people. In the process, the entire shape of the Earth was changed. Governments, economies and militaries were wiped out, and human civilization enters into an age of chaos. Poverty runs rampant among the people while the sole remaining power known as Logos reigns supreme through absolute force.
Jo Katsuragi and Jin Tsurasawa are two people on the run from the military force known as Phantom. They are also assigned to protect a mysterious young girl named Noto Sana, who is hunted for reasons unknown....

description:
After many long battles, 
 and Co. have finally defeated the insidious and elusive 
. It seems like peace has finally been achieved, and the group decide to go their different ways. 
, 
, and 
 continue to search missing Shards of the Sacred Jewel. 
 is reunited with her lost brother 
, and 
 returns to his home.
However, trouble once again rears its ugly head when 
 and 
 discover a mirror containing a being named 
, who is the ruler of Eternal Night. Soon enough, 
 is freed from her prison, free to terrorize the world and blanket it in the darkness of Eternal Night.
 and the gang once again reunite to fight against this powerful new enemy.

creator: Rumiko Takahashi
title: Inu Yasha: Kagami no Naka no Mugenjo

description: In this second part of the Ikki Tousen trilogy, it is Unchou Kanu, who was only a secondary character in the first series, that is the central character. In this series, she now acts as a protector to a young girl at her school. This girl, Gentoku Ryuubi, isn't a fighter and prefers schoolwork, and just happens to possess a potentially-harmful power within her – one that could rival the power within Hakufu Sonsaku!

The students of seven schools are battling each other over reasons that are years old. Many of them are trained in all forms of armed and unarmed combat. But even more unusual, many of them are guided by spirits of warriors long past.
, an airheaded, young student newly transferred to Japan, is one of these students. She is guided by the spirit of the warrior Shou Haou, who had united seven nations centuries before. However, she has an uphill battle against many of the others as she tries to unite the schools, as well as overcoming a darker side of Shou Haou's power.

Ikkitousen is an obscure and fan-servicy anime based on Three Kingdoms Era of China. The story is simple-- the main character, 
, is the reincarnation of a famous Three Kingdoms warrior (Sun Ce). She and her lovely mother, 
, move in with her cousin, 
, and she runs into school with fists clenched and skirt a-flying, beating up many of the boys for fun.
This leads to many twists and turns in 
's daily life, as she learns that her sacred bead, given to her by her mother, contains the soul of the legendary Sun Ce. She continues to fight, becoming stronger and stronger...

When his father marries a second time, Akira is granted three younger stepsisters and a pretty young stepmother. On the return of their honeymoon, only stepmother Yukie returns, where Akira's father remains on the location for archaeology purposes. Not much later, Akira solves one of his father's lost projects, which gets him in a very wrong situation.
He gets into a contract with the Divine Goddess Inana: He must obtain 3 full bottles of "life" juice, one for each of his stepsisters. Were he to succeed before the new full moon and without anyone seeing the bottles, he can make a wish; were he to fail, terror will fall upon him, which seems worse than death...
This Hentai/Lolicon series is in my opinion special in its kind, because it has both a proper story and nice hentai scenes, even if it's only one hour. Everything is censored, as it was never licensed and released beyond Japan. Very good and unique series, which is a must see for hentai/lolicon fans.

title: Now and Then, Here and There

description:
. Seems like your typical, optimistic male middle school student. He's a member of the kendo club, though his kendo skills leave a lot to be desired. And that's a bit of a problem, because a girl he has a crush on is more interested in the guy who wins. But what 
 lakes in talent he makes up for in determination. And that's what makes 
 different from any other kid his age... cause his determination stronger than freakin' adamantium. But lets not jump ahead, as we'll be getting to that later.
So on his way home after kendo practice, 
 decides to detour over to an old hangout that he and his friends used to play around at. Three huge smokestacks is what stands out among the area, which 
 and his friends would climb to prove how brave they were. Only 
 made it to the top every time. This time, however, he spies a blue haired girl about his age already sitting atop one of the smokestacks. Funny thing is, the ladder on that smokestack appears to be busted. So he climbs up an adjacent tower and attempts to make conversation with the extremely quiet girl, who seems only to want to sit and enjoy the beautiful sunset. At least 
 was able to coax her name, Lala Ru, out of her.

Then out of nowhere appears a bunch of piloted mech robots that seemed bound and determined to capture this sweet young girl. Lala Ru doesn't put up much resistance, but she does mouth something to 
... just a simple, non-emotional request for help. But that's all it took to get 
 to spring into action, risking his life high atop the smokestacks to stop these people from and their mechs from abduction Lala Ru. This is really where we start to catch a glimpse of 
's unmatched determination. Out-numbered? Doesn't matter. Out-gunned? Doesn't matter. He ever persists after the towers begin to crumble! Unfortunately, the poor lad fails, and one of the mech suits tosses 
 up into the air. The next thing you know a big energy bubble surrounds them all and poof, their gone.

Everything caught inside that energy sphere re-materializes inside a giant chamber, and I mean everything, including rubble from the collapsing towers. Without skipping a beat, 
 finds Lala Ru and takes off! The leader of the team attempting to capture Lala Ru, a woman named Abelia, orders the heavy metal doors to be shut, but 
 and Lala Ru slip though just in time, giving them even more of a head start. They don't get far, however, before they finds themselves in the middle of a drawbridge that is being raised. They are on opposite sides, so 
 reaches out, but Lala Ru won't jump. And so the young boy with a heart of gold makes the decision to leap across the ever expanding gap back to where Lala Ru is. Flying through the air, he reaches out as far as his arms will allow, yet all he is able to grab is Lala Ru's pendant before he starts plummeting to the depths below.

This scene is very reminiscent of another scene in a PlayStation 2 game called Ico. And the next scene is reminiscent of that one in Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back where Luke is falling after being beaten by Vader and ends up sliding through giant tubes which slow his decent. Somehow, in real life I just don't think it would happen like that. But this is anime, so its all good. So now Lala Ru is back in the hands of her would-be abductors, and 
 is alone, running for his life aboard what seems to be some kind of giant complex. We soon learn that the team was after not just Lala Ru, but her pendant as well. Apparently, whatever King Hamdo's plan is, both are needed to implement it.

King Hamdo is the man in charge of everything and everyone in the massive compound. Oh, and did I mention that he's completely insane? He believes that he is the one destined to "fix" the world. He feels that no man is more important than the Earth, and that there will be no Earth without him, and therefor he is more important that the Earth and everybody and everything on it. Not really the kind of person you want for your leader... yet his army is completely loyal to him, especially Abelia, his right-hand woman. She follows his every order, no matter how insane it may be. This is extremely frustrating to watch, considering how intelligent and grounded she otherwise seems. There are so many times when you just want to show "just kill him and end this madness!", but of course if she actually did that then we wouldn't have the stupendous anime series to watch.

This is by far one of the absolute best anime series I've ever seen... ever. I blasted through all 13 episodes in one sitting, 'cause I just had to see what happened next. And what's great is that each episode had meaning behind it; there were no throw away episodes. The art style, although nothing ground breaking, was still quite good and definitely powerful enough to allow the dredging up of emotions throughout the grim tale. Of course, the voice actors help with that as well, especially the voice for King Hamdo. Both the Japanese and English voice actors were able to stunningly capture this madman. I should definitely mention here that this anime is definitely not for children, as there is a lot of violence and deals with several really tough subjects. I don't think it's rated by the 
, but if it was I'm sure it would have gotten an R rating.
The portion of the saga that I described above takes place in the first couple of episodes, and there is really a lot more here than just the standard boy-with-girl-and-her-pendant story. There is a lot of emotion is this series, due in part to some of the hard issues explored within, such as slavery, rape, and child abuse. Yet all of this seems to flow naturally from this world we become a part of, and never feels like it was inserted just to be preachy. Of course, there are a lot of positive moments too, which I wouldn't want to overlook. Only someone with a heart of stone could sit through this and not feel anything. If you love anime, and are over 17 years old, then you should absolutely get this anime saga, 
.

A raging battle taking place between two warriors in space nears its end. The heroic Iczer 1 fights with all her might to stop the devilish Neos Gold from spreading her evil. Iczer 1 accomplishes her task, but not before an entire planet gets blown apart by Neos Gold, and also not before using up the last of her energy. Still, Neos Gold is halted, though not destroyed. Neither combatant has the strength to continue. Each must recover before this war will eventually be decided, yet the malicious Neos Gold has already selected the battlefield for their next conflict... Earth! In preparation for the showdown, the evil one sends her four female generals, Fiber, Golem, Insecto, and Bigro, to devastate its surface. Seems like the fun will never end!
Nagisa and Shizuka are both part-timers at a military moon base when the invasion begins, and both girls seem to be about high school age. Nagisa awakes from a nightmare, knowing that something is wrong. They quickly learn from Yajin, another part-timer at the base, that they've lost contact with one of their ships out in space. Soon, the terror reaches Earth, and one by one they witness the other bases being taken out. Its not long before the rampage infests their location as well, but with the hanger destroyed, escape seems impossible. The two young ladies cower in a corner, unsure of their next move.

Then Yajin arrives with hope for survival! He leads them to the construction bay housing a nearly completed space ship, the Queen Fuji. There they meet up with two other base personal, who are ready to get the heck out of there! Unfortunately, before they even get a chance to climb aboard their last remaining hope for escape and blast off, Nagisa finds herself being grabbed and hung upside-down by what appears to be a claw floating in mid-air. A horde of minions de-cloak to reveal that the sole survivors of the base are completely surrounded by giant metallic warrior beasts. Truly, all hope seems to be lost, but just as one of the beasts is about to strike with its razor sharp claws, it gets blown back by some unexpected force. It's 
, and she's ready to play!
 is Iczer 1's little sister. Like Iczer 1, she was created by Sister Grey. Though 
 had not yet fully matured, the unfortunate circumstances left Sister Grey little choice but to send the young super-being to Earth. She arrived to late to stop all the destruction, but once she appeared in the construction bay, 
 had no problem teaching those mechanical monsters who the boss was. Fiber was shocked to see another being with powers that matched Iczer 1's, but that didn't stop her from trying to take the lass out. Too bad for her that it didn't go so well, 'cause Neos Gold doesn't take kindly to failure. Fiber may have been defeated by 
, but her destruction came from the wicked one.

Once settled in, the troop heads out in their new ship to scour the Earth for survivors. Their first search mission outside the ship takes them into a swarm of odd-looking insects, similar to those that were seen destroying some of the other bases. The only one who didn't fear these creatures was 
, who ran around outside playing with them as they unsuccessfully tried to eat her. Unfortunately, the search party struck out on finding anything living other than the bugs, so they returned to the saftey of the ship... or so they thought. Once the little buggers make their way inside the ship, 
 takes off to battle Insecto, the woman controlling the pests. Being the self-proclaimed greatest warrior of the four generals, Insecto puts up a valiant fight, though it still doesn't last too much longer than Fiber did... at least, not in her first form.

Her second form is giant, like Godzilla size, so 
 goes and grabs Nagisa, claiming that she needs Nagisa's help for this. Pretty much everyone is puzzled at this point, but then 
 creates a giant robot out of thin air, and merges herself and Nagisa to it. And of course, for some reason Nagisa has to be naked and floating in some kind of liquid in order to help control this Iczer-Robo. Don't worry though, all her naughty bits are conveniently covered up. As soon as Iczer-Robo finishes off the enormous Insecto, a new battle immediately begins , this time against a holographic Neos Gold. Iczer-Robo expends all it's energy trying to conquer this hologram, allowing it to steal Iczer-Robo's Iczerian power. And don't ask me how a hologram could steal anything, 'cause I didn't understand that either.
The strain of controlling Iczer-Robo put Nagisa, unconscious, in the medical bay, while Yajin throws 
 in the brig for what she did to Nagisa. All the while, Neos Gold is using her stolen Iczerian power to create Atlas, an 
 of her own! What's going to happen with 
 goes up a foe who equates to her twin sister? Will the crew of the Queen Fuji be able to track down anyone who survived the vicious attack on their planet, or are they the lone survivors? Will Iczer 1 heal in time to resist the evil Neos Gold, or will 
 have to go it alone? All six OVA episodes are being re-released, this time on one DVD, and for only $9.95, so there's no reason to get left out of the loop. Find out what happens!

Yui is a cute and innocent maid android, and she had just been purchased by Takaya Murase. This might be a good thing, an android maid doing the cleaning, dishes and cooking, but there is one... slight problem. It seems that Takaya has this... cosplaying maid fetish, and is forcing the poor girl to dress at least five times a day just to satisfy his whims! What is she to do?

In the not to distant year of 2023, a new sport was created known as the Immortal Grand Prix (IGPX) which mixed racing, martial arts, and technology and engineering. The sport soon became famous worldwide. IGPX involved the use of giant (and extremely fast) humanoid robots called "IG Machines" and pitted two teams of three IG's against each other on a race track. The objective is simple, get to the finish line by any means necessary while fighting the opposing team along the way.
IGPX takes place much later, in 2049. The sport has become a worldwide phenomenon and an entire city was built to accommodate the league. The story focuses on Team Satomi, which is lead by 
. Satomi recently won the IG-2 championship, advancing them into the IG-1 league. However Team Satoshi tends to be rather disorganized as a team, but an encounter with the leader of Team Velstein inspires 
 to get his act together. Many challenges lie ahead for Team Satomi, and opposition creates some difficult odds. Will 
 and his team come out on top?

Hibiki Amawa is a young man who recently graduated from college. He dreams of being a teacher and helping his students to succeed. Currently without a job, his landlord encourages him to apply for one at a nearby private school so that Hibiki can pay his rent. However, the school is run by a man-hating principal and she refuses to hire Hibiki-san based on his gender. But he does not give up. Hibiki enlists the help of his landlord and crossdresses in order to land the job. Hibiki-sensei now struggles with being a good teacher and keeping his true identity a secret from his students and the suspicious vice principal.

On a beautiful morning, 
 was on his way to school, but he lost control of his bike. As he fell, he found some clothing. Then he fell off a small cliff and stumbles on a naked girl. Now everyone is calling 
 her husband!
Now with a girl on his back, more things start to happen. Wrestlers, aliens, robots start attacking to kidnap 
. But 
 and 
's family saves her from Dispel's plans.
Later at the beginning of the first season, 
 says she wants to become an angel. But how? She uses an angel-training suit, metal wings, etc., but none work. So not only does 
 have an annoying girl that loves him, he also has a girl that wants to become an angel. Can things get weirder?

A young girl named Haruka Amami is a shy and unconfident young girl who loves to sing tries out for an audition to be a singing idol and passes and sent to Tokyo to start her career. Little did she know the agency that was in charge of the whole thing actually wants her and several other girls to pilot giant robots called IDOLS to stop meteors from hitting the earth.
