title: Sumeba Miyako no Cosmos-sou Suttoko Taisen Dokkoid

description:
Mystic Kato has an obsession with conquering Tokyo, which awakens the fierce guardian of the city, Masakato. Kato devises an evil plan in which he uses an ordinary person as a tool to produce a spawn capable of taking on Masakato, but things go horribly wrong and chaotic when vigilantes step in and more spells are cast.
Note: This is a relatively violent, gorey anime and not recommended for kids.

Being sick of all the people who want to hunt him down, Earl Dracula and his daughter Chocolat settle in a new home in Japan.
But there is still one man on the vampire's trail, and that is Professor Lip Van Helsing!
If you can provide a more detailed description, please 
!

The story is rather odd (to say the least). You see, the future is plagued by an uncontrollable population problem. However the masterminds of the future decide to find the source of the population problem, and change it. The source is found to be a guy by the name of 
. You see, 
, in the past, becomes (what the show calls him) a mega-playboy. He is said to have 100 kids with 100 different women. Then those 100 kids have a 100 kids of their own, and so on. Of course if this continues several generations, you have a horrible population problem. So the people of the future decide to go back in time and change the DNA of this guy. It was supposed to be quite simple- a DNA operator goes back in time and shoots 
 with a DCM bullet that will alter and change his DNA, then the operator returns to the less populated future. However those masterminds that devised this great plan, made one mistake... putting Karin Aoi in charge of the operation.
So Karin goes back in time and makes one very serious mistake... she brings the wrong DCM bullet (hey we all do it at one time or another). So when she finally confronts 
 she shoots him with a bullet that increases the possibility of him becoming the "Mega-Playboy". OH NO!!! This is horrible... 
 will most likely cause the horrible population increase. And even worse, because of the bullet 
's DNA is super unstable which causes him to change between the super mega playboy, and his regular boring self at anytime. He briefly changes once, resulting in Saeki (a main character) to fall in love with him. Every girl in the world is attracted to 
 when he turns into the mega playboy. Every girl but Ami, 
's "friend" since childhood. Oh boy... confused yet??? Well me too...
Karin, seeing her mission failing in front of her eyes, comes up with a plan (one that might allow her to still get that "sweet sweet home, and great husband"). The plan is to get Ami and 
 together. Since Ami isn't turned on by 
 when he is the mega playboy, 
 will never have the impulse to change. The plan seems great, but 
 is not in love with Ami (well if you think about you might say he is); he is more in love with Karin. Karin's plan is harder and harder to achieve. Finally Karin receives the correct DCM bullet from the future! Karin will now be able to get the mission over with. Well, of course it doesn't turn out to be that easy (sounding kinda familiar doesn't it)... The reason: SHE SHOOTS THE WRONG PERSON!!! She actually shoots Ryuji (in fact he's a big jerk). Well this causes a problem (yep, you guessed it), for now Ryuji turns into this big dictator type of person!
Now 
, Karin and Ami have to team up and exterminate Ryuji. It's a fierce little competition, but of course the good guys come through. Now that the Ryuji incident is over, they all have to decide on what's gonna happen. That's when outta the blue, a new time machine comes from the future. The people, demonic as they are, try to destroy the small progress that Karin has made in attempts to stop 
 from becoming the mega-playboy. In the end, the good-guys prevail, and the masterminds of the future come and save the day by curing 
 of the mega-playboy gene (or whatever it is).

The whole thing started in the middle of December. 
, out of sheer whim, declares that the SOS Brigade was going to celebrate Christmas at their school clubroom. As far as 
 was concerned, this was possibly the tamest of 
's whims. But it was a couple of days afterward that 
 discovers that 
 didn't show-up at school – and everyone claims that they never knew her! Even more amazing was that Koizume was not there, 
 was the sole member of the literature club – and even 
, who 
 had deleted, was in school! Somehow, 
 has to figure-out why 
 – and the SOS Brigade, for that matter – had ceased to exist!

The story starts off with Mihai who is a hit-man who just came back to town not long after he starts to have memories about his old student Ian. Then after a little time passes he runs into Ian at the grave of a women named Milena Teslawska who was killed by Ian. Soon after Ian shows up at the grave he is shot dead by an assassin. Before he dies he tells Mihai that the reason he killed Milena Teslawska is because he was jealous. Then Mihai is killed... or so it seems.
After that the story moves on to Badou, a clumsy chain-smoking eye patched assassin/photographer who becomes deranged when denied cigarettes. Next is Naoto Fuyumine, a orphaned child and who was trained to wield the amnesia sword. The last person is Haine who was genetically experimented on as a child, which led to him possessing dog-like attributes. He is partners with Badou. Their pasts are somehow connected to the secret underground and the organization that controls it.

In the wake of a biological war that has left a deadly cloud of bacteria hovering over the entire Northern Hemisphere, Newport City has a major crime problem. Spearheading the crime in the city is the gang led by the notorious Buaku and the mutant cat twins, 
 and 
. Criminals for hire, they'll commit almost any sort of crime for a buck. The crime has become so troublesome that the Newport City Council set up a special Tank Police division to combat this plague of crime. The problem is, the Tank Police cause so much damage the question now becomes: just who are the bad guys?
Enter the Tank Police's first female officer: 
. She joins the ranks of Mohican, the Chaplain, 
 (the commander), and 
, the only other relative newcomer. And the Tank Police (including 
) soon get their hands full as Buaku's gang makes another strike, and this time, they're playing for keeps! Nothing's gonna get in their way ...except maybe for 
 and Bonaparte, the little tank that could. It's firepower, shenanigans, some scantily-clad beauties, and lots of mayhem, so when you hear those tanks, run for cover!

From rescuing a warden during a prison uprising, to chasing a rogue battle robot during a city-wide Halloween celebration, to saving one of their own from gambling, there is nothing that 
 and 
, anime's original "Lovely Angels" won't do to keep the universe safe and clean. Let's just hope that the insurance companies take their tranquilizers while settling the damage claims after they're done.
Note: the costume that 
 wears in these TV episodes is a silver-tone one, and not the gold-tone one that comes later.

does not always go looking for trouble, but sometimes trouble goes out of its way to find 
. The unfortunate thing is, civilians always seem to have to do the cost counting. 
 is taking a return flight back to Garabonia when an unidentified fight craft starts to shadow the airliner. It is soon apparent that trouble is abundant when the airliner is forced out of the sky by some heavy firepower. As the plane plunges to the ground over the Jural Mountains, amidst the confusion 
 spies a young mother trying to protect her baby. Through her usual "unknown" luck, 
 survives the crash. The baby's mother is not so fortunate and begs 
 to protect her baby. 
 reluctantly agrees and takes the infant clear of the plane, just in time.
, not one to quit in any circumstances, takes the young infant and sets out across the snow covered mountains. However, they do not remain alone for long, as a feeding time is interrupted by the crack of gunfire. It seems whoever brought the plane down, intended this child to go down with it. 
 makes a skilful escape, using her most precious blaster to even up the odds.
For a while 
 looses her pursuers and comes across a log cabin, which offers the freezing pair some protection. Peace is soon shattered once again as 
 sees a pursuit chopper off loading. Although the troops fall to 
's naturally destructive charms, 
 has to duck to avoid the missiles. Regardless of a good fight, even 
 can't win all fights single handed.
In a rare moment of their early career, 
 expresses real joy to see 
 as she comes to the rescue (late as always). With the terrorists finally dispatched, 
 who has actually been paying attention, informs 
 of the infants current circumstances. 
 reacts in an unexpected manner (well, 
 was surprised!). Although I'm not sure the young infant is going to be overly fond of his new name!

For many generations, the De Noir family has upheld the family traditions and carried on the family business with pride. Now it is the turn of the current generation to step into her parents shoes, now that she has come of age. Therefore, 
 has decided that this will be best accomplished with the "help" of the two new 3WA officers, still making their own name. 
 and 
 are currently enjoying something they won't often receive as they get (a little) older- a holiday.


 is sun bathing on board a beautiful yatch, with a number of birds flying above. Unfortunately these are not normal birds, and they start to attack our lovely Angel while she relaxes. This does not sit well with 
, who dispatches the explosive birds. At the same time, 
 is fishing and reels in something rather sharp.
Later, 
 is relaxing by the pool and 
 is about to take a swim. As 
 commences her dive from the board, 
 notices something very strange about the water. Reacting with lightning-fast reflexes, 
 catches 
 by the Bikini. 
 is not amused by this until 
 demonstrates a very good reason not to go swimming.
 and 
 are now quite unhappy about the interruptions in their holiday (although this will become something they will have to get used to). 
 takes them both out for a spin. Whilst up on a mountain road, the ladies stop for a short break, when a young girl stops to talk to 
, giving her a pretty broach. The girl the gets on her monocycle and speeds off. Strange, huh?. Suddenly a lot more explosive sea gulls start to dive bomb 
, until 
 figures out what is happening. This little girl has always been around when trouble is about. 
, followed by 
, jumps into the car and floors it. They catch up the abandoned bike at a castle on top of the ridge road. Of course they go in.


 welcomes 
 and 
 to their "farewell" party, to which 
 and 
 laugh, that is until 
 mistakenly insults not just 
, but also 
 (this is not wise!). As 
 and 
 skilfully evade the various attacks on them, they reduce 
's arsenal down to her Tedybear, Mack, and Papa Mack. Even this doesn't stand up to a close assault. (If you are actually stupid enough to insult our lovely 
, don't do it when she still has her powersword!)
Another case of wrong doing is finally raped up, as 
 administers appropriate punishment on 
. Shame that the fairy tale castle didn't fair very well. It will also be a long time before the Pink Sniper decides to cross paths with 
 and 
, they're just too dangerous.

It would not normally be considered that either 
 or 
 were particularly sporty. Yes, 
 constantly practices her combat skills, while 
 stays in shape for much more feminine reasons, but volley ball championships?
 and 
 have been selected for a special mission. A way has been found for the 3WA to arrest the president of a powerful corporation known as the "Northern Concern", wanted on a string of charges. 
 and 
 will, however, have to undergo several weeks of intensive training, far above the current skills. Our girls are therefore transferred to the corps special training facility, where they are assigned to 
, the hardest of all the corps instructors.
For the next few weeks 
 and 
 are pushed beyond their known limits, so far in fact that they become walking zombies. Eventually 
 cracks and is unable to take it any more, after all this training has wrecked her and she hasn't been able to wash her hair properly (not good for such a long and beautiful Maine). 
 breaks down into tears and threatens to quit. 
, now getting very used to 
 through all their missions to date, supports 
 and the two leave. However, the instructor has an ace up his sleeve and persuades them to make it through. Soon 
 and 
 are molded into a team, tighter than anything before them and able to withstand ten times the punishment of before. Finally, the Lovely Angels pass the last test with flying colours. They are now ready for their mission.
As the ball goes up, it is launched with the force of a bazooka. The Galactic Volleyball Championships are under way. The competition is very good, but not good enough as the barrage onslaught from 
 and 
 continues. Soon the ball goes down for the last point. The unknown outsiders are the new Galactic Champions (wow). To present them with their trophy, the president appears. At this point our girls spring into official action and arrest the president, with a "small" amount of backup.
Back at headquarters, 
 is very pleased with their action, but lets slip a piece of information the girls were mislead on. Now the corps special instructors will learn a lesson- Don't lie to the Dirty Pair!

This is not actually from 
 and 
's official case files, but was a small mission 
 "volunteered" to embark on to Help 
 out of a small jam that she had got herself into. Without giving the story away, there's not a lot to this story.
 has to volunteer to baby sit Julian (the grandson of a weathly business man named Mr. Winston), who believes 
 to be the perfect woman (easy to do!-biased!-sorry). Anyway, 
 has to spend the next week with Julian in rather unusual conditions, with almost ridiculous constraints. Fortunately, 
 feels she is in 
's debt and 
 ensures that 
 is going to repay her. Points to note, while 
 goes through many attractive outfits, do you recognise one particular outfit? Also, 
 makes a very cute pizza delivery girl, just don't short change her.
Eventually 
 decides that she must straighten Julian's thinking about women, and explain to him what real women are all about. This revelation has unexpected results. As with any Lovely Angel/Dirty Pair mission, it will never turn out as expected due to that "luck streak" of theirs. Poor 
! Well, Julian comes out happy, although 
 doesn't quite get what she wanted, she's still got 
 after all.

The Galactic is a very rough place in parts, hence the need for an unusual, perhaps unauthordox police officer. Of course, not even the Lovely Angels get away unscathed all the time. Currently off active duty, our ladies have a few apologies to hand write- ouch!
A little way across the galaxy, a meeting is taking place between the legendary "Mad Dog" Kamen and an escaped prisoner, Beringer. It would seem that Kamen has acquired a special weapon but needs Beringer's help to utilise it. Beringer agrees on one condition. He wants a 100 hours with the weapon to settle an old debt with the 3WA and a man named 
. Time to cut back to 3WA district headquarters, where 
 and 
 still haven't finished the apologies. While down in the basement, a surprise is entering the building, pretty risky huh?
Unfortunately, the building defences seem to be designed to stop terrorists and humanoid invaders, not super heavy combat tanks! As Beringer cuts through the headquarters, 
 becomes isolated, while 
 and 
 naturally stop off at the armory. 
 and 
 catch up with 
 as most of the building's staff are evacuated to safety. Things are not going well for the home team as it transpires that they just haven't got enough serious firepower, (me thinks 
 will procure some better "supplies" after this event), however 
 has what is considered a real "think on your feet" moment. The worst news is that Beringer has captured little Rosa and is quite happy to use her to get to 
. As 
 heads towards the roof after Beringer and Rosa, with 
 in pursuit, 
 heads down to the basement to find the only thing she can think of that has enough power to punch through Beringer's super armour. As with anything 
 does, the word overkill jump into mind.
Up on the roof things are now getting rather taught, as Beringer plays with 
, wanting to savor the moment. However, his time is up and Kamen wants his toy back. Beringer must now get rid of 
, discarding little Rosa, he trains his attention on 
. 
 gives 
 the command to fire and 
 always hits her target. Unfortunately (a favorite Dirty Pair word!), 
 hits more than her intended target, but then I think 
 forgot to tell 
 what had moved above them.
In the end, 
 can't help but to thank our heroines, even if he must now help them write another load of apologies. Still, a good score for the Lovely Angels record! Not only did they take out Beringer and destroy the stolen mech, they managed to get "Mad Dog" Kamen in the process as well!
Overall scores were several thousand for the good guys, complete toast for the bad guys, and for everyone else, heavy collateral damage with mixed casualties and a serious taste of what's to come now that the Dirty Pair have come of age!

The series 
 and 
 is a "hard science-fiction" anime. It's pretty much about a girl named 
, an 18 year-old girl with a "ghoul" living within her.
In the series, 
 started out as an amateur trying her best in the "army", and also trying to figure out why her father "worked" there. Later on, 
 is on a team with 
, Suzanna, and Luxandra, the best... let's just say "students" there.
In one of the episodes, 
 meets a little girl walking into a room with a giant gun, bigger then her's, in the middle of her and her team's "gun practice". As 
 watched the little girl hit every single "virtual" rock, she just stares at her. You must be wondering, what is a little girl doing there with a gun?! Well, she's NOT a normal girl. Her name is Kotoko -01, and she is actually a support android made from "Watcher's nest".
Divergence Eve is all about 
, the ghoul within her, and her team going to different planets, trying to kill the ghoul and a bunch of other things about the other characters.

Based on the hit PS2 Strategy/RPG video game series, Disgaea follows the comedic and supernatural misadventures of 
, who is the prince of the Netherworld. He awakes after sleeping for two years, only to find the Netherworld in chaos and his father King Krichevskoy dead.
 sets out on a mission to reclaim the Netherworld, along with the help of 
, his father's former vassel. Will 
 succeed in gaining his late fathers legacy?
The King of the Netherworld has died and various demons are now building their own empires in an effort to take control. However, the late King's son has arrived and is out to reclaim his rightful place as ruler of the Netherworld! Along to help him is his vassal; 
 with her Prinny squad, and 
, an angel-in-training originally sent to assassinate the king only to find that he has already died. Join our three intrepid, and somewhat eccentric, heroes as they initiate their plan to conquer the Netherworld, Heaven and Earth in DISGAEA.

Mika Suzuki is a teacher at Okitsa High School, but standing at 148 cm (4'10") in height, her students don't take her seriously. Her living with her parents at age 27 doesn't help either. She has a bubbly personality and suffers from chronic back pain. Her students are a mixture of kids. Kobayashi has a very short attention span, and is always harping about her weight (50 kg; 110 lbs.) Nakamura is nicknamed "old man" because not only does he look older than he is, he acts that way as well. Seki is the classical narcissist, who isn't above cross-dressing. Iincho wants to be class president because her favorite singer said he liked class presidents. Watabe aspires to be the world's greatest artist; he's the only member of the manga club. Kudo, a gay pervert, loves Suetake (but not vice versa) and has the title of "nosebleed king." Tominaga is in the cooking club, likes horror films and generally has to put guys in their place. Kitagawa has a thing for short women, and naturally, likes Mika. Suetake is the jock; he's in several sports clubs, but not really that bright.
They have the physical exam day at the school, and naturally, Kobayashi is worried about her weight. Naturally, after weighing herself, she gets very depressed. Mika has to take the exam as well, and finds out she's getting shorter. Later at the basketball championships, Mika is a backup referee. When the original ref does not show, Mika reveals she doesn't know the rules of basketball. A last-minute intervention by Mika's doting father saves the day. Kitagawa cheers for her. After watching volleyball, they watch the baseball game. Seki encourages the others to cheer by dressing up in a cheerleader's outfit and giving the girls pom-poms. Mika's class ends up winning.
On the first day of summer, Seki comes in dressed as a Japanese schoolgirl. Mika collapses in the summer heat, and they take her to the school nurse Matsumoto. Then they go out for swimming. The guys admire Matsumoto in her bikini; however, Mika only gets praises from Kitagawa. After getting into the pool, Mika passes out and has to be rescued. Kitagawa offers to give her artificial respiration, despite her being able to breathe on her own.
Next it's time to study for the exams. Here's where we find out Mika may not be very bright, as she encourages the kids not to be cunning instead of not cheating. Oddly enough, the only student that passed the exams was resident baka jock Suetake.
During summer break, Mika's dad takes her to a shopping arcade, where she meets all her students. He thinks Seki is a girl until Mika sets him straight; however, this doesn't sit too well with him. Then at the summer festival, Mika and her students meet up. Seki shows up in a yukata (a traditional Japanese female summer kimono.) To spot her in the crowd, her students tie a bunch of balloons to Mika. She ends up floating into the air. Kudo gets to hold Suetake's hand, and clueless Suetake doesn't think anything of it. They play a bunch of games as well. In the end, they watch a fireworks display.

Kyoji Miura is a dedicated Kendo Blade student who discovers an amazing and frightening secret about his master Masanari Tate. He learns that he is the reincarnation of an Incan Warrior named Yawaru, who wants to purify the world only through its destruction.
Even more surprising is the fact that Kyoji is destined to stop him, learning that he is also descended from Yawaru's rival, Bilka. Yawaru seeks the spirits and powers of nature to complete his plans, and a battle from the ancient past will soon reawaken on Earth. But Kyoji himself struggles with his identity. Is he really Kyoji? Or the warrior Bilka? The future of the world will depend on the entire outcome.
Fun Fact: Clips of this anime can be seen in the Opening for the Comedy series, "Malcolm in the Middle."

In the long-awaited fifth installment of the Digimon series, Digimon Savers focused on a tough 14-year old named Masaru Daimon, who is the self-proclaimed "best street fighter in Japan." He meets an escaped Digimon named 
, who is on the run from D.A.T.S, an organization dedicate to protecting Earth from invading Digimon.
After fighting and acknowledging each other's strength, they become partners and members of D.A.T.S. He is teamed with two other members, Tohma and his partner Gaomon and Yoshino and her partner Raramon. As they fight they discover the mysteries of the Digital World and its mysterious ruler Mercurimon and a mysterious boy named Ikuto, who may be responsible for the numerous amounts of Digimon attacks on Earth.
Note: Apparently a movie will be coming soon!

and 
, those intrepid trouble consultants from the 3WA, return with five more TV episodes filled with action, thrills... and plenty of damage and destruction in their wake!
Among the themes in this outing, the "Lovely Angels" investigate a counterfeiting mob family, while 
 plans to marry one of them. Then the girls run into someone from their past as they infiltrate the world of underground fighting. Then they protect the only survivor of a 20-year old mass murder... a 5 year-old girl found in a 20-year cold sleep!
Also, the Angels try to mediate peace between warring factions, while a weapons dealer seeks to derail their efforts. And to top it all off, the girls become space truckers to find out who's killing all the good buddies during their long-hauls. This is one outing the insurance companies don't want to know about... and one to keep Chief Gooley in antacids!

Now that 
 and 
 have finally settled down and are willing to tolerate each others extreme behavior, the new chief of their WWWA division assigns them to their first case as full agents. The world of "World's World", a planet-sized theme park, has encountered a major computer virus. The 3WA is therefore sending a Tro-Con to assist, and 
 and 
 have been selected to "baby-sit" the technical Tro-Con, 
.
Upon arrival at "World's World", the girls cannot see what all the fuss is about concerning 
's rather unorthodox landing. At least she is a better pilot than 
. 
 and 
 leave with 
 to escort him to security headquarters. Using a quaint method of transport known as a "Taxi", the three of them are ready to depart. Here the first attempt on 
 is made, putting 
 in a bad mood. Later 
 is shown to his hotel room, during which time another attempt is made on his life. This attempt, though, is stopped very abruptly by 
. The assassin makes a hasty exit whilst leaving a number of grenades on the floor. Out in the hall, 
 is passed by the assassin. Needless to say 
 catches up to both 
 and the assassin, and returns some of his property to him.
Although the assassin has been dealt with, 
 informs 
 and 
 that the viral infection is going to take sometime to sort out and until then "World's World" will remain under quarantine. Therefore they cannot leave at present.

This seems like good news to 
 and 
, trapped in a theme park and the assassin has already been dealt with. 
 decides that they will stay and have fun, since their new boss won't know anything about it. But of course things don't run smoothly. The Lovely Angels find that, due to their latest tactical operation, there is no accommodations left for them in the hotel. Being 3WA agents, the girls throw their weight down and some accommodations are found for the girls. However, the "World's World" officials are concerned that they may not like it.
The girls arrive at their new accommodation, an elite school for girls, prompting two completely opposite reactions from 
 and 
. During the next few days 
 uses the opportunity to rouse 
. Eventually 
 pushes 
 too far and 
 gets them expelled. Of course when 
 finds out what 
 has done, she attempts to exterminate 
 and 
.
 still has not finished fixing the network or tracking down the viral infection. Thus while waiting, the girls go looking for MORE fun, but as usual trouble finds them.
 recognizes a wanted criminal, a con artist named 
. To 
 this means reward money and therefore an expensive meal. So 
 drags 
 off after 
. This involves leaving the city and being dragged across a desert, which does not exactly make 
 very happy (not the best thing for 
's soft complexion and long hair). Still, the girls get to play with some nice large dump trucks, and naturally capture their prey. So our girls get both their man and their meal.
 has still not been able to track the virus entry point, but is closing in on the source. The group has now been found some better accommodations, but this still does not suit our girls until they do a little rearranging of their own (poor 
).
For the next few days, 
's efforts are distracted by a beautiful young lady named 
. 
 tries his best to impress 
 and even asks 
 for her advice. 
 shows 
 that he should not be afraid and arranges a date for 
. Things naturally take an unexpected turn. This affair almost kills 
 with laughter. 
, however, is both shocked and then very pleased for several reasons.
 finally tracks down the source of the virus to JAIC. However JAIC needs to escape off planet and heads for the spaceport, due to be reopened within the hour, after two weeks. 
 identifies JAIC at the spaceport, and 
 and 
 go into pursuit, only to see JAIC steal the Lovely Angel itself.
, of course, goes completely insane over this (or should that be ballistic!). 
 meantime has the brilliant idea of hijacking an incoming transport to block the Lovely Angel (they cannot let JAIC escape). This maneuver surprisingly works. Since we are talking the Dirty Pair here, there is a rather unfortunate consequence for "World's World".
The bright side of this is that after having spent two weeks really winding 
 up, when 
 is nearly killed 
 rushes to her and even 
 is surprised by this. At least the girls can quite truthfully state that they achieved all of their mission objectives, and that no criminal will ever get away from them! It's just the civilians that need to keep their heads down.

Digimon is about seven young kids who go to camp for the summer and end up getting sucked into a vortex leading to a digital world. They all meet up with little monsters known as Digimon. Each kid has their own Digital friend, which can Digivolve, Warp Digivolve, Mega Digivolve, DNA Digivolve, Armor Digivolve, etc. The kids go on many adventures as they try to get home and save the digital world.
Digimon now has 4 movies in the U.S, excluding 
. The first U.S. Digimon movie was comprised of the first 3 Japanese Digimon movies, while the remaining ones based on the last Digimon Seasons we're released in the U.S. not too long ago. They we're all broadcasted on Toon Disney.

The first season of Digimon tells the story of different seven different children (
, 
, 
, 
, 
, 
, and 
) brought together under extraordinary circumstances. During a trip to summer camp, an earthquake envelops them all, and sends them to a realm known as the Digital World. They meet creatures called Digital Monsters, creatures (some friendly, others aren't) that are capable of evolving (or Digivolving) into more powerful forms. They immediately befriend the children, becoming their partners and helping them survive the many perils of the Digital World.
However, as their journey continues, they learn that the world they are trapped in isn't a game, and learn of the true reason they were sent there. The Digital World is threatened by a great evil, and the children learn of their true destiny as the Digidestined. In order to pull it off, they must realize the true potential of their Digimon and themselves. They also receive different crests of virtue to help in their mission. But, the danger is mounting and the Digidestined's battle to save the Digital World will soon spill into their own....

The second season begins three years after the Digidestined saved the Digital World. As they all enter Junior High school, the Digital World has been peaceful ever since, until a new and different threat arrives. The Digital World is now being terrorized by someone known as the Digimon Emperor. However, their new enemy is human, using the Digital world as a game to fuel his frustrations and ambitions.
The Digidestined are called back into action to put a stop to the Digimon Emperor's iron-fisted domination over the Digital World. However, new allies and Digimon join them in this new battle. But they soon learn that the Digimon Emperor is only a pawn of a new and mysterious evil threatening the Digital World. All of which will culminate in a battle that will involve the entire all of Earth....

The third season breaks away from the story of the Digidestined and focuses on a new set of heroes in an Alternate Universe. 
 is a kid who is obsessed with Digimon (which is a hit TV show and card game). One night, a Digimon known as Guilmon (
's favorite Digimon) arrives in his world, all with the help of a mysterious Blue card. He eventually meets two other children (
 with Terriermon and 
 teamed with Renamon) who also have Digimon for mysterious reasons.
They soon learn that their world is being invaded by out of control Digimon, all kept under the watchful eye of a mysterious man named Yamaki, who is a part of a mysterious government organization known as HYPNOS. The three children eventually travel to the Digital World to find and cut off the source of this invasion and become a part of a battle to save Earth from a sinister force that could devastate both Earth and the Digital World.

Note: Digimon: the Movie is a combination of the first three Japanese Digimon movies. (Digimon Adventure, Our War Game, and The Golden Digimentals)
Digimon: The Movie presents the Theatrical debut of the popular series, which is comprised of three different stories/segments narrated by 
.
The first segment starts four years before the Digidestined traveled to the Digital World in the series. It tells of the first encounter (and battle) 
 and 
 had with the Digimon. It starts when a Digiegg falls from the Digital World, which hatches a Botamon. As they raise and evolve it, the Digimon unintentionally wrecks the neighborhood and soon evolves from an 
 to a Greymon (which isn't the same Digimon from the series) that battles an invading Digimon known as Parrotmon. Soon enough, the other Digidestined become involved in the battle, starting the destiny that's soon to come for each of them.
The second story opens with a mysterious Digiegg that 
 and 
 discover on the internet. It reveals itself as Diaboromon, and soon begins assuming control over the net and much of the world's technological databanks. As 
 and 
 both try to intercept the threat, most of the other Digidestined are busy with their own activities, leaving them short-handed. Soon enough, most of the kids worldwide experience the battle against Diaboromon. However, time is running out, and Armageddon may not be too far behind if the Digidestined fail to stop this sinister Digimon.
The third and final segment opens with the Digidestined traveling to America. Diaboromon apparently links to a mysterious boy named Willis, whom our heroes are searching for. As it turns out, Willis is on the run with his partner Kokomon from Endigomon. When the Digidestined come to help, they soon find out that Willis was accidently responsible for Diaboromon's creation.

creator: Akiyoshi Hongo
title: Digimon Adventure
Digimon Adventure: Our War Game
Digimon Adventure 02: Digimon Hurricane Landing - Excellent Evolution!! Golden Digimentals

description: Diamond Dustdrops is about six girls falling in love during a cold winter of Hokkaido. Like every love story, happiness doesn't come easily. They must learn to fight and take grasp of their own destiny. Diamond Daydreams or Diamond Dustdrops is about six girls doing what people do every day, falling in love.

Long ago in the Digital World, a crisis occurred that almost destroyed it. However, a group of ten Digimon, called the Ten Ancient Warriors, sacrificed themselves to stop the crisis. What followed was a golden-age in the digital world, governed by the three Celestial Digimon. However, this did not last forever, as 
, one of the three Celestial Digimon, shattered the peace and declared war. There was hope, though, as the spirits of the Ten Ancient Warriors were to be reincarnated as the Ten Legendary Warriors as their world became endangered once more.
On another world, five kids (
, 
, 
, 
, 
, and 
) each receive an SMS message on their mobile phones telling them to be at the train station where they live at a precise time. When they arrive in the Digital World, they find out that they are the Digi-Destined, along with five others. They all have a corresponding Digimon, who they can Digivolve into. They are helped along the way by two Truedigimon, Bokomon, and Neemon.
The kids' cell phones change into their Digivises, which is their main unit for changing into the Ten Legendary Warriors.

A virtual realm, the Digital World, was created by the present-day network. The world is inhabited by the Digimon, digital-lifeforms of various forms with a host computer "Yggdrasil" to mantain the balance. However, out of fear, Yggdrasil developed the "X-Program" to eliminate all Digimon and develop a new Digital World, except for certain Digimon it decided to spare. But there is one unique Digimon born with immunity to the "X Program", just as the greatest disaster ever is approaching the Digital World....
Digimon: X-Evolution is the 8th Digimon movie, but aired on Fuji TV toward the beginning of January, 2005. Unlike the other films, this one features only Digimon, not humans.

In a world where science and magic has advanced dramatically, Kuro Daijuuji is a poor and struggling detective living in the magic city of Arkham. One day, his luck changes when he receives a request from Ruri Hado of the famed Hado Financial Group. Kuro is requested to help find a special Grimoire (a magic book) that is known to have unimaginable power. Though Kuro initially refuses, a large sum of money obviously changes his mind.
While searching for the book, he runs afowl of the sinister Black Lodge, an evil organization lead by the powerful wizard Master Terion. However, he also runs into a young girl who is actually revealed to be a powerful Grimoire. She decides to forge a contract with Kuro, giving him incredible magic powers.
As if that weren't enough, he soon discovers the ability to summon a powerful mecha owned by the Hado Financial Group known as Demonbane. And this was only of the beginning of the war that will rage between Hado and the evil Black Lodge.

Devil Hunter Yohko, commonly known as Mamono Hunter Yohko, is a japanese animation series about 16 year old 
. She is your typical guy-crazy teenager who shows up late to school, hangs out with her best friend 
, and is a little lax about studying. However, cute, bouncy 
 has been training since childhood in the art of Devil Hunting (unbeknowngst to her) by her Grandma-ma 
, and inherits the mantle of being the 108th generation Devil Hunter.
The series is a an action/comedy with a tiny flair for sexual situations, most notably in Volume 1, as we watch 
 mercifulessly banish the demons from Earth. Along the way 
 almost loses her virginity, gains a sidekick named 
, frees a prince from emprisonment, and dies (but just a little). Nobody will ever nominate the series for ground-breaking storylines, but Devil Hunter Yohko is nevertheless a fun series. Although the first volume is a little racy for some, the rest of the volumes are more appropriate for general viewing.

Based on the popular videogame 
, this series follows 
, a half-demon, half-human mercenary and demon hunter. As the owner of the Demon Extermination service "Devil May Cry", he takes on any mission involving the supernatural. So long as the price is right, of course.
The story begins when 
 is hired as a bodyguard to an orphaned girl named 
, an illegitimate child heir to a large fortune and has to protect her from demons sent by those who want the inheritance for themselves. Along the way, they are attacked by several demons hired by 
's relatives.
Other characters from 
 also make appearances such as 
 and 
.

Our first story centers around two seventeen year old girls, whom for as yet unknown reasons have decided to be galactic police officers. At first sight, 
 and 
 must be considered an ill match at best, as they cannot agree on anything and represent a danger to themselves and others. However, the powers that be have decided that the unique talents of these two junior agents CAN be harnessed and in time they can be molded into top class Trouble Consultants. (It would appear that this is their first assignment outside their WWWA training period, and I would therefore guess that the Flash adventures take place after the Shatsi incident but before the other stories.)
Trouble already seems to know how to find 
 and 
, as it quite literally drops at 
's feet. This is very inconvenient since 
 is waiting for a date. (At this point in their lives, it seems 
 is purely occupied with how cute she is, while 
 plans to be able to out shoot everyone!) The girls suddenly find themselves being chased by a large number of heavily armed assassins, who seem to want the data card 
 now has in her possession, even though 
 does not actually want it.

While fleeing from the attackers, 
 and 
 manage to constantly be at each others throats. As they make their way to the safety of 3WA headquarters, our heroines manage to lay waste to a large part of the derelict suburbs of the city. With a little help from headquarters, the girls make it back with the data card. While the data card is being decrypted, 
 and 
 are given a simple bodyguard assignment. Unfortunately their assignment doesn't last long as their targets are taken out! 
, followed by 
, give chase to the person they believe to be the assassin, but find that, as good as the girls are (albeit inexperienced), they are totally out classed by this new adversary. (This of course really upsets 
, who is not used to being beaten!)
Back at headquarters the assassin is identified as 
, and the girls are ordered not to pursue the matter. 
 is too dangerous for junior agents to apprehend. 
 is furious at being ordered not to pursue 
 and storms out. In order to give 
 time to cool down, 
 is given another assignment.
While on her own, 
 manages to track the assassin on board a luxury ship, and finds her meeting with a man named 
, who she has seen before. Meanwhile, 
 is informed that 
 has been placed on suspension for disobeying direct orders, and 
 is to bring her back for her own good.
On board the ship 
 corners 
, who outwits her, but due to a mishap of 
's the ship goes out of control and 
's luck enables her to obtain the upper hand, leading to an unfortunate demise for 
. Unfortunately, the ship itself is also lost, but the girls manage to survive as usual.
, still mad at 
, arrests her for the improper use of illegal weapons while on suspension. 
, outraged by 
's behavior, quits, and 
 is granted a new partner, Lillie. Unfortunately, Lillie makes 
 look like a dedicated agent at this point.
 is now tracking 
 as a freelance operative in her usual discreet manner, with the help of some gang members she has under her thumb. Meanwhile, 
 and Lillie are now also tracking 
, who has been under investigation by section 9 officers for some time. 
 and Lillie are to assist in the operation to capture 
 at the spaceport. However Lillie is a very pale imitation of 
 and panics during the operation. All mayhem is let loose as opposing forces attempt to nail 
. As civilians dive everywhere, the spaceport is reduced to rubble. Fortunately civilian casualties are quite minimal, probably because 
 is not around.
It is now known that 
 has the override access for the galactic communications system, which he plans to use to blackmail the galaxy. Unfortunately, the ordinary galactic police are unable to stop 
. However 
 has managed to stay on his tail, but as they close in, Lillie decides this is all too much for such a cute girl and abandons 
, leaving her plunging to certain death!
Just at that moment 
 appears through the thick of the fighting along with their boss (Garner) and rescues 
. 
 is somewhat taken aback by 
's arrival, thinking that 
 no longer cared for her.

The three of them manage to board the space station. 
 and 
 go round in one direction, while Garner goes round the other way. On his way around Garner comes across and old friend whom 
 is to find has a secret that really surprises her.
Meanwhile, 
 and 
 have found 
 and are attempting to subdue him, when Garner and his friend come to assist them. After a pitch battle and a large amount of gunfire, 
 is terminated and the girls have completed the case objectives, though not without casualties. The communications station, essential to this region of the galaxy, has not fared as well as the girls and is just about to explode. Therefore our adventurers make their exit just in time to catch a ring side view of the station going up into a million pieces.
Finally back at WWWA headquarters, Garner debriefs the girls and informs them that they have now been assigned as full field agents and the code name "Lovely Angels" has been allocated to them, along with their own cruiser. While Garner himself closes one of his own past cases for good.
Both 
 and 
, despite their continual disagreements, leave together having proved ONE VERY IMPORTANT POINT. They cannot bare to be apart and each needs the other, even if they are unable to admit it. As they drive away, you know this is the start of a long and deep friendship that will see them through many situations.
During this story, watch out for the first assignment that 
 and her new partner are given and note 
's reaction to her new partners behavior. If only 
 could have seen it! I also believe that 
 and 
 could have learned a lot from Freya, but alas!

Shoichi Negishi is a young man who lives in the rural Ota Prefecture, and he goes to Tokyo in hopes of starting a trendy pop band. He wants to write peaceful and cute songs that his mother could be proud of. Somehow, five years later, he ends up in the death metal band Detroit Metal City.
He now takes songs that used to be cute and fun, and changes the lyrics to make them vulgar. He is also idolized as Johannes Krauser II, who is known to have killed his parents at a young age and afterwards raped them, and he's still out raping any slut he sees. What would happen if the girl Negishi loved found out that he was the lead singer of the band she hates the most?
On top of this, Negishi has to hide his new job from his family and the people he loves most. It's not easy when interviewers and the Death Record's President try to interfere! And will Negishi ever be able to quit this band to start the one he originally wanted? All this and many more insane situations poor Negishi gets into, along with a killer song for the opening in Detroit Metal City. Go to DMC!!!

Japan in the future has been reduced to an inhospitable wasteland. 
, the Desert Punk, travels the Great Kanto Desert eking out a living in this harsh environment. He's not exactly what you would call a 'model citizen'... he's been known to use questionable methods, to mention being a big pervert... but he prides himself with completing whatever job he's given, then collecting the money and moving on into the desert.
However, everything changes when 
 happens upon Junko Asagiri, a beautiful mercenary he stupidly rescues from a competitor of hers, only to have Junko double-cross him as payment for saving her (it must've been 
 seeing her very big boobs that started it). Now the little runt finds himself having to contend with Junko, but also Kosuna, a pint-sized sharpshooter who's striving to help him out whenever possible... as well as a deadly rival named Rain Spider trying to kill him!
Earning a living in the desert isn't as easy as it sounds.

In the far future, mankind has laid waste to the Earth, turning it into a giant desert. In the Great Kantou Desert (formally Japan), many people struggle to make a living in the hot sands, and only the strongest manage to thrive. Among them is a short-statured bounty hunter named Sunabozu, who has a reputation for being the deadliest Bounty Hunter in the Kantou Desert.
However, after a mission involving a beautiful woman turns the tables on Sunabozu, he now struggles to reclaim what he has lost and his title of the "Demon of the Sand." However, the only thing standing in his way is his weakness for the opposite sex.... especially when its named Junko Asagiri.

Kannauki no Miko is about two girls, Chikane and Himeko, who went to an ordinary high school until the orochi (or gods) attacked. Then they found out they were priestesses, Chikane the priestess of the moon and Himeko the priestess of the sun.
Together they must destroy the orochi, save the earth from being destroyed, and rebuild the shrine on the moon.
But Chikane knows something Himeko does not. In order to rebuild the shrine, a sacrifice of a priestess must be made.

One day an object of some kind appears to fall from space into the woods nearby the home of one Max Taylor, a pre-teen boy who is absolutely obsessed with dinosaurs, though that should be no surprise considering his dad is a paleontologist. At any rate, Max sees this unknown object land somewhere in the woods, and so he calls his friends out to come help him search. Max, together with Rex Owen and Zoe Drake, are known as the D-Team (can you guess what the "D" stands for?), and it doesn't take them long to find the point of impact, but they're shocked at what they find... stones! Not average, ordinary stones, but specifically shaped stones, with symbols on them... and a little button/knob thing. Touching the button makes them light up. Oh, and Max also finds a card that has a triceratops on it.
When Max rubs the card against the stone for whatever reason, the triceratops comes out of the card and stands before them in it's giant, full-sized CGI-glory. Yeah, the dinosaurs here are done in CGI, and they don't match too well with the traditional anime-style the rest of the series follows. But I'm thinking this was probably on purpose, to make the dinosaurs stand out. As Max cowers from the giant lizard, the triceratops somehow disappears back into the card. Max then rubs the card against the stone again, but instead of a giant triceratops, a little baby one the size of a dog shows up... and it's in the traditional anime style. Max names it Chomp, because it starts biting him.
Now that we know the heroes of the story, we are taken to meet the people who will be the villains. Doctor Z is the man in charge, a short guy with white hair and an extremely annoying voice. Along side him are the beautiful and busty Ursula and her two male lackeys, tall and slender Zander and short pudgy Ed. Together they make up the evil Alpha Gang! There are also a couple kids, Laura and Rod, but not too sure how they fit into this dysfunctional family. Oh yeah, and some blue-haird guy named Seth. Unlike the others, he actually looks like he's not a bumbling idiot.
The meat of the series here is that the D-Team must travel around the world capturing dinosaur cards, though usually they seem to be in their full-sized forms that need to be beaten so they will turn into a dinosaur card. And of course, they usually have to deal with the Alpha Gang. Oddly enough, Max's dad gives him and the other D-Team members an electronic device that supposedly acts just like the stones they found, just swipe the card through the slot... wow, isn't technology wonderful? Well, wonderful or absurd, one of the two. At least they included a ginormous manual with it... except that most of the pages are blank because apparently the people who made it don't actually know what it can do.
Okay, I'm just going to come out and say it... this is a Pokemon clone, pure and simple. It's based on a videogame, which I haven't played, so I don't know if the two games are similar, but the two anime series definitely are. Instead of pokeballs, they have cards. They both have cute little creatures, but in this series they happen to be baby dinosaurs, and when the creatures battle they are made bigger. The kids here are also similar to those in Pokemon. And the bad guys? Yep, Ursula, Zander, and Ed feel very much like 
 and 
, and 
.

Max Taylor is a dinosaur fanatic and the leader of the D-Team, a group of friends devoted to learning all they need to know about dinosaurs. He is the son of Dr. Spike Taylor, a paleontologist assisted by Reese Drake, the older sister of Zoe Drake, one of Max's friends. His second and best friend, Rex Owen, lives with him under the Taylor Family's care while his father is away.
One day, Max sees a meteor that crashes into a nearby forest, and wakes up Rex while also calling another friend of his, Zoe. The three investigate, and stumble upon magic stone slabs with images of dinosaurs. Soon enough, the kids are being called out to by the dinosaurs for help. It seems that an organization known as the Alpha Gang, led by Dr. Z, has traveled back in time to hunt down dinosaurs so they could use them to take over the world.
And so, the three kids start traveling around the world, battling the Alpha Gang while hunting down the dinosaurs.
Dinosaur King is based on a Sega game franchise with the same name. It's also the second anime series to be based on a Sega game, the first two being the 
 movie and 
.

title: Ancient Ruler Dinosaur King DKidz Adventure
Kodai Oja Kyoryu King: DKidz Adventure

description:
In matters relating to the world of the dead, there is an institution that judges the sins of the deceased: the Ministry of Hades. The Summons Section of the Judgement Bureau comprises a group supporting the Ministry's operating functions by guiding the lost souls that wander the mortal world. They are also known as the Guardians of Death (or Shinigami).
 is a Guardian of Death; his only problem is that no one wants to work with him. When given a case involving a vampire, 
, an unusually young Guardian with an obscure past, is tricked into working with 
. As the two delve deeper into the case, it becomes apparent that someone else is controlling the vampire, Maria Wong. The man controlling Maria is one 
, a doctor with a twisted perspective who lets no one get in his way on his quest to find the secret of immortality.
That's not a good thing when 
 is in the way, and 
 kidnaps Hisoka to use as bait for a trap. Things start getting ugly when Hisoka finally remembers that 
 is the one who killed him years ago, and now both 
 and Hisoka are out for revenge.

It was bound to happen sometime. Yep, the prince of the underworld has finally returned to Earth. Man, I was really enjoying life too. But wait... what's this? He isn't here to destroy us all? Sweet! Apparently he's here to seek out and capture (or destroy) rogue demons. Who would have figured the demon prince for a good guy? Well... maybe calling him a good guy is going a bit to far. After all, he is willing take human life in order to kill the demons that inhabit the innocent human hosts. Not like he has a lot of choice in the matter, though.
Anyway, so Enma arrives on Earth and meets up with Kapaeru, a weird mutant-looking creature who has embraced the 20th century and all it has to offer, such as cell phones and night clubs with pretty girls (he tells everyone that he is wearing a costume so they don't get freaked out by his appearance. Enma brings with him a rather unusual creature that looks like some kind of witch's hat. Called Chapeauji, this guy seems to sleep a lot. Enma often wears him like a hat. Filling out our main cast is Yukihime, an ice maiden demon princess that won't hesitate to encase Enma in a block of ice should he "accidentally" spy her in the nude.
In order to help track down this demons, the group has set up a detective agency that specializes in supernatural or unexplainable mysteries. Of course, just being passive and waiting for others to seek them out just won't do! Luckily, Kapaeru also has a source that lets him know whenever she hears any kind of strange stories so they can go check it out.
The first story focus on a sexy blonde who... how can I say this... men give her money and she gives them pleasure... in private. Her father is German, which is where she gets her stand-out looks... which makes her popular. Of course, she keeps this life hidden from her father. But then she starts getting these visions of horrible deaths, which she is totally freaked out by since the deaths actually seem to be happening. So while the police look for a serial killer, our demon hunters look for the demon.
The second story involves a young, naive girl working in a night club where the men all tend to be of the touchy-feely variety. She does not like this, not one bit. Why she doesn't just quit, I still haven't been able to figure out. But no, she doesn't quit, she goes ahead and puts on the short-skirted sailor school uniform and perform her waitressing duties. After a bad night at work, she comes home early to find her "boyfriend" (or the guy she thought was her boyfriend, even though all the other girls tried to tell her what he really was) in bed with a hot number.
So she freaked, and wished he would die. Then later that night, the doll that he had given her earlier in the day and that she had thrown out the window after her discovery... killed him. When more bodies start showing up, the group investigates, though at first Enma doesn't take it seriously and instead gets distracted by the talent at the night club. Actually, the only one who seems to think this threat to be real is Kapaeru. Of course, Enma will see the eventually see the light as well, just too bad it takes his life being in eminent danger from this demon in order to get him there.
This series really seems to be more about atmosphere than anything else. The characters aren't very deep, nor are the mysteries or how they go about solving them. There is some occasional humor, but not nearly enough to classify this as a comedy. Really, it seems like a mojority of the stories focus on not on our main characters, but on the characters involved with whatever weirdness is going on. To me, this just makes the show seem kind of bland.

In the year 2545, a teletransporation experiment gone wrong puts test pilot David Jance through the center of the galaxy and into another universe, where he ends up in the middle of a life-and-death struggle against the armies of GRIP, led by Dark Star. In order to defeat Dark Star, the good forces combine to form Macron 1.
Macron 1 was a flying space robot formed when Beta Command, led by Dr. Chagall, joined its energy and weaponry with the Macstar, piloted by David Jance. Many characters, including the little robot An-D and wookie-like first mate Nok, were basically Star Wars ripoffs, as was some of the storyline. In many ways, Macron 1 was similar to 
, also receiving odd time slots and suffered from poor scheduling. Frankie Goes To Hollywood provided the theme song, "Relax".
The show was originally aired in Japan as Sengoku Majin Go-Shogun ("Demon-God of the War-Torn Land Shogun") in its first season (1981), and as Aku Dai Sakusen Srungle- "Great Military Operation in Subspace Srungle" from 1983-84. When dubbed and aired in America, current Top-40 hits were added.

title: Sengoku Majin Go-Shogun
Demon-God of the War-Torn Land Shogun
Aku Dai Sakusen Srungle
Great Military Operation in Subspace Srungle

description:
Demon City Shinjuku is about this guy (Kyouya) who's father (Genichiro) was killed when trying to defeat Levi Rah. Levi Rah was once his rival, but he sold his soul to the devil for power. Hmm... fighting game junkies, you know this guy sure sounds like Akuma. As part of the deal, ol' Levi has to turn the Shinjuku district of Tokyo into the capital of evil monsters and demons to kill without purpose. Levi Rah and Kyouya, as well as Kyouya's father, are masters of the skill of Nempo, which is incredibly powerful.
Kyouya doesn't even try to save the world until after the peace ambassador was kidnapped, and even then it was after the ambassador's daughter got into some trouble in Shinjuku. Hmm... sound like 
 to you? Just slightly.
Kyouya doesn't have a too good understanding of Nempo, so it really isn't good for him that he has to train while in a city full of monsters out to take his life, and mystic traps. At least he finds some help while he's there. Too bad some of the help tries to kill him and dies. Oh well. Who will win? The answer may never surprise you.

Voogie's Angel takes place in the not-too distant year of 2020, where humanity is on the losing side of a war against a sinister alien race known as the extraterrestrial Space Emigrants. Humanity is forced to live in underwater cities and mankind's defenses are quickly overwhelmed by the aliens' more advanced technology.
A Century has passed since humanity was placed underfoot by the Space Emigrants, and the remnants of humanity has planned an offensive to take back their planet. Their hopes are placed on four cybernetically enhanced girls: Voogie, Rebecca, Merrybell, and Shiori. Together they use the latest weaponry to carry out guerilla attacks on the alien enemy and ultimately take back the planet Earth.

is a boy who dreams to become the worlds greatest detective. He gets the best opportunity when he is given the chance to enroll himself at Dan Detective School.
There he meets Megumi, Kintarou, and Kazuma. Later, they meet 
. They each possess their own skills and abilities.
Together they manage to qualify to enter the rank of 'Class Q' which stands for 'qualified'. Furthermore, Class Q is the best class in DDS. They are to be hand-taught by the school's principal, Dan Morihiko.

In the hideous Shadowlands, a demon called the Shadow Lord overtakes the Land of Deltora by destroying a mystical object: the Belt of Deltora. This belt consists of seven gems, the Diamond, the Emerald, the Lapis Luzuli, the Topaz, the Opal, the Ruby, and the Amethyst. It is the only thing that protected Deltora from his cruel ways, and now, it is destroyed...
Sixteen years after this all occurred, a boy named 
 is sent on a quest to retrieve the Seven lost gems. Along with him are 
, his previous body-guard in the town of Del, and 
, a wild girl from the Forest.
If the trio cannot complete the task, all of Deltora will be lost.

For centuries, the demonic Black World has remained unknown to most of humanity. However, for just as long, a pact has remained between the two worlds, creating a peaceful coexistence. But new terms are negotiated every 100 years.
However, a militant group known as "The Radicals" aim to prevent a signing of the latest treaty. Taki Renzaburo and Makie are two agents of the Black Guard, agents assigned to protect the balance between Earth and the Black World. They are partnered together on a case to protect Giuseppi Mayart, a 200-year old man who will play a vital role at the treaty signing. But the Radicals will stop at nothing to kill Giuseppi and upset the balance between Earth and the Black World. In this dark supernatural thriller, nothing is as it seems.

, an intelligent high school student with a loving family and high social status is bored with his life. Being the son of a Police Detective, he becomes despondent with the constant crimes he witnesses on the news. One day, he finds a notebook entitled the "Death Note" which has the power to kill anyone whose name is written into it. He doubts the book's power until he tests it out for himself, and to his shock it proves to work with deadly efficiency.
He meets a Shinigami (Death God) named 
, who was also bored of his life in the Shinigami Realm. He is the owner of the Death Note and drops it out of boredom. 
 decides to undergo a massive plot to completely wipe evil from the world and become its new God, by using the Death Note to kill each and every criminal on Earth. (Even to the point of eliminating anything and anyone that gets in the way of his plans.)
As more and more names are written into the Death Note, the world takes attention to the massive number of criminal deaths. The International Police Organization scrambles to find out who is responsible and how the murders are being committed. Gaining the help of the eccentric master detective known as "
," he makes his presence known to 
 (known to the world as "Kira"), resulting in a massive battle of wits between the two minds.
Who will win and who will die first? And what type of "Justice" will ultimately prevail in the end?

Death Note is a 12 volume manga series (plus one extra 13th issue called "How to Read 13") that has recently been turned into a 37 episode anime series (plus one 3-hour special) and has a live-action movie that was released in Japan June 17th, 2006.
It's about a high school student by the name of Raito. One day he finds a strange book called Death Note. The book reads that if a human's name is written in the Note then that person will die in 40 seconds. At first, Raito didn't believe this, until a few experiments proved him wrong. And also, meeting the Shinigami 
 helped him believe in the Note.
After Raito learns a bit more about the Note he begins to 'Cleanse the World', as he puts it. He kills off all the criminals and gains the nickname 'Kira' in the process. Now he has to cleanse the world, and help the Japanese police force try and capture 'Kira' along side Raito's new suspicious enemy who goes simply by the name, 
.

One year ago, a spaceship carrying aliens drifted in Tokyo Bay. They couldn't go home, so they studied Japanese culture and eventually were able to receive Japanese citizenship. These people are called "DearS".
One day a high school student, 
, met a DearS girl whom he named 
 since her real name had the sound "ren" in it several times.
DearS are typically very intelligent and have an uncanny ability to learn languages, though 
 had not yet learned to speak Japanese. So one night with the help of childhood friend (and a daughter of the landlady) Neneko, 
 learned Japanese. 
 then calls 
 "Master" and keeps on saying "
 is 
's slave".

Debutante Detective Corps begins with the rather flashy arrival of five popular girls at school. (Miyuki, Reika, Youko, Nina, and 
). Each of them are incredibly wealthy, though life ain't worry free.
They have been sent a threatening video tape by a mysterious group of terrorists. The girls are placed under protective custody by the Police, until 
 decides to solve the problem herself and tricks the Police into leaving the school. From then on the girls are attacked by the terrorists. But ultimately, chaos ensues as the girls take them all on at full force. At the end of this crazy day, the school will never be the same....

This is not Japanese Animation! I have, however, decided to include it on this site anyway. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
Seeing the action and horror in the first Dead Space DVD, 
, is what got me interested in the videogame, and after only a day of playing the game it immediately jumped up my list to become one of my favorites on the Xbox 360. And now there's both a sequel game and sequel DVD, both which are being released on the same day, January 25, 2011. Oh yeah, you can bet that the DVD was at the top of my Netflix queue. But then something surprising happened... a review copy arrived in the mail! Woo-hoo!
The first thing on the DVD was a preview of the new game, which apparently takes place in the mind Isaac, the main character from the first game. The game looks visually stunning, but I usually don't like stories that take place in a dream or in someone's head, so I was rather disappointed to hear that you're just playing through Isaac's dementia. I'm sure I'll get over it once I start playing though, because it does look amazing.
Next the main feature, Dead Space: Aftermath, started playing, and I was blown away... not by how awesome it was, and not that it was CG instead of the 2D animation of the first film, but because somehow it was actually some particularly bad CG. The kind of detail and animation here felt like it would have been top of the line 10 years ago, or like something you might find on a small child's weekday morning TV show. Is this what Dead Space has been reduced to? Well, thankfully not.
It turns out that there actually is some wonderful 2D animation here, showing up to tell flashbacks of four survivors who were rescued from damaged ship USG OBannon that was sent in to investigate the events which took place in the first movie and game. What's cool is that the art style changes for each person's flashback, and that you get to see different versions of the same story. What's not so great is that the story doesn't have a whole lot of depth to it. There is not much sense of purpose for us as the audience watching these characters. What is their goal? Why is it important? Why should we care?
The other bad thing is when the flashbacks end, it's jarring because the awful CG returns. I bet it was an issue of time since it had to be released the same day as the game. I'm sure they probably wanted to fix it up and were just unable to because of the time crunch. The movie is slightly shorter than average, clocking in at an hour and 17 minutes, which includes the end credits, and when it's all over, we don't really own the feeling of going through an adventure and coming out with new insights into an overal plot thread. It's more like we watched some people struggle because some higher ups don't care about the little people and then it's over.
So I liked the 2D animation and action sequences, and the voice acting was particularly well done, but the story left me wanting much more.

Space Runaway Ideon begins in the year 2300, where mankind has ventured far into space and has advanced to the point where entire planets are finally colonized. An amazing discovery is made on the Planet Solo. Three vehicles are discovered, each having the ability to combine and transform into a powerful godlike robot known as the Ideon. A giant spaceship is also discovered.
Six months pass and restoration on the machines begin. But the vehicles fail to operate, until they receive help from an alien civilization known as the Buff Clan. Karara, the Princess of the Buff Clan, joins the colonists against the orders of her superiors. This leads to a misunderstanding between the Buff and the colonists.
Cosmo Yuki is the first person to finally operate the Ideon, and fends off the Buff assault. A war soon begins between the colonists and the Buff, who constantly pursue the Ideon and its mysterious power source. Cosmo stays as the Ideon's pilot, and discovers the terrifying power the Ideon wields. However, the battle takes a horrible toll on the crew, and the outcome of this hopeless battle may or may not end in even more bloodshed.

Ten years after a big earthquake in Tokyo, survivor Ganta Igarashi was having a normal middle school day until a guy dripping with blood (who Ganta called the Red Man) came into his classroom and murdered his entire class. With Ganta being the only survivor, the judges blamed him for the crime and gave a death sentence to Japan's privately owned prison...Deadman Wonderland.
Deadman Wonderland was a half prison half amusement park and the prisoners were the attractions. To top that off all of the death row prisoners had to wear a security collar which every three days injected them with poison. The only way they could survive is if they would eat a candy shaped antidote. Ganta was now furious and wanted to get revenge on the Red Man.
Later on Ganta gets a power called Branch of sin and he can now manipulate his blood and use it at his advantage. Though he does see the Red Man he never got a chance to defeat him.

landed on Earth along with her half sister, 
, and her guardian, Gema. They all find work at an Anime Gamers store in Japan. The manager there lets the three travelers live above the store in exchange for working there.
Later, when 
 was out shopping, a red-haired girl named 
 knocked her down. 
 didn't belive that 
 wasn't her rival, so she blasted 
 with eye beams.
Eventually she also meets the reason she was sent to Earth, The Black Gema Gema Gang....

This is not Japanese Animation! I have, however, decided to include it on this site anyway. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
 is based on the videogame 
, but actually takes place before the game, showing us all the horrible events leading up to Isaac Clarke's battle against the monstrous alien creatures called Necromorphs aboard the spaceship USG Ishimura. We start out following a small survey team on the surface of a dead planet where they soon come across a giant alien artifact. Some believe it may hold the key to God, but it's never explained exactly why anyone believes this... and in fact would seem to be just the opposite, as it seems many of the colonists living in the mining facility begin to go insane and kill themselves or others.
The captain of a spaceship called the USG Ishimura is ordered to retrieve the artifact, and thus hauls the thing up from its planetary resting spot. Not a good decision if you ask me considering what it seems to have been doing to the colonists. But the captain has his orders, and so it is brought on board. And from that point on, all hell breaks loose. The colonists are soon all slaughtered by some mysterious force, while onboard the ship people seem to be migrating to the artifact, risking even violence just for a chance to look upon it.
Strange things are definitely afoot, but we haven't even gotten to the real action yet! Someway, somehow, the nasty alien creatures find their way on board the ship, and now it's up to Alissa Vincent, Chief Security Officer, and her team to track down and exterminate this pest problem before everyone on the ship ends up like the people on the planet. Easier said than done!
This movie is all about gore and atmosphere, which it does well. There is very little story here, and even less character development. There are many hints at a larger story, but no follow through. I have not played the game yet, so perhaps it is expanded there. And actually, this movie feels like it could easily be made into a videogame. I wouldn't be surprised to see this prequel made into something playable... eventually. When that happens, I wonder if they'll make a prequel to this prequel?
Check out the official website for images, news, and more: 
An ancient religious artifact has been recovered by a deep-space mining ship, and for the crew of the USG Ishimura, life just became a living hell. Unearthed on a far-away planet during a mining operation, the relic is worshiped by some, even seen as proof of God. But when it’s removed from its resting place and brought on the ship, the artifact unleashes a long-dormant alien race, one bent on ripping apart -- and taking over -- every human aboard. Their screams CAN be heard in space … but only the slashers are listening.

A young boy by the name of Ryo Utsugi finds out that he's 
. Soon enough, he starts going through some changes....
He's being followed by a crazy satanist, who says he's not Ryo Utsugi, but Ryo won't accept that. He keeps telling himself he's not. Other than that, this anime is very good,

The skies of Tokyo have been taken over by a bizarre phenomenon known as "Hell's Gate." An unknown and abnormal territory, Hell's Gate has given birth to individuals with Special psychic abilities, however these people also lack conscience and human emotion, and brutally murder people in cold blood. They've become known as "Contractors."
As a response, many governments have attempted to use Contractors in order to discover the secrets of Hell's Gate. 
 is just one of these Contractors. With the Code name BK201 and the feared title as "The Black God of Death," he battles other Contractors in his path along with partner 
. However, his past will soon come to haunt him, and maybe even bring some humanity to 
 as well.

description: , the childlike queen of the undead, hoped that by paying the national debt of Japan, she could establish a new homeland for the same race of the coast of it, where they and other vampires can live openly alongside humankind. What she and her werewolf protector Akira didn't count on were the hysterical prejudices of humans, other vampires and werewolves trying to stop them. Will they be able to survive this miscalculation?

Okay, here's what's going on:
Two malcontents, Pandy and Retro, wake up one day, naked and with no memories of their past. Being they have nothing to do at the moment (and having no clothes and very hungry at the time), the two go on a violent criminal rampage... for about five minutes before they are caught, tried, and sentenced for life to the D.L prison facility on the Moon (which was devestated by an unknown accident eight years before).
It turns out that the prison is actually a genetic engineering facility which manufactures biological weapons from the prisoners there. Now Pandy and Retro have to get out... before they end up as part of the experiments themselves!

To this day, whenever we hear the word "De:vadasy", the words "Evangelion rip-off" immediately come to mind (to those who have seen the show anyway). Despite that "curse", 
 is definitely a mystery that keeps you trying to figure out what it is, even after you finish the whole thing.
In the year 2012, an unknown force is invading Earth (Angels, anyone?). And so young school-hating pervert Kei Anno (not as depressing as Shinji Ikari) is chosen, along with always serious looking girl Amala Minakushi (Rei Ayanami, anyone?), to save the world using the mecha known as De:vadasy which gives new meaning to the word stimulation (it runs on sexual energy).

It is the end of the second World War and the Japanese have invaded Berlin. There is a group of women who have developed a world of hatred between the two countries of Germany and Japan. So they end in a never-ending civil war.

It started out innocently enough; Shinji Yagami was given the address to an Internet site his friend Satoshi Kojima said was a gaming site. However, when he accessed it, it turned out to be a site which exhibited girls from his school who had been raped. Before he knew it, he had been dragged into the dark side of his soul when he starts degrading and humiliating the girls at his school as well.
Later on, Shinji finds out that it was Satoshi that had begun the site in the first place. Soon the two not only start raping other girls, but female teachers as well. It soon began to dawn on Shinji that he might be losing his grasp on sanity, because it has become obvious that Satoshi has already lost his.
Will he be able to stop before his childhood friend Miku Eno becomes a victim herself?

Nope, your eyes aren't deceiving you. There IS an anime version of the Powerpuff Girls. In this anime-style re-imagining of the series, instead of Townsville, Z takes place in Tokyo City. When 
 and his son accidently create the substance Chemical Z (created when a Rice Cake falls into a vat of Chemical X), his son shoots it as a beam when a giant glacier threatens the city.

Shooting out into different white and black beams of light, it hits three regular girls, 
,
