description:
Several years ago, Junna Tohno's parents were killed in a car accident leaving him no memories of the time before the accident. Since then, Junna has been living with his twin sister, Senna, in the huge house their parents left them.

Currently, Junna and Senna both go to Ouhama Private High School and have been living a normal simplistic life while coping with their variety of friends (including helpful but clumsy Sana Fujie, efficient book-smart Akino Iida, and mysterious anti-social Tomo Kishida). This simplicity is broken upon the arrival of Haruhi Inohara, Junna's childhood friend who has come to claim him as her older brother, despite Senna's wishes.
Haruhi instantly tries to stay by Junna all the time and help him remember what he's forgotten, but Senna desperately wants Junna to continue forgetting. As the story unravels, Junna must remember everything that he's forgotten, including the wish he made long ago, in order to save the world from total destruction.

Sky Blue takes place in the future, where the sky has been constantly covered with blanket of billowy clouds for a hundred years, and being able to catch a glimpse of the sun's rays only happens about as often as a blue moon. The atmosphere is toxic, covering the whole planet save for one specially built living-city called Ecoban. It was designed by those who saw the coming of the disaster which turned the Earth into this wasteland.
After the catastrophe, many came to Ecoban seeking it's safety. But they were all denied entry, forced to live outside the city and mine carbon compounds for Ecoban's Delos System, which transforms it into useable energy. Thus, these "diggers", as they're called, are imperative to the survival of Ecoban. Too bad they haven't been meeting their quotas.
Enter Shua, a young man that as a child lived inside Ecoban, but though an unfortunate circumstance ended up on the outside... permanently. At least until today, that is. Because today Shua is breaking back into Ecoban, although not because he wants to reside there once again, but because he needs to steal some information that could release all of the city's energy and thus put every human on an even playing field.
Once inside, he accomplishes his task, but is discovered he can make his escape. He struggles to evade all the troopers sent in pursuit, and almost manages it, were it not for Jay, one lone female trooper... who happens to be his child friend from when he lived within the city. She thought he was dead. Everyone thought he was dead. And now... Shua escapes and leaves Jay to start thinking. Question is, what is she going to do now? Quite an opening sequence!
Note: This animated feature is actually a Korean production, not a Japanese production. However, I still think it falls into the anime category.

In this fifth installment of the Zoids series, Genesis takes place in a post-apocalyptic period on Planet Zi. Much of humanity is rebuilding and recovering from the Great Flood, a series of cataclysmic ecological/geological disasters that have devastated the planet. Much of Zi's inhabitants have become reliant on giant structures known as Generators to help preserve civilization. Out of the ashes of this disasters, the Zoids still exist and are excavated for use of the people.
The story focuses on a boy named Ruuji, who lives in the seaside village of Mirodo. He discovers the Murasame Liger after it's excavated and eventually becomes the Zoids pilot. However, his village is attacked by a mysterious enemy, and their target is the Generators. He will soon gain many allies and fight against the corrupt army of the Digald.

Touka Kamiazuma is the protector of the magical land of Kamitsumihara. He is also the wielder of the Stone Sword, which has the power to absorb souls. However, his life is more complex that it appears, and in time, he become a witness of many victories – and tragedies.
The most unusual feature of this series is, instead of starting from the beginning, it starts at the end and progresses to the beginning. It is also a sequel to the hentai series "Moonlight Lady", although it is not a hentai series. There is also the appearance of characters from "Yami to Bōshi to Hon no Tabibito".

Loosely adapted from the American comic book series, Witchblade takes a step in the world of anime with this new series. In this new version, 
 is a woman who lost her memory during a catastrophic earthquake that devastated Tokyo. She was found holding a baby in the middle of Ground Zero.
Six years pass, while living a life on the run with her daughter Rihoko, she discovers that she has inherited the powers of the Witchblade, a powerful ancient weapon passed down only to women throught history. From then on, she gets caught in the middle of a struggle between Doji Industries (who keeps watch over 
 and her abilities as Witchblade) and the NSWF, a government faction that wants to take 
's daughter. They also seek to exploit and copy the abilities of the Witchblade for themselves with their own project known as the "Cloneblades."
However, in all of this 
 wants nothing more than to care for her daughter in peace. Though in her battles as the latest bearer of the Witchblade, she fights for her sake only. As she struggles to build a life for her, she finds many obstacles and difficult decisions in the process....

title: The Tower of Druaga: The Sword of Uruk

description:
In this second season of the 
 anime, half a year has passed since the 
 and its evil God was cleaned out by Jil and his companions. As Jil and Fantana live out the rest of their lives, circumstances bring them back to the Tower once again when they rescue a mysterious little girl named Kai. She shows them a terrible vision of the future, sending him and his friends on yet another journey to the Tower. They learn that a mysterious artifact on top of the Tower will help prevent Kai's prediction from coming true. They soon discover that they aren't the only ones after it. And plenty of other factions are after the artifact for mysterious reasons.

creator: Bandai/Namco Games
title: Druaga no Tō ~The Sword of URUK~

description:
Notice: 
 is not Japanese animation! It is a cartoon created and produced in Italy. However, because it has a style that is strongly influenced by anime, I have decided to include it on this site. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
Winx Club is about five fairies Tecna, 
, 
, 
, and 
 who go to school at Alfea. They have to deal with normal things like school, boys, friends oh yeah and keeping the realm of magix safe from the witches. 
 possesses the ancient and most powerful of all magic, the Dragonfire. When the three witches Icy, Darcy, and Stormy steal it from her, they call up the army of decay, an immensely powerful army of all dead things from the past 10,000 years.

dreams of another realm of magical beings. But that all became a realty when she meet a real fairy named 
. 
 found her magic powers and is now going to a school in the land called Magix.
The school I'm talking about is called Alfea for fairies. There are two other magic schools which house two other magic types. One of them is called Red Fountain which houses hero's in training. The other is Cloud Tower which houses witches.
 meets the other fairy friends, 
, Tecna, and 
.

A bunch of teenage girls have fairy powers and they battle the evil witches Icy, Darcy, and Stormy. 
 has the Dragonfire and the witches are after it to become more powerful.
Eventually, 
 beats the witches and they get sent to a good boot camp where they're supposed to become good. Lord Darkar, an evil guy who got swallowed up by the Shadowfire, breaks them out and gives them gloomix. It's power jewelry that makes them more powerful.
Now the witches have a better chance of ruling the universe, while destroying the fairies and the tiny pixies.

To some, this anime series might seem a bit confusing. Sadly, I was one of those people. But I'll try to lay it out as best I can. First off, this series takes place in the future. Japan is working together with the USA and China, though I'm not sure exactly what for... something to do with weapons I think. Anyway, a group of teenage kids are a bit peeved by this, and decide kick up a bit of trouble. Unfortunately, one of these kids, Asap Suzuki, takes things a bit too far when he actually fires a rocket!
Now wanted by the US military, Asap, who we learn is the son of a big-wig Japanese military officer, flees for his freedom... and winds up in the ocean as the waters suddenly and drastically rise. A giant light then causes one of the giant battleships to begin floating in midair. Asap was able to grab hold before it left the water, but now he finds himself on a flying battleship, and face to face with a beautiful girl who says she is the princess of a world called Byston Well.
The girl's name is Lyukus, and her boots have little wings that can pop out, allowing her to fly. She then says "My father is Japanese, Shinjiro Sakomizu. Please help me, Asap Suzuki", to which Asap replies "I'm the Magical Man from Happy-Land, in a gumdrop house on Lollipop Lane!"... okay, so that last quote came from The Simpons, but her quote is legit. Somehow this alien girl knows his name. Talk about weird. So then, US military aircraft start attacking the spaceship... oh yeah, did I mention the spaceship? Well, there's a spaceship. Or multiple spaceships. And then a portal appears which sucks everyone in, including the battlship and aircraft, taking them to new an alien world, where ships look like bugs. Now everyone is confused, including the audience.
So now that Asap and Lyukus are on Byston Well, they are joined by a fairy named Ferario, and everyone is ticked off that Lyukus took her boots to Earth. What? They want her to go barefoot? The boots, as I'm sure you can guess, are the Wings of Rean, and they are supposed to be used to control a kingdom or something. I don't know, I really didn't get this part (like I got the rest of it?), but at any rate, the boots are special somehow, and not just in the fact that they can make the wearer fly. Oh, and you know how Asap was kind of rebelling against his military dad? Well, Lyukus is rebelling against her father, who is the king, because he became a bad guy or something. I'm not too sure about that either.
Each DVD includes an little booklet insert which provides some insight into the series, which is actually a very nice touch. Usually I don't give a crap out inserts, but these are worth checking out.

was a famous gunslinger, because of his rare ability to use the famous ARMS weapons, and a mysterious birthmark that matches both the symbol on ARMS weapons and the symbol of the ancient Evil Race.
After an ambush, 
 is shot, and then wakes up several years later, in the body of a 10-year-old boy, with no memories of how he got there. With the help of tall scientist Kiel Aronnax and the Popepi Pipepo Issac, he searches for clues about his past.
 and Kiel eventually meet up with Loretta, a card sorceress, Mirabelle, a Crimson Noble (a vampire-like race), and Jerusha, Issac's Popepi Pipepo ex-wife. These three thieves search for treasure, and while searching accidentally run into Sheyenne nearly every episode. Mirabelle and Loretta where the first to encounter Kiei while they were searching for treasure. Then, while finding the treasure (which so happens to be 
), they all meet up there before coming under fire. It wasn't until later that the foursome split off.

Wowser was the forerunner of 
 in the way that it was just senseless slapstick!
Wowser is a dog that gets picked by a cat called ratso catso (which voice sounds spookily similar to meowths old voice in Pokémon)! Here are a few episode descriptions to help describe the show:

The Professor build an ice cream freezer that frosts anything it comes into contact with. Ratso Catso begins playing with the machine and nearly turns the house into the glacier.

When Wowser hurts both his arms in a fall, he is unable to feed himself. The Professor comes to the rescue with an automated feeding machine. It works brillantly, until Ratso Catso takes control.

The professor invents a machine that lets you step into your dreams. Ratso Catso dreams he is a super-hero and Wowser decides to journey into a dream where dinosaurs still roam the earth.

A notorious art thief threatens to steal a golden mask from the egyptian exhibit at the museum, so The Professor wraps Wowser up like a mummy so that he may guard it. The robbery is foiled, but the thief is manages to escape when Ratso Catso attempts to lend a hand.

In another adaptation of a Marvel Comics series by Japan's Madhouse Studios, loner mutant Logan, a.k.a. Wolverine, has after a year found-out the location of his girlfriend Mariko Yashada – and her circumstances are not good! It seems that Mariko has been bound-over for marriage by her yakuza father to another crimelord – Hideki Kurohage, who also happens to be a chief customer of the nefarious A.I.M. organization! In a chase that takes him, along with a mysterious woman named Yukio, from Japan to the corrupt island city of Madripoor, where he has to put his savage fighting skills, mutant senses and adamantium-plated claws to the ultimate fighting test, Wolverine must find some way to save Mariko from a fate worse than death!

creator: Herb Trimpe, Lee Wein, John Romita, Sr.
, Kengo Kaji
title: Uruvarin

description:
Whisper of the Heart follows the adventures of a Junior High School student named Shizuku Tsukishima. She loves to read and write, but her parents pressure her to put more focus on her studies and High School entrance exams.
One day during a subway ride, she spots a mysterious cat. Following it, she ends up at a Curiosity Shop, which is owned by a kindly old man. She checks out the books at the store, and strangely every book she opens reads the name "Seiji Amasawa." As it turns out, the identity of this person is only the beginning of her forthcoming destiny.

Detectives Takeshi Kusumi and Shinichiro Hata are investigating a mysterious rash of accidents involving Labors around Tokyo Bay. To their horror, all of the labor pilots are found murdered and horribly mutated as well. The case leads to a mutated creature roaming and terrorizing Tokyo Bay, which also links to a secret biological project known as the Wasted Thirteen (WXIII).
However, Wasted Thirteen is linked to a government conspiracy and cover-up that reaches the deepest levels. The mysterious history of Wasted Thirteen also involves the tragic past of Hata and his girlfriend Saeko. Both detectives seek the help of Captain Goto and the Patlabor Special Vehicle Division 2, teaming up to help take down the WXIII creature. However, victory will come at a painful and costly price.

This is not Japanese Animation! I have, however, decided to include it on this site anyway. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
For about 10,000 years, two races, the Kherubim and the Daemonites, had waged a secret war for dominance. But now events are converging to the point of open warfare! Jacob Marlow, a dwarven industrialist who recognized the problem and has aided the Kherubim, has organized a Cover Action Team (known as the WildC.A.T.s) to combat the problem. The team is composed of Kherubim-human hybrids, as well as a Kherubim known as Zealot, in order to fight the Daemonites.
A word of note: WildC.A.T.s was originally an American comic created by Jim Lee and Brandon Choi. In that comic, Jacob Marlow was portrayed as Lord Emp, a pure-blooded Kherubim.

"Three hundred and twenty years have passed since the coven sank in the dark." Witches...to this day they roam the world, though none may know it, not even those whose blood still carries the potential. Most of those with the "Witch Gene" are latent, but every so often, there is one who awakens to his or her powers.
When that happens, an organization called Solomon (more commonly known by the letters STN, which stand for "Solomon Toukatsu Nin'idantai"- roughly translated to "Solomon Control Center") steps in to bring the powers of this witch back under control before the population is threatened.
 is the story of Solomon's Japanese bureau, STN-J. They carry the front line of the fight against witches as changes in Japanese society has caused an alarming rise in the number of witch awakenings, and the recent loss of one of their number has them shaken. Into the STN-J enters a new Witch Hunter named 
. 
 is a witch herself, a Craft-User gifted with the well-honed ability to create fire.
With witches awakening in ever-increasing numbers, STN-J will need to rely on every member and every advantage it can exploit to prevent the witches from growing beyond their control.

is a girl who was born in Japan and raised in Italy. Six moths ago, the STN-J lost one of their workers. That's when 
 came in. She was summoned to the STN-J to help out with Witch hunting. She is also a craft user, so no one really trusts her. She can minipulate and create fire, but her vision blurs everytime she uses her powers, so she has to wear glasses to compensate. Now Sakaki, 
, 
, Dojima, and 
 must work as a team to help get rid of Witches.

This is not Japanese Animation! I have, however, decided to include it on this site anyway. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
W.I.T.C.H. is based on a comic published by Disney's European publishing division.
W.I.T.C.H is the story of 5 girls chosen to become guardians of the veil, a magical border that separates Metamoor from the rest of the known worlds. Will, Irma, Taranee, 
, and 
 are the five young girls who discover that have been given elemental powers which they must use as Guardians of the Veil. Hay Lin is 13 years old with the star sign Gemini, Taranee Cook is also 13 and has the star sign Aries, Irma Lair is 12 years old with the star sign Pieces, and Will Vandom is 14 years old and a Capricorn.
Each of them is granted power over one element, 
 has Earth, Taranee has Fire, Irma has Water, and 
 has Air. Will is the only one that does not control one of the four elements, as she is the heart, or neutral, that unites the other four. Although not guardians, Cedric and Eylon are occasionally mentioned as the dark and the light.
They oppose the despotic Prince Phobos who rules the land of Meridian with an iron fist.

is not japanese animation! It is a cartoon produced in the US. However, because it has a style that is somewhat influenced by anime, I have decided to include it on this site. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand a non-anime series being on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you never saw this page.
Xiaolin Showdown is a mystical series about four kids, 
, 
, 
, and 
, who need to collect all the Sheng Gong Wu to stop Wuya and 
 from ruling the world!
Our team needs to travel around the world for their mission because 1500 years ago Grand Master Dashi hid the Wu all over the Earth so they would not fall into the hands of evil.

related.name: Captain Harlock and the Queen of a Thousand Years

description:
This is the story of the fall and rise of probably Leiji Matsumoto's most famous character: 
. Once proud commander of the Deathshadow, he was defeated by the Ilumidus Empire, a force that would later occupy the Earth. Driven underground, 
 finds the Voice of Free Arcadia, and he finds new friends, friends which will shape and affect his life from then on.
As well as detailing many of the events leading between his fall from grace and his new life as a pirate of justice, including his sole love interest, Arcadia of My Youth looks into 
's ancestry as well as pronounces a message of freedom: that one must stand up against tyranny, no matter what the cost.

Michiko, who is the weather report girl for the failing television station ATV, finds herself searching for a one-night replacement so that she may attend a wedding. After looking and looking through the employee files, she finally comes across a one Keiko Nakadai. Unlike the other beauties Michiko's so far rejected, Keiko Nakadai looks to be a very non-glamourous woman, almost nerdy in appearance. Once Michiko hits upon Keiko's file, she knows that she has found her replacement for the night, as she figures Keiko's the perfect woman to make herself look great by comparison. Unfortunately for Michiko, she doesn't have any clue as to what kind of mistake she is about to make!

When Keiko is delevered the news, we find her in a stall of the ATV television station women's restroom, masturbating with no restraint. At first she's annoyed at being interuppted, but as soon as she hears the good news, she immidiately strips off her clothes and tosses them over the stall door, into the shocked hands of the messenger. Then out she bolts, all the way down the hall and through the offices, running seemingly faster than a jet plane, and all while wearing only her underwear. But hey, she has to get ready! No time to waste!

As Keiko is about to go live on the air, Michiko waits anxiously with her little portable television to see how it's going to play out. She's shocked when the person whom she spies on the air looks nothing like the brains-over-beauty picture in Keiko's file, but she's even more dumbfounded when, at the end of the report, Keiko purposfully lifts her skirt to give every wide-eyed viewer a nice solid view at her panties! Of course, it's hard to say who was more surprised, Michiko or all the viewers. One things for sure, the executives at the station sure aren't happy! Too bad the chairmain liked it, as he just bumped up Keiko's to take over Michiko's position permanently!

Keiko's plan works like a charm! The ratings skyrocket, and Keiko not only becomes the new weather report girl, but the star of the once failing TV station, leaving Michiko completely devastated! Ah, but Michiko isn't going to take this lying down... she has a plan to force Keiko off the air. I won't tell you what the plan is, just that it backfires, causing poor Yamagishi more than a bit of discomfort, and a lot of embarassment. Who is Yamagishi? He's a guy who just got hired on to help out, but his relationship with Keiko actually go back to high school. I shouldn't say anymore than that... best you just watch for yourself.

So after Keiko gets revenge on Michiko, she forces Michiko to become what she calls her personal "assistant", though the term slave or servant would be more appropritate. It's either that or get fired, and Michiko can't afford to start her career all over again. Thus, she contacts Samejima, a reporter she met at the wedding, for some help with her situation. This reporter has made some associates... the kind of associates that will do bad things to someone for the right price. Too bad Keiko is a martial arts expert! She escapes unscathed, though her clothes had seen better days. Oh yeah, and after all this, we're still not even to the second episode yet!

title: Touhou Anime Project
Musou Kakyou: A Summer Day's Dream

description:
The Touhou Anime Project is an anime created by Studio Maikaze that is based on the Touhou Project series of Doujin games produced by Twilight Frontier and Team Shanghai Alice. The Touhou series is popular with fans for its large cast of characters (including anime girls) and various styles of music.
The story begins with a mysterious figure walking up to the Hakurei Shrine with its shadow closing in on some kind of box, which turns out to be Reimu Hakurei's donation box...
The next day, after Reimu Hakurei, the shrine maiden, and guardian of the border of the fantasy land of Gensokyo sends her acquaintance, an oni named Suika Ibuki, out to run an errand for her, she immediately notices that her donation box is missing!
Realizing that her donation box may have been stolen, Reimu reluctantly turns to the photographer Tengu Aya Shameimaru, who brings the sorceress Marisa Kirisame, a friend of Reimu's, with her, and goes to the Scarlet Devil Mansion, suspecting Patchouli Knowledge, the keeper of its library, the Voile Library, of being her donation box's theft. However, Patchouli doesn't actually seem to be the culprit, as she has been looking for her missing books all that time. And that's not all; a supply of tea and food supplies kept by Remilia Scarlet's head maid, Sakuya Izayoi, also went missing as well. Once Reimu realizes that, she decides that the problem is just another incident in Gensokyo.
What's going on behind the disappearance of Reimu's donation box, Patchouli's books, and Sakuya's tea and food supplies? Who or what and where is the real culprit behind that problem?

title: Touhou Anime Project
Musou Kakyou: A Summer Day's Dream

description:
It's been 4000 years since mankind left the Earth to venture out into space. However, humanity faces a new challenge called the Gnosis, an alien species that is threatening the colonists. In the midst of this crisis, a new battle droid was created to combat the threat of the Gnosis... its name is 
, and is a female android with amazing battle capabilities.
When a ship comes under attack, 
 is activated and manages to rescue her creator 
. However, 
 defies 
's orders to fulfill her own mysterious agenda. The situation gets more and more complicated when 
's ship is destroyed and she is forced to defend herself not only against the Gnosis, but the U-TIC Organization as well.
What is 
' true purpose, and will 
 and the rest of humanity survive the Gnosis onslaught?
This anime is based on the first game of the Xenosaga series, "Der Wille zur Macht" (The Will for Power).

In the anime, there are two parties with different objectives. One is the Dragons of Heaven, bent on protecting the people of Earth from destruction, and the other is the Dragons of Earth, bent on protecting the Earth. Each party consists of six members and a see-er. However, the destined one, 
, has a choice to make, as he can only choose one side to be on.
Though he is cold and uncaring at first, deep down inside him the reason he came back was to protect the two people he cherished and loved most, Fuuma and Kotori. However, destiny is ever cruel, and Fuuma is the companion star of 
 to balance the scale. Being consumed by the evil of the Earth Dragon, his first is to kill his own sister, Kotori, and retrieve one of the Holy Swords. The final battle ensues as 
 battles Fuuma for the destiny of Earth.

All the characters basically receive their own calling, dependant upon their circumstances, and are sent to gather in Tokyo. 
 enters a temple in which a sword is held... but he's told he has to fight a guy to get the sword back, in order to make sure he can wield it properly. And with as much, 
 lashes out. Ironically, the priest with the sword turns out to be the father of Fuuma and Kotori, but that's a whole other story.
Kotori had a strange dream... though it's obviously not the first. She dreamt that 
 returned from his long time away (they had been childhood friends). The next day, things went down exactly like in the dream, only instead of his warm smile she had dreamed of, he had this horrible coldness to him. This is because he was attacked by some people created from a charm while on his way to school (his first day of school back in Tokyo after all those years). He easily got through it, but he wasn't in a good mood.
So when Kotori spotted him, she chased him down, and spoke with him... "It's been a long time..." kind of thing. But he tells her not to talk to him, that he is not the same person he was all that time ago. As she leaves, he finally yells out, knowing he was spied on. Attacking the invisible foe, it turns out that the Dragon of Heaven's Dreamgazer princess had sent a charm to look at his face, because she was blind and had to know if it was the boy from the dream.

Kotori remembers a time playing with 
 in times past... he saved her from falling from a tree even though he was frightened himself. He held her there all day, until he was even falling asleep. And from this came Fuuma's promise to 
 that he would always protect him.
While walking, Kotori finds some bullies trying to beat up on 
... and then watches 
 get out of the jam himself. Anyway, Saiki Daisuke later approaches 
, having observed him, not believing it was the real 
. A fight ensues, and while 
 wins, he does get a nasty wound. Fuuma spots him while playing basketball, and of course worries over him, for they WERE childhood friends.
, Daisuke, and the Dreamgazer Princess Hinoto speak on him being the real 
, and the princess asks 
 to look after him. 
 makes his way home, bleeding all the while. 
, a junior in high school, sits atop a roof, pondering the situation when 
 initiates a fight with him.
 casts Kekkai, or a barrier, in which the world encased in this barrier becomes an alternate dimension so the real area and people are not damaged. It is explained that the Kekkai will not lower until the caster is dead or badly injured, in which case the damage WILL be incurred to the real world. But the fight breaks off as Fuuma breaks through the barrier accidentally, just bicycling over towards 
's house to see if he was okay. 
 was standing outside the door, and Fuuma finally opened it... to see 
 collapsed on the floor.

Notice: 
 is not Japanese animation! It is a cartoon produced in France. However, because it has a style that is strongly influenced by anime, I have decided to include it on this site. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
Three girls named Clover, Sam, and Alex seem to be you average Beverly Hills High School girls... but that is just their cover up! The girls are really spies that work for W.O.O.H.P., which stands for World Organization of Human Protection.
With the help of their boss, Jerry, and his robot assistant G.L.A.D.I.S, they save the world from bad guys... and of course they still have to go to school!

Wandaba Style tells the story of an unsuccessful music group named "Mix Juice." They are comprised of four Idol singers, one unscrupulous manager named Hanagata, and one rather eccentric Boy genius known as 
, who uses money for the most bizarre uses of Space travel. (Mostly intending on the most eco-friendly uses of doing so.)
The Pop group is determined to make it to the top by any means necessary. However, Hanagata came up with an idea and uses them as an experiment to be the first Pop Group to sing on the moon. And so begins Mix Juice's twisted journey to become famous and literally reach the stars.
Will Mix Juice ever be able to make history with such a crazy endeavor?

Under the orders of Galactic Control, a space saucer lands on Earth. In that saucer (Patrol A3)- three superior beings from outer space named "THE AMAZING 3", who were sent to Earth to help achieve law and order. When they land on Earth, a huge vacuum cleaner attached to their ship sucks up 3 animals; a duck, a horse and a bunny. The Amazing 3 take over these bodies to be used as a disguise, to decide if the war-hungry Earth is a threat to the rest of the galaxy and should be destroyed or not.
The bunny was named Captain Bonnie. She was the leader of the group. She was the sensible one and had a cute voice, a big fluffy tail, and long pointy ears. The duck was named Lieutenant Zero and was the aggressive one always wanting to blow Earth up. The horse was named Corporal Ronnie and was always making contraptions such as an autopictograph where pictures were put into a machine and would come to life. Kenny Carter was a boy who knew the secret of The Amazing 3, and when in great danger called on his secret agent older brother, Randy Carter, to help. He worked for the Phoenix Bureau of Peace Enforcement. This organisation was the greatest crime-fighting agency in the world. His code name was P77.
The Amazing 3 regularly signed in and gave reports about earth to Galactic Control, and after 12 months the members of the Galactic League, representing all advanced planets of space, analysed the reports and voted to destroy Earth. It was Kenny Carter, however, who was taken to The Amazing 3's planet and who convinced them that earthlings love each other, so they delayed their decision to blow up Earth until Kenny was older.
Kenny and The Amazing 3 travelled around in a huge wheel.
The Amazing 3 was called "Wonder 3" in Japan. 52 episodes were made. It was created by Osamu Tezuka (
 and 
) through his own production company- Mushi Productions. It was released in Japan in 1965 and was shown on Melbourne TV in April 1969 at 4pm on channel 9.
Like 
, Amazing 3 was also produced by Gene Prinz and his staff at Copri International. Reuben Guberman went on to work with producer Salvatore Billiteri (
) writing the scripts as well as dubbing the occasional villain's voice on both 
 and Johnny Sokko's "Flying Robot". Corinne Orr was not the voice of "Bonnie Bunnie" (this was reconfirmed by Corinne herself) as stated in many Anime history books. The actors hired to do the dubbing were thought to be lost to history until 
 uncovered who they were. They were college students and local actors from Miami's little theatre.



Bobbie Byers (Capt. Bonnie Bunny)


Neil Patrick (Col. Ronnie Pony)


Paul Brown (Zero the Duck)


Kurt Nagel (Kenny Carter)


Jerry Burke (opening intro)
Amazing 3 has not been released on video, as the existing 16mm prints as well as the audio tracks has been lost or destroyed in the US, but there could still be some in the archives of television stations or collectors' homes around the world. There seems to be no record of where the 16mm prints were distributed (production info from 
).

In this surprising sequel to the classic anime Gunbuster, Gunbuster 2 tells the story of a clumsy young waitress named Nono, who dreams of leaving Mars in order to become a space pilot. Her life changes when she runs into a teenage robot pilot named Lark, who is a member of the elite psychic pilot team named "Topless."
However, when mysterious space monsters appear and attack Mars, Lark calls out the Buster Machine "Dix-Neuf" to take them down. Lark gets a big surprise when Nono uses her own super strength to help take down the aliens.
Afterwards, Nono joins Lark in hopes of finally realizing her dream of becoming a space pilot. But what exactly is Nono, and what type of power is she really hiding? And will it help turn the tide against this mysterious enemy?

is about 17 year old Ryuji Takasu. He doesn't have a lot of friends because of his "killer eyes" look. On the first day of school he bumps into 
, nicknamed "Palmtop-Tiger" because of her size and that she will pick a fight with anyone.
Ryuuji likes 
's best friend Minori, while 
 likes Ryuuji's friend Yuusaku. When 
 and Ryuji find out about each other's crush, which happens to be the other's best friends, they team up and try to help each other win the other's crush over. 
 views Ryuji as her dog or servant.
Later, a model named Ami transfers into their high school and instantly becomes popular. Ami falls in love with Ryuuji.
In the end, 
 and Ryuuji end up falling in love with each other and run away to get married. They meet up at Ryuuji's grand parents' house and don't get married.
The anime is really funny and full of drama.

This anime classic is about a girl named Karin Kokubu, a regular junior high school student going to Saint Ringo Junior High who one day stumbles across a yellow apple-loving little piglet lying unconscious behind a bush. After that she finds out that the piglet's name is Tonrariaano the Third, or Ton-chan for short.
He then gives her a pink object called a 'Dream Compact'. This 'Dream Compact' enables her to transform into super pig 'BUURIN'!. After transforming, she complains about how totally un-cute Buurin was and so Ton-chan made a deal with her that with every good deed that she does as Buurin some pearls would come out of a green shell, and once she collects 108 of those pearls she would be able to chose any form she desires to transform into.
While she is doing all these good deeds to fulfill her goal, she is also competing with a fellow classmate called Kouichi Mizuno's attention. With so much to do in such little time, this crazy anime is surely one of the best ever!

title: Tonde Buurin
Ai to Yūki no Piggu Gāru Tonde Būrin

description:
Nadja is an anime about the turn of the century (19th-20th) social life in Europe. It's the story of a young teenage girl named Nadja who lives in an orphanage in London and the only clue she has about her family is a mysterious locket...
Suddenly Nadja's orphanage burns down and two strange men try to steal her locket. And then the adventure begins. She is saved by a man who she calls "the knight of the bright eyes" and meets Francis, whom she believes is him.
Nadja joins the circus to fulfill her dream of being a dancer. So, she travels through Europe with the Dandelion Circus and learns a lot. She eventually finds out her mom is alive and goes in search of her, while learning more of the past, helping many people and making friends along the way... until she figures out that society expects little aristocrats to sit at home and host balls.
It's an anime about the new world "princesses", social changes, woman freedom, and lots of romance along the way, including Nadja's very hard choice- Francis or Keith?

This is a story about a girl named Nadja. She lived in an orphanage, but when the director of the orphanage tells Nadja her mother is alive, she goes to the Dandelion Company (which is a company who travels around the world), and goes to work with them so that can travel around the world with them searching her mother.

This is not Japanese Animation! I have, however, decided to include it on this site anyway. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
Total Drama Island is about teens that take on a series of challenges that will test out their physical and mental skills to win 100,000 dollars. The host of the show is Chris, a funny skater dude. He and Chef the cook are the only adults on the island. There is going to be lots of romance, comedy, and challenges for the whole family to enjoy... well, the whole ADULT family.

creator: Jennifer Pertsch, Tom McGillis, Olivia Stackhouse
title: Total Drama Island

description:
Touch is a great series! We see the twins, Tatsuya and Kazuya, that both fell in love with Minami. Kazuya plays very good baseball and he's a model at school. Tetsuya is a lazy young guy that doesn't like baseball.
But for the love of Minami, they both want to do anything. But when Kazuya died in a car accident, Tetsuya decides to be like his brother and tries to do all the things that his twin did. Even when he reached his goal, he couldn't be in love with Minami, because he thinks to much of his brother who had loved her. But Minami only has loved Tetsuya....

is your normal 13 year old girl, but when she goes on a "date" with her crush 
, something strange happens. 
 is accidentally fused with the DNA of a wildcat, becoming the first memeber of the "Mew Project".
Equipped with her new powers, 
 must now become a crime fighter, protecting the world from an invasion of evil aliens called 
. She must find her team members and keep her new identity secret while also working part-time in the secret cafe base!

My Neighbor Totoro is a story about two girls who move to the countryside with their father to be closer to their mother's hospital. As Satsuki and Mei explore their new house (which is haunted by soot sprites and frequented by the Totoros), they discover the world of the Totoros within the giant camphor tree in Tsukamori Forest.
Later on, Satsuki and Mei meet 
, a giant orange cat that is a bus - but only children can see him, just as children are the only ones who can see Totoros.
Mei and Satsuki get to play with the Totoros, but when the girls discover that their mother's recurring sickness has prevented her from visiting home on the weekend, 
 and 
 jump in to help them especially when Mei gets lost on her way to the hospital.
This movie will leave a smile on your face and will certainly cheer you up if you're feeling down. People of all ages will love the Totoros and their adventures for years to come.

Tokyo Godfathers takes place on Christmas Eve in the city of Tokyo, and tells the story of three homeless people. The middle-aged Gin, a former drag queen named Hana (who wishes to become a mother), and a High school runaway named Miyuki. Each of them carry a burdoned past.
On this very night, while searching the dumpsters for possible Christmas gifts, they find an abandoned baby. Believing its a gift from God, the three begin a quest to find the baby's mother. On a possbly hopeless quest, these three individuals are hoping to achieve a little Christmas miracle of their own.

This prequel to the movie 
 features the adventure of mystic 
 before his fatal battle with 
, although it does not include the circumstances of why they battled. These two episodes are set during the time when the two were still friends, and includes 
's somewhat loopy, but well-meaning twin sister 
.
In the first episode, 
 investigates the mysterious deaths surrounding a building complex, and discovers that someone is looking for revenge because of one of those deaths. In the second, 
 meets a mystic with "post-cognative" abilities after witnessing a murder on a subway. Soon, he discovers that she might be in danger from the murderer.

Intelligent, adaptable, always looking for a way to survive. That's a wolf: kind of human-like in its survival instincts. In the distant future, humanity had thought the wolves had disappeared forever some 200 years back. But instead, the wolves adapted, remade themselves, and survived...by taking on human form.
These modern wolves think and act like humans. And like humans, they have a dream: a paradise on Earth just for wolves. For them, the path to paradise lays in the scent of the Lunar Flower. For young 
, his search for the Lunar Flower and the way to Paradise will take him down a long and twisted journey, where he will meet a mysterious girl as well as come together with three other wolves to form a pack. Together, they hunt, they survive, and they seek the path to paradise.

Wolf's Rain has been one of the most highly anticipated shows since it is from the creators of the ever popular 
.
, a white wolf, is searching for paradise relentlessly. As in the "The Book of the Moon" Wolves are the only ones that can find such a place.
 rounds up three other wolves, 
, 
, and 
. Following his instinct, 
 leads them to find the Flower Maiden, 
. With her help they'll find this paradise.
Sounds easy? Well there's a catch. A lot of other people want 
 too. 
 wants 
 for scientific purposes, 
 wats her to heal his love from a curse, all those other nobles, and of course, 
 suspects the wolves. With a shotgun in hand 
 hunts down to kill the wolves. Not so easy now is it?
So 
, 
, 
, and 
 have to fight their way through all these obstacles and then some to find the legendary Paradise. Just like in the book of the moon...

Aliens from the planet Voice decide to invade Earth through corporate raiding. Fortunately for our world, the Special Duty Combat Team Shinesman is there to stop them! The team is composed of dedicated employee Hiroya Matsumoto as Shinesman Red, ladies' man Ryoichi Hayami as Shinesman Moss Green, car crazy Shogo Yamadera as Shinesman Grey, doting father Shotaro Ono as Shinesman Sepia, and tough as nails office lady Riko Hidaka as Shinesman Salmon Pink.
This two episode OVA is popular among anime fans due to its enjoyably funny English dub and its unique take on Power Ranger/Sentai style shows.

From the creator of 
 comes the supernatural thriller Tokko.
Ranmaru has just graduated from the top of his rank to become an Officer for The Special Mobile Investigation Troops First Division (or TOKKI) in order to avenge his parents death. However, he has been harboring dreams of a mysterious girl covered in blood and holding a sword, and to his surprise Ranmaru sees the girl in Police Uniform. He learns that she belongs to Section 2 of TOKKO. (Special Public Safety Task Force) However, the nature of their work is shrouded in mystery.
But the destiny of both of them will intertwine when a rash of mysterious and brutal murders arise. They soon learn that the causes are Paranormal, and are linked to hellish creatures involved with "The Box of Dirge."

In a highly technologically advanced city Tōma Kamijō is a student currently enrolled in an Academy set in Western Tokyo where students with magical powers are living. However, he is on the lowest ranks of physic powers, as a level 0 with his power Imagine Breaker (which can negate all magic, psychic, or divine powers with his right hand).
After Touma Kamijou gets in a fight with a level 5 esper Mikoto, his world is ultimately changed when the next morning he finds a young girl dressed as a nun hanging on his balcony railling. The white cloaked girl introduces herself as Index, a nun from Necessarius, a secret magic branch of the Church of England. Her mind has been implanted with the Librorum Prohibitorum—103,000 forbidden magical books the Church has removed from circulation, and she can remember it all as she possesses a photographic memory.
Now he must protect her from those who try to steal the secrets from the forbidden books-but, can a low rank esper like him handle it? What happens when two people known as 'sorcerers' appears in chase of her, or more specifically, her memory? Will the low level 0 rank be able to protect her?

To Love-Ru is a anime and manga that tells the story of 
, a normal 15 (16 after his birthday) year old student who goes to high school along with his longtime love Haruna Sarenji, though whom he cannot confess his feelings towards. Another girl, Lala, then appears, trying to escape from her home and father due to that she doesn't want to marry any of her chosen fiances. She ends up in 
's bathroom... naked. 
 freaks out, but then later on helps her escape and she then stays and lives with 
.
Lala stated that she loves 
 and wants to marry him, while 
 cannot do that due the fact that he is completely in love with Haruna. Haruna and Lala later become friends and 
 gets closer to Haruna thanks to that. Haruna shows similar affection for 
 and loves him back but she also cannot confess her feelings to 
 because of Lala.

The main character in this anime is 
. He is in love with Haruna Sarenji but he's too shy to confess to her and always fails. One day, while taking a bath, a naked girl popped out of his tube. That girl is Lala Satalin Deviluke. She comes from another planet. She then falls in love with 
, who doesn't answer to her feelings. With her, they start the adventure of their lives.

In the future, Tokyo is no longer the capitol of Japan, and many areas of the city had fallen on hard times... especially the Ginza District, which is now a slum area. The crime rate had risen dramatically, and the normal police had gotten so overwhelmed that many citizens now inlist private security firms to protect themselves.
One of these firms is the Tokio Private Police. However, since they are a private firm, they are often overwhelmed by budget cuts and manpower cutbacks, which can bring on stress. So many of the members often find some... interesting and delightful means to releave stress.
 had recently transfered from the notorious Ginza District to her new position as a top mecha pilot in Shinjuku. But she soon finds that her new teammates are a bunch of mecha freaks and sex maniacs. And the manager of the Shinjuku Division has an eye for 
 while having a girlfriend of his own. How will 
 handle all of this?

For over a decade now, the legendary anime Gunbuster has only been available to North America on VHS tapes... but that will all end on February 20, 2007 as finally this wonderful series makes the leap to DVD! And what better way to release this gem than to give the deluxe treatment, with a three DVD box set containing two episodes (and super-cute science lessons) per disc, newly translated English subtitles for each episode, and a 24-page color booklet containing episode summaries, character profiles and sketches, mech info and sketches, and the staff and cast credits.
Gunbuster is the first anime series I ever rented from a video store, so it will always hold a special place in my heart. Of course, it being a great mini-series also helps. It pretty much embodies exactly what people think, or at least used to think, when they heard the word anime: girls in tight clothes, giant robots, starships, aliens, and space battles. But Gunbuster also includes real emotional content. Friends change... they grow older, and some die... and it all matters. It isn't just brushed over as something that happens. It is dealt with.

Gunbuster, named for one of the giant mech robots in the series, tells the story of Noriko Takaya, a cute young woman who is desperately trying to follow in her father's giant footsteps. And what giant footsteps they were, as her father, Admiral Yuzo Takaya, was commander of Earth's first faster-than-light ship called the 
... and nearly his entire fleet perished during an alien attack. There were a few survivors... however, Noriko's father wasn't one of them.

So now Noriko is training to become a mech pilot, but she lacks even the most basic piloting skills that most of the other girls already have. Luckily for her, Koichiro Ohta, a coach at Okinawa Girls Space Pilot High School (and a survivor of the incident that claimed Admiral Takaya's life), takes her under his wing to personally train her... or is it lucky for her? Now all the other girls thinks she's getting special treatment... can nothing go right for this poor girl!

Well apparently Koichiro, AKA "coach", sees raw talent in her, and after a bit of one-on-one training, he is able to bring it out of her. Although still far from being the best student pilot in the school, she is nonetheless chosen as a pilot candidate for the Top Squadron, along with the extremely talented Kazumi Amano. Seems Noriko's dream is actually starting to come true, as the two of them head off for space, but knowing not of what awaits ahead.

It's not long before she meets new friends aboard the massive space battleship 
... and winds up fighting in her first real battle against the space monsters! I wish I could say she kicked some major space monster butt, however at this point just surviving would seem to be a major accomplishment for our inexperienced rookie. Unfortunately, simply surviving might not be enough. She's going to have to find a way to pull herself together if she's going to conquer the trials to come.

And battles aren't even the only thing to fear in space! Time is all relative, so when traveling at near light speeds, time progresses at a different rate than those standing still, so what is a quick 5 minutes at near light speed for Noriko and Kazumi ends up being months back at the Exelion, or years on Earth. How does one reconcile the fact that five minutes ago you were at the same level as the rest of your Top Squadron class, and now all of a sudden they're all ready to graduate? Or that your best friend from back in high school is now a middle age woman with a daughter?

Well, one thing's for sure... things are only going to get worse! Enormous alien fleets, extreme time distortion, and high-running emotions... Noriko and Kazumi are going to have to pull out all the stops and use the hopefully invincible giant robot Gunbuster to save the Earth, and humanity, from total annihilation! Thank goodness for those ultra-cutesy science lessons in between each episode to smooth out the intensity of the series. And unlike other shows, these shorts actually serve and informational purpose, explaining clearly about the science and physics of the series, as well as enlightening us on the largely unknown space monsters. Without these funny little snippets, following the series would have probably been a much more challenging task!

Gunbuster tells the story of Noriko Takaya, a girl training to become a robot pilot in the midst of a massive intergalactic war. She hopes to follow the footsteps of her famous father, Admiral Yuzo Takaya. She befriends fellow student Kazumi Amano and undergoes various trials and tribulations on her way to the top, and with help from Coach Ota and the rest of Noriko's friends she finally becomes the pilot of the insanely powerful robot known as Gunbuster.
The Earth and the entire Solar system has fallen under war from a mysterious and massive alien threat that places humanity in jeopardy. Noriko and Kazumi soon travel to space to prepare and combat the alien threat, however the horrors of the war and the consequences of space travel create unimaginable trials and tragedies for Noriko.
Will Noriko and Kazumi find the courage and confidence to combat the alien threat and protect their loved ones? And what consequences will come from the final battle?

Long ago, in the fuedal era of Japan, there was a fierce warrior named the Demon King. He had control of a band of demons, known as the Kyouma. Only the powers of ten warriors sealed the Demon King away and controlled the Kyouma.
But now a powerful Kyouma, named Lord Shindigan, is planning on freeing the Demon King, and the reincarnations of the ten warriors must band together and save the earth.

From the creator of 
 comes another aquatic post-apocalyptic tale called "Tide-Line Blue". In this story, the world has been ravaged and mankind is close to a watery grave due to an ecological catastrophe known as the "Hammer of Eden." As a result of this event, 90% of Earth's land has been flooded, resulting in the death of 6 billion people. A new government called the New United Nations was formed in order to restore order to this now chaotic world.
The story is about a young boy named Keel, who lives in a prosperous town powered by a nuclear generator. Aoi, one of Keel's relatives, is the Secretary General of the New United Nations. She views the catastrophe as an opportunity to finally unite the world in peace, free of any social conflict. However, a submarine captain named Gould and his rogue crew of the nuclear submarine Ulysses, wishes to unite the world by pure military force, and declares war on the New United Nations.

Two teenagers named Takeru and Ryo are struggling through an angst and rebellious period in their lives. However, all of this is disrupted one strange night when Takeru meets a strange girl that he dreamed about.
They are attacked by an alien creature, and things proceed to get stranger when Takeru transforms into a monster himself and defeats the alien beast. However, the girl (who they name Hikari) seems to have no past or memories.
They eventually start a new life for her while she learns the ways of the world. However, this is only a prelude leading to even more strange encounters and mysteries, eventually climaxing in a struggle that could jeopardize all life on Earth.

A group of cadets from the elite Cosmo academy are placed on a derelict ship called the Esperanza and told they have to find their way home. However, they are told that there are supposed to be 10 of them, but a head count reveals there are 11 beings on board the ship. Naturally, the cadets want to know who the imposter is.
Paranoia takes over as fears of sabotage grip the team. An early attack on the ship doesn't help, and neither does the discovery of a cache of weapons. They must stay aboard the ship for 53 days, the time it takes to orbit the planet they are near.
The ship also has numerous problems with it, which they must fix. One carries a deadly plague. Can they unmask the imposter, if there is one, before it's too late? Can they stop the plague before it kills everyone? Will secrets from Frol and Tada's pasts come back to haunt them?

title: The Third - The Girl with the Blue Eye

description:
The Third is an anime that takes place in a post-apocalyptic future where most of the Earth has been devastated by War, and 80% of humanity was wiped out. The world is now governed by a group of beings known as the Third. They are called that because of the Third eye in their heads, which can access any type of computer system. The world is also plagued by giant insects that attack anything in their path.
The story focuses on Honoka, a Jill of all Trades who travels with her intelligent tank named Bogie. In her travels, she is joined by an old man named Iks, who brings some unexpected trouble in her travels.

creator: Ryo Hoshino
title: The Third - Aoi Hitomi no Shoujo

description:
Futaba Kudo is 12 and optimistic, and dislikes the idea of being located by his family through his mobile phone. He has an over-protective family and gets mistaken for Kiara's "master". Kiara appears to be a clumsy girl who came from another world, insisting that Futaba called out to her.
According to the manga, Kiara is an "amarathine" which means many opponents await to kill her. The first opponent managed to reach Futaba's world tailing Kiara. Said opponent called Futaba a child and that he is not fit to be Kiara's master. Kiara told Futaba that she would protect him and requested for some incantation which Futaba has no idea of.
Strangely, Kiara sniffs Futaba's hand and realizes that she made a mistake. The two ran for their lives and somehow lost the opponent and hid under a bridge.
Futaba's mobile rang (his brother called) and startled Kiara since she has not seen anything of that sort. She borrows the mobile and opens the gate to her world. The opponent attacked Kiara, making entrance to the other world harder. Futaba grabs Kiara and they managed to go to the other world.
At the other world, Futaba gets up and notices a strange bunny-like creature meddling with his mobile, and it appears to be master BeruBeru, who states that SHE is a supreme wizard(??) having both reputation and power.
Noticing that Kiara is missing, Futaba then went on a little search for her. Beru then told him that she was actually at the same place that he fell.

In the land of Japan, there is a large town... Tokyo. Under Tokyo is a small civilization called the "Underground" where the "Elemental Users" live. They are a large group of people who can control various elements, such as fire, water, electricity, gravity, and wind. There is "The Company" (a group of thousands of Elemental User that use their powers for evil) who want to capture the Maiden of Light, Ruri Sarasa, and use her for their "plans." Ruri's bodyguard, Chelsea Rorec, is an Elemental User of gravity and a Company traitor.
Chelsea and Ruri were being chased by a Company member in the Underground. Chelsea uses her gravity power to make a hole above them for her and Ruri to escape to the surface.
Rumina Asagi and his best friend, Ginnosuke Isuzu, make their way to their first day of Senior High (high school), but soon Rumina pick a fight with an upper-classman, the bully of the school. Rumina, being the fighter he is, kicks the bully's butt, making the whole school afraid of him and his dreams of the perfect high school are shattered.
Rumina makes his way home with Ginnosuke. Ginnosuke hears a noise coming from Rumina's house and Rumina checks it out. Rumina discovers a wounded blond girl (Chelsea) and a light purple-haired girl (Ruri). Ruri begs Rumina to help her and they go out into the garden. The silence is soon disturbed by the Company member who controls fire. Chelsea, who is still not healed from using too much energy to escape from him once, is quickly trapped in a fire trap. Rumina comes forth to fight the Company member, but is killed in one strike of the member's "Fire Claws." Ruri uses her reviving power, which the Company wants, to bring Rumina back from the dead. Now with his newly found wind powers, Rumina along with Chelsea will protect Ruri from the Company. Who knows Rumina might also fall in love with Ruri...

Texhnolyze takes place in a man-made underground society, a group of banished descendent battle in order to gain control of the crumbling city of Lux. The story focuses on a fighter named Ichise, who loses an arm and a leg to a fight promoter.
Ichise is taken in by a doctor and is used as a guinea pig for Texhnolyze, which gives him a new mechanical arm and leg. He is eventually taken under the wing of an organization called Organ, who already has control over a majority of Lux.
As Ichise joins in the war for the city, he meets a young prophet named Ran, who shows him the future and guides him out of the dark side in order to find the truth about Lux and fulfill his true destiny.

Astroboy was called Tetsuwan Atom in Japan. The black and white series was created, animated and produced by Osamu Tezuka (1928-1989) through his own company named Mushi Productions. Tezuka, like his father, was a qualified doctor of medicine but was more interested in drawing. Astroboy was a successful comic strip in Japan in the 1950's. It was released in Japan between 1963 and 1966 and was shown on Melbourne TV in April 1966 at 5:30pm Sunday's on channel 0. The tv week described it as "Cartoon adventure series about a youngster in the 21st century." It was the first animated TV series to be produced in Japan, and after becoming a worldwide hit, Japanese cartoons began to flood the market with the release of other successful series' such as 
, 
 and 
. The large oval eyes became the standard for most other Japanese cartoons. A total of 193 episodes were produced, but only 104 of them were redubbed and shown on TV outside Japan.
The voice of 
 and 
 was Billie Lou Watt (who was female, not male as many people believe). She later went on to be Kimba and 
 from 
. The voice of 
 was Cliff Owen who also played 
 from 
 and Dan'l Baboon from 
. Gilbert Mack was the voice of 
 as well as Dick Strong from 
 and Pauley Cracker from 
.
Peter Fernandez wrote more than half of the English scripts and many others were written by the voice cast members. Peter was paid $100 to $125 per episode- the same fee that he was later paid by Fred Ladd for 
.
Fred Ladd directed the English version and wrote some of the scripts. Ladd said that "Astro Boy began with Mushi's #1, and generally stayed in Mushi's sequence, but we had to reject 6 of their shows, for various reasons: one dealt with vivisection (unacceptable here as kids' content at the time); one dealt with a bachelor who had pictures of nude women hanging on his walls; one (Christ's Eyeballs) dealt with a criminal hiding out in a church and scratching a secret message to his cohorts on the eyeballs of a statuette of Christ, (in Buddhist Japan, nobody at the studio objected)."
In 1982 a colored version was released and shown in Melbourne throughout the 1980's. In 1996 it was shown here on cable TV. Many of these episodes are available on video in Pal format through Siren Entertainment and are still enjoyed by young children today.
The series begins in the year 2000 with the death of Dr Boynton's (a robotics engineer) son Astor (Toby in the first remake) in a car accident (help with some character names from Dave Sternberg). He makes a robot in his son's image, but disappointed that he's not a real boy he disowns him, and he is sold to a robot circus and here is named 
. The ringmaster Cachatore (Hamegg in the new series) treats him cruelly, but he is later rescued by 
 (large nose and two puffs of hair on the sides of his head) who is against slavery of robots. Under his guidance, 
 embarks on adventures, fighting anything that threatens mankind. 
 can fly using jet rocket propulsion; has weapons including a lazer and machine gun, and has emotions. 
, like most of the other robots, lives by the robot law that orders robots to help mankind by doing what's good.
Other characters in the series included 
 who was a friend of 
's (renamed 
 in the colored series because of his long moustache), 
 (named 
 in the color series) made by 
 as 
 sister. 
 bigger brother was named Jetto. He was stored away in the warehouse of the Science Academy and was created by Dr. Boynton as a prototype of 
. One of 
's main enemies is 
 who was a boy robot but was rebuilt into a highly intelligent and powerful robot. 
 is sometimes a secret agent and in some episodes is also Judo Expert (as this fact is demonstrated in the Blackie Young episode). He retains the boastful loudmouth qualities of 
 but actually is portayed in the new series as a courageous individual as opposed to a cowardly braggard in the older Astroboy series.
The 
 character in the New Astroboy is a somewhat less of a scholar and actually more of a foolish "Absent Minded professor", rather than the learned man that we see heading up "The Institute of Science". (Info on 
 from Dave Sternberg)
Some of the episodes include "Funnel To The Future" where 
, 
 and 
 are sent 70,000 years into the future; "Mystery Of The Metal Men" where 
 is blown away into a parallel world, and "Gangor The Monster" where 46 wrestling robots join together to form a giant centipede. The lost episode, titled "The Beast from 20 Fathoms", was created in 1963, and only two copies were made. The Japanese version was destroyed as Osamu Tezuka was unhappy with it. The other copy was sent to America for dubbing and is the only version that exists today.
The following information is written by Mark Cannon from Canberra Australia who has picked up some interesting points after watching Astroboy episodes again after nearly 30 years.
Thanks Mark.

was made as a short anime to premote the the SNES game Chrono Trigger, it follows the adventures of the monster group Nuumamonjaa. With they're club being a bust, they explore the Millennial fair and end up in a bunch of trouble. In this anime the android Johnny from 2300 A.D. appears and he looks older than he is in the game.

This is a color remake of 
 that debuted in Japan in 1980.
Dr. Boynton (Tenma) created a robot after the loss of his son Toby (Tobio) in a horrible accident. Modeled to look and act just like him, he hoped to fill in the void that his son left behind. However, realizing that a robot could never replace his son, he discarded his invention by giving it to a circus in America. However, it is here that Astro is found by the kindly robot scientist Dr. Ochanomizu, and give a new name and identity.
From that day on, he was known as Astro Boy. A powerful robot fighting for the peace of both robots and humans alike!

Based on the classic Science Fiction manga by Keiko Takemiya, the story of "Toward the Terra" is retold in this new series. Taking place far in the future, humanity escapes an environmentally devastated planet in order to colonize in space. In these colonies, the lives of its citizens are controlled by Supercomputers. However, these advanced AI have given birth to a new race of psionics known as the "Mu." The Mu themselves become feared and hated by humans, and eventually become targeted for elimination. But their only wish is to return home to Terra....

creator: Ben Edlund, John August, Josh Whedon
title: Titan A.E.

description:
Notice: 
 is not Japanese Animation! It is a cartoon produced in the US. However, because it has a style that is reminiscent of anime, I have decided to include it on this site. If you're one of those hard-core anime purists who can't stand seeing a non-anime series on a site dedicated to Japanese Animation, then just press the Back button on your web browser and pretend like you were never here.
In the far future of 3028 A.D., Earth was attacked by an alien race made of pure energy known as the Drej. Threatened by the capabilities and ambitions of humanity, they staged a vicious attack that ultimately ended with the complete destruction of Earth. Left without a home, the last surviving pockets of humanity are left adrift throughout space, constantly looked down upon by ther other alien races.
Cale Tucker was one of the survivors of the Earth's destruction. However, he remains bitter towards his father, after disappearing while safeguarding a mysterious ship known as the Titan during the Drej's offensive against Earth. The only remnant lies with a ring given to him by his father.
Cale's life changes when he meets a man named Korso, who was connected to his father and the Titan Project. Cale teams up with Korso and his ragtag crew aboard the Valkyrie to go in search of the Titan and hopefully, a new home for the human race. However, the Drej will stop at nothing to make humanity a thing of the past....

is a mild yet enjoyable anime based on a dating simulation game. No robots or monsters or spaceships or alternate dimensions are to be found at the center of the story, as this series is all about relationships and everyday life. I know, saying it like that kinda makes it sound boring, but surprisingly it's not. Each character has something about them that makes you care and want to learn more.
In the first episode, we see that Akarai had been friends with Hiroyuki ever since they were both little kids. Now they are both starting a new semester at high school, and although they are still both good friends to each other, it seems like Akari might want to be more than friends with Hiroyuki. Of course, Hiroyuki is oblivious to this, and Akarai isn't the outgoing type who would just go up and confront him about it.
In the second episode, a popular Japanese rock band known as "Childish An Hour" comes to town. Hiroyuki and Akarai, and their friends Masashi and Shiho all express an interest in going... only problem is, there are no more tickets available. But then somehow Shiho manages to snag two tickets through a music store where his big sister used to work, and thus now has the dilemma of choosing who gets to go.
In the third episode, Hiroyuki unintentionally befriends a quiet mysterious girl named Serika Kurusugawa. Serika is a member of the school's Occult Club... or I should say the 
 member of the school's Occult Club. When she speaks, it is never more audible than a whisper, making it difficult-to-impossible for us to hear what she's saying. Thankfully, Hiroyuki repeats what she says before responding, so we don't have to be subjected to one-sided conversations whenever she's around.
In the fourth episode (and the final one on the first DVD), we are introduced to a new girl, Aoi. She is attempting to get people interested in her new extreme martial arts club, but everyone just seems to shrug her off. Somehow she is able to convince good ole Hiroyuki to try it out... I'm sure it didn't hurt that she was a cute girl. Then one day Akarai and Shiho decide to follow him and check out his practice, but they end up witnessing a confrontation between Aoi and her rival, Yoshie Sakashita, who is a member of the Karate Club.
The DVD contains a few extra features, such as character bios, translation notes (my favorite), line art gallery, trailers, and a reversible cover. It also has both English and Japanese dialog, and optional English subtitles. Oh, and Dolby Digital audio. All-in-all, not a bad release at all, especially for a series that I wasn't expecting to like.

, also referred to as 
, is about a high school boy named Hiroyuki Fujita, who is rather lucky at befriending girls. He has one male friend, named Masashi, but his other friends are a group of girls.
The anime is calm, laid-back, and easy to follow. Most of the episodes depict common things, such as everyday duties, seating arrangements in class, clean up duty, etc. It's short, nothing to reach out and grab you, and no real thrill, but it is nice to sit and watch.

It is their first day at the Toujou Academy, and new students Souichiro Nagi and 
 have one thing in common... to run the school together and basically be the top thugs there. However, the two of them run into the Jyuukenbu, the school's local martial arts group, which among it's members are the Natsume sisters, Naya and 
, and Masatake Takayanagi. In no time at all, Souichiro and 
 get the snot beat out of them.
However, these two troublemakers now have bigger problems ahead of them. Seems the student counsel has gotten wind of Souichiro and 
, and has sent it's "Enforcement Group" after them. It seems that the Group and the Jyuukenbu have a lot of personal difference between them, and these two punks have gotten their attention. So out of self-preservation, Souichiro and 
 have decided to join the Jyuukenbu, and in the process, accelerate their own skills.

In the future, mankind has been reduced to living underground, establishing villages beneath the surface. Contact between other villages or the surface is non-existent, and because of constant earthquakes, the villages has to expand deeper underground. This is a task left to special people known as "diggers".
 is a 14 year-old digger, an orphaned boy who is employed by the elders of his underground village. When he rescues another orphan named Kamina, he discovers a special key that gives him access to a robot that enables him to reach the surface – which just happens to be inhabited by mutants bent on wiping out all of humanity!
However, with the help of a busty sharpshooter from another village named 
 – not to mention stealing one of the mutants' battle machines, 
 not only stops them – but enables humanity to once again gain control of the surface. But no sooner than the humans establish themselves again that Team Dai-Gurren, 
's group, has to defend them against a new threat!
Note: 
 lost the license to Gurren Lagann when it dropped in from their inventory in mid 2007 (and added it again in late 2007), and awarded it to 
. Apparently 
 has released a new set that includes the dubs.

Gurren Lagann takes place in an alternate world, where its inhabitants are forced to live in underground, isolated civilizations, having no contact at all with the surface world or any other civilizations. Villages are forced to expand deeper underground due to the unstable geological activity. The ones assigned to this job are known as "Diggers."
The story begins in Jiha Village, which is home to a young boy named 
. He is a digger at the age of 14, due to the death of his parents in an earthquake. Having a strong reputation, he is invited to join an elite group called the Gurren Brigade. He also meets a man named Kamina who constantly dreams of what the world on the surface is like. But as 
 and Kamina team up, fate will take a different turn, and peace will shatter after the discovery of a giant robot in a forbidden territory.
They are soon brought into a fierce battle for the surface of the planet and the very fate of humanity itself. With the help of the excavated robot, the Gurren Brigade faces off against the Beastmen, a fierce army hellbent on the eradication of mankind.

description:
This is the anime classic that started it all.
All that 
 wanted to do was to find out what the monster in the forbidden cave near the family shrine was. Little that he would know that he would unleash a wild and beautiful space pirate who finds him very attractive. After that, a whole bevy of extraterrestrial girls show up to complicate his life.
Soon afterward, he would find out that his very destiny would be tied to these girls as he finds out that he has strange and wonderful powers - which is what he needs if he is to save the Earth.
 is an action/comedy based around 
, a high school student. The story originally spans along 13 very funny and lovable OVA and continued as a TV series and a movie. In the OVA, 
 accidentally releases the "demon" 
 from a cave near his grandfather's shrine in the mountain. After 
 realizes who 
 really is, (his ancestor was the one who locked her in the cave), she begins to play with or terrorize 
, depending on how you look at it; she's in love with him though.
Luckily, 
 isn't really a normal guy either -- if he can just figure out why he is not normal, that is. To make matters worse, 
 is being hunted by the crown princess of Jurai, 
. 
, 
's little sister, barges in and joins in the fun, along with Mihoshi (a Galaxy Police officer- 4th episode) and 
 aka The Greatest Scientist In the Universe aka 
's "mom" (6th episode OVA). Believe me, after this the story starts to get really funny and I just can't have enough of 
 and the gang.....AND his grandfather of course...heh.
The first OVA series contained 6 episodes, followed up by a 1 OVA special episode. The second and third OVA series each contained 6 episodes, and then 1 final OVA episode was released to tie up the cliffhanger.

When

Hold on tight! This is one ride that is sure to thrill!
Here is an episode that centers on the Masaki clan's bubbleheaded, but cherry space detective in her most famous case.
This story marks the only OVA appearence of

.

description:
The classic anime 
 (commonly known as 
 in the U.S.) was remade in 2004 at the helm of Yasuhiro Imagawa (
, 
). This new version of the classic story takes place 10 years after the final events of World War II. Japan is gradually crawling back from the ashes of the war, and life was once again returning to normal.
One of the many successes was lead by Professor Shikishima, who started the development of robotics. Just before Japan set off its economic growth in 1955, the ruins of a classified weapons laboratory of the Imperial Japanese Army was found, and with it a giant humanoid robot named Tetsujin, a weapon that was originally thought to be destroyed in the war.
Tetsujin was created by the now dead Professor Kaneda, and is finally resurrected after 28 attempts by Shikishima. However, after Tetsujin goes on an uncontrollable rampage, Shotato, boy detective and the son of Professor Kaneda, soon discovers he can control Tetsujin. He and Tetsujin join forces in order to fight evil!
Note: Apparently a movie will be coming soon!

 has escaped from his prison, completely destroying the Galaxy Police Headquarters in the process! Traveling back in time, his one target is the source of the Juraian bloodline... 
's mother. In the process, this causes the history of 
 and the girls to be nearly erased, until they are saved by 
. The only hope of stopping 
 and making things right again is to travel back in time and stop 
 from harming

 sends the gang back to 1970 on a mission to look after and protect

. Posing as the staff/students of her school, they learn and experience how

 (
